properties.descrption: This is the top wine from this estate. Wood aged and richly endowed with both fruit and firm tannins, it has a fine balance. The 12 months in wood have softened the wine's structure and given it extra richness. It is still full of youthful fruit, so drink from 2018.

properties.title: Château Bovila 2012 Les Quatre Eglises Malbec (Cahors)
properties.descrption: This is an opulent ripe wine, named after the four churches in the local village. Full of blackberry flavors that cushion the firm tannins, the wine is generous and finishes with youthful acidity. Structured and dense, the wine will still age well. Drink this fine wine from 2018.

properties.title: Cuda Ridge Wines 2014 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
properties.address: 2400 Arroyo Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.descrption: Although full-bodied and rich in texture, this wine is restrained in terms of ripeness and oak. It has good balance, a quiet blend of black cherry, clove and dark chocolate flavors and a firm, fine-grained tannins. Best after 2019.

properties.title: David Duband 2014  Côte de Nuits-Villages
properties.address: 12 Rue du Lavoir, 21220 Chevannes, France
properties.descrption: This ripe wine comes from organic vineyards in the village of Brochon, next to Gevrey-Chambertin. It shows plenty of structure, a tantalizing smoky character from wood aging and juicy red fruit character. This will be a delicious wine to drink from 2018.

properties.title: Dunham 2012 Lewis Vineyard Artist Series Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 150 E Boeing Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Fruit and barrel aromas intermingle, with notes of vanilla, coconut, wood spice, clove and red berries. The red fruit flavors are fresh and focused, with lightly grainy tannins providing the frame.

properties.title: Dunham 2013 Trutina Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot make up the majority of this blend (42% each), with Malbec, Petit Verdot and Syrah rounding it out. Aromas of toast, vanilla, cocoa, cherry and herb lead to sweet, elegant chocolate and cherry flavors, threaded with vanilla notes.

properties.title: EOS 2015 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 2300 Airport Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Black cherry, dark chocolate, coffee and mint touches show on the nose of this approachable bottling. The palate is solidly structured, pairing soy and licorice flavors with tangy black-plum and elderberry fruit.

properties.title: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Château de Haute-Serre Malbec (Cahors)
properties.address: Route de Toulouse CS20159 Cahors Cedex 9, 46003 Cahors, France
properties.descrption: Mint and smoky aromas give this wine an attractive, juicy character. It is developing well and almost ready to drink. From Cahor's high altitude vineyards, the wine is bright and fruity with damson flavors and smoothed with wood aging. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Château de Haute-Serre Malbec (Cahors)
properties.address: Route de Toulouse CS20159 Cahors Cedex 9, 46003 Cahors, France
properties.descrption: On some of the highest vineyards in Cahors, this estate has a history reaching back to the Middle Ages. This latest vintage from this major estate has a firm structure and cool texture. Allied to acidity and dark tannins, the rich black fruits are going to need time to mature. Drink from 2020.

properties.title: Giornata 2014 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Well-rounded and integrated strawberry, black plum and licorice aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend from Paso Robles' most exciting Italian variety producer. It's light and easy on the palate, with red plum, cranberry and chaparral herb flavors packed tightly with tannin. It's good now but will improve with age.

properties.title: Global Wines 2011 Encontro Baga (Bairrada)
properties.descrption: A bold, ripe, perfumed wine with Baga tannins and acidity, this is not a wine for easy drinking—demanding rich, oily or fatty foods instead. It's a great example of this notoriously fickle grape and is packed with spicy fruit. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Husch 2008 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.descrption: This is a wonderful Pinot Noir to drink now for its dry crispness, silky elegance, and pleasant cherry, currant, Dr. Pepper  and teriyaki beef flavors. Polished and supple, and easy to find, with nearly 38,000 cases produced.

properties.title: Leopoldo I di Toscana 2007 D'Aria Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Localita' La California, 48/B, 57020 Bibbona LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Simple and straightforward, this 50-40-10 blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot delivers black concentration and slightly sweet aromas of mature fruit and blackberry. The wine tastes smooth and rich, but also remains very approachable and friendly.

properties.title: Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Crianza  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: Clear and focused, with raspberry and edgy spice aromas to the nose. The palate doesn't bring a whole bunch of meat or heft, but it is clean, racy and food-friendly. Flavors of red berries and pepper are normal and expected, while the finish is dry and lean.

properties.title: Mocali 2007 Mirus  (Maremma)
properties.address: località Mocali, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: The blend is 50% Sangiovese with Merlot, Syrah and Alicante, and the final result is that of richness, plushness and all around berry intensity. The fade is soft, slightly sweet and driven by easy berry flavors. Would make a fabulous companion to pasta and meat roast type dishes.

properties.title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2008 Red (Alentejano)
properties.descrption: Big, chunky and ripe, with earthy aromas followed by soft, round texture. Spice and black berry fruit juice are supported by dry tannins. It is bold, a little rough around the edges.

properties.title: Antonino Tringali-Casanuova 2008 Patrimonio  (Bolgheri)
properties.descrption: This 60-40 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot opens with jammy aromas of cherry marmalade and blackberry preserves. The fruit tones are very intense but the spice nuances are integrated and folded within the natural density of the mouthfeel.

properties.title: Bodegas Olarra 2004 Añares Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.address: Avenida de Mendavia, 30, 26009 Logroño, La Rioja, Spain
properties.descrption: Dry and peppery to start, with muted berry fruit aromas along with wood shavings. The palate is snappy, clean and juicy, with raspberry, vanilla and tobacco-like flavors. More basic than special, with a steady, light-framed finish. More than functional; likely good with food.

properties.title: Calera 2007 Mt. Harlan Cuvée Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
properties.descrption: Shows the rich fruit, acidity and silky texture of Calera's spot on Mount Harlan, with cherry, cola and sweet sandalwood flavors. It's not as complex or concentrated as the single-vineyard bottlings, but is a good approximation.

properties.title: Château de Minière 2008 Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)
properties.descrption: Dry tannins dominate this rough-edged wine. There are plenty of bitter cherry and cocoa flavors, while the acidity gives an attractive freshness. Those tannins need a year to settle down.

properties.title: Château Fonplégade 2007 Fleur de Fonplégade  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: The second wine of Château Fonplégade is fresh and bright with good fruits, berry flavors and some richness. It has good poise; ready to drink in 2–3 years.

properties.title: Château Pey la Tour 2007  Bordeaux Supérieur
properties.descrption: Soft, ripe and juicy, this is an attractive wine, with red berry flavors and a light structure. Not for the long term. Drink now for its fruity character.

properties.title: Château Soussac 2006 Liberty du Château Soussac  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
properties.address: 1 Marot N, 33790 Soussac, France
properties.descrption: With some good, ripe fruit and a core of dry tannins, this wine benefits from wood aging and rich berry flavors. It is solid and chunky, with a fine edge of black currant acidity. It could well age for 2–3 years, but can be drunk now.

properties.title: Cupcake 2008 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
properties.descrption: A delicious Pinot Noir. Set it beside more expensive bottlings and it stands up well. Silky and rich, with raspberry and cherry purée, cola, sweet vanilla and sandalwood flavors, and a long, spicy finish. Production was 26,000 cases.

properties.title: EOS 2008 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: With its soft acidity, silky mouthfeel and very ripe raspberry, cherry, currant, mocha and pepper flavors that finish almost sweet, this is a classic Paso Robles Zinfandel. It's a little hot in alcohol, but not too much.

properties.title: Folie à Deux 2008 Merlot (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: A very good Merlot except for some sharpness. The wine is dry and finely tannic, with black and red cherry, mocha, dried herb and tobacco flavors.

properties.title: Headbanger 2007 Rock n Red Red (Sonoma County)
properties.address: 7302 E Helm Dr #1002, Scottsdale, AZ 85260, USA
properties.descrption: An upscale hamburger wine, fruity and spicy. There's a bacony, smoked meat note to the raspberries and cherries that will play well against the char of grilled beef.

properties.title: Le Grascete 2008 Antero Merlot (Toscana)
properties.descrption: Antero is a 100% expression of Merlot with green notes of eucalyptus, caper olive and herbs. There's a warm note of graham cracker as well and the wine ends with sweet, firm concentration.

properties.title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
properties.address: 9 Rte des Moulins, 41140 Saint-Romain-sur-Cher, France
properties.descrption: This is a juicy, fruit-forward selection, boasting vibrant notes of red cherry, raspberry and strawberry on the nose and mouth. A hint of vanilla adds a sweetness to the finish, which otherwise ends clean and mouthwatering. Drink now.

properties.title: Chacewater 2013 Highlander Red (Sierra Foothills)
properties.descrption: Lots of ripe berry and pomegranate notes give a fruity profile to this dry, medium-bodied, fresh and lightly tannic wine. It will be a good quaffing wine for lunch or dinner with mushroom pizza or grilled chicken.

properties.title: Château Carpe Diem 2013 Major Red (Côtes de Provence)
properties.descrption: The tannins are still intense in this dark, structured wine. It does have red fruits although there are also hints of green and stalky flavors that are less attractive. The wine will always be dry although the red fruits could push further forward. Try waiting until 2017.

properties.title: Chelsea Goldschmidt 2014 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 4791 Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: This is a fine wine, reflective of the vintage's generosity and approachable nature, giving off flavors of vanilla, cherry and currant alongside a sanguine, gamey character and smoky full-bodied ripeness.

properties.title: Deuce 2012 Reserve Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: The oak is far out in front, with the aromas of vanilla, dill and freshly hewn wood making it difficult to find the fruit. Cranberry flavors struggle to get to the surface. It's technically well made but the barrel treatment completely overrides any sense of the variety.

properties.title: Peter Zemmer 2012 Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)
properties.descrption: Here's an earthy red that opens with aromas suggesting smoke, tilled soil and leather. The solid, straightforward palate offers mature plum and a hint of almond alongside rather grainy, astringent tannins. Drink through 2017.

properties.title: Trig Point 2013 The Railyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 408 Appleola Rd, Hendersonville, NC 28792, USA
properties.descrption: Toffee, black cherry and orange combine around a softened, yet tightly woven layer of leather and bitter espresso bean in this full-bodied, robust Zinfandel with an approachable palate.

properties.title: Wagner 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
properties.descrption: There's plenty of ripe blackberry and cherry here, along with a heady dose of vanilla and spice, but also darker, earthier tones of forest floor and mulch that linger on the nose. The palate is fresh and crisp though, framed by fine, firm tannins and brisk acidity. It finishes with a tang.

properties.title: Hillinger 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
properties.address: Hill 1, 7093 Jois, Austria
properties.descrption: Juicy black cherry is the main theme here: it fills nose and palate. The body lacks a little focus but its fleshiness is cut by freshness that sets all the cherry fruit into scene.

properties.title: Kunde 2013 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
properties.descrption: This is a big-boned and soft wine with pleasing characteristics of blackberry, vanilla wafer and upfront baking spice. The tannins are well-managed and integrated, with a touch of sweet heat on the finish.

properties.title: Peter Zemmer 2013 Raut Lagrein (Alto Adige)
properties.address: Weinstraße, 24, 39040 Kurtinig an der Weinstraße, Autonome Provinz Bozen - Südtirol, Italy
properties.descrption: The nose isn't very expressive but it eventually releases whiffs of pressed violet and dark woodland berry. The shy palate offers dried black cherry and dark cooking spice alongside somewhat fleeting tannins.

properties.title: The Crater Rim 2014 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)
properties.descrption: Lightweight and fresh, with beet green overtones to the tart, pie-cherry aromas and flavors. It's refreshing and vital right now, so drink it before the delicate fruit fades.

properties.title: Matchbook 2012 Tinto Rey Red (Dunnigan Hills)
properties.descrption: Aromas like plums and flavors like prunes give a ripe character to this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has good balance due to firm tannins and light acidity, so it doesn't get tiring on the third or fourth sip.

properties.title: Pianetta 2012 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 829 13th St, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Red cherries and rose-petal extract waft into the plush nose on this bottling, which also discloses fresh acidity. The palate offers sour cherries, red bricks, chopped marjoram and cooked beef flavors.

properties.title: 14 Hands 2012 The Reserve Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.descrption: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this wine offers aromas of dried herbs, milk chocolate and raspberries. It's silky in feel with polished tannins and a spice-filled finish.

properties.title: Bedell 2012 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.descrption: Whiffs of cherry Coke and vanilla juxtapose fresh red raspberry perfume on the nose of this fruity, forward Merlot. Sour cherry and berry flavors are juicy and thirst quenching, framed by a fringe of feathery tannins. Drink now to enjoy its fresh, primary flair.

properties.title: Canoe Ridge 2014 Limited Edition Canyon Vineyard Ranch Cinsault Cinsault (Yakima Valley)
properties.descrption: Vineyard-designated rosés are unusual in the state, and other Cinsault offerings unheard of at present. Pale copper in color, this offers berry aromas followed by just off-dry flavors backed by a big blast of acid that keeps you coming back for more.

properties.title: Cascina La Barbatella 2012 Nizza La Vigna dell'Angelo  (Barbera d'Asti)
properties.descrption: Aromas of oak, leather, plum, vanilla and espresso unfold in the glass. The concentrated palate doles out dried black cherry, blackberry jam, oak-driven spice and licorice alongside firm, fine-grained tannin. This has weight and a velvety texture but it isn't overly vibrant, so drink sooner rather than later.

properties.title: Castello del Poggio 2012 Masarej  (Barbera d'Asti)
properties.descrption: Aromas of black plum, vanilla, blue flowers, baked earth and leather lead the nose on this bold Barbera. The big, chewy palate doles out juicy blackberry, black cherry, licorice, clove and orange zest alongside fresh acidity and round tannins.

properties.title: Saget la Perrière 2014 Marie de Beauregard  (Chinon)
properties.descrption: Still young, this is a wine with fruit and acidity that dominate. At the moment, it is about stalky red berry fruits that need to soften into the smoky background. The aftertaste is perfumed and fresh. Let the wine age until 2017.

properties.title: Tenuta di Lilliano 2010 Vignacatena Merlot (Colli della Toscana Centrale)
properties.descrption: Aromas of raisin, tobacco, cedar and toasted oak lead the nose on this full-bodied Merlot. The palate offers dried black cherry, black currant, graphite, licorice and clove alongside firm tannins that are rather rough on the finish.

properties.title: Tenute dei Vallarino 2009 Bricco Asinari Nizza  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
properties.descrption: This full-bodied wine opens with aromas of toast, vanilla, cocoa, plum, violet and a whiff of grilled pepper. The robust palate offers black cherry, red currant, anise and clove alongside racy acidity and fine-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish.

properties.title: The Divining Rod 2012 Divine Red (Lodi)
properties.descrption: An attractively earthy, meaty character in the aromas and flavors is balanced out by an elegant texture, medium body and moderate tannins. Elements of black pepper, soy sauce and blackberry fill out the flavors and linger on the finish.

properties.title: Three Rivers 2013 River's Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Sangiovese, Malbec and Merlot take the lead on this blend. Red cherry, plum and red currant aromas are followed by tangy fruit flavors, with the oak seeming dialed back and a lingering finish. Pair it with pizza or a red pasta sauce.

properties.title: Château Galès 2012  Graves
properties.descrption: Aged for a year in wood, this dense, structured wine has serious tannins that are still very firm. Hints of juicy red currant fruits underneath promise a fresh, fruity wine with time. Drink this wine from 2017.

properties.title: Château Haut-Macô 2010  Côtes de Bourg
properties.descrption: Showing the typical power and concentration of the 2010 vintage, this is a dense and structured wine. Good acidity and black plum flavors show through the big tannic texture and dry core. The wine still needs to age so drink from 2018. This is a 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc blend from Mallet Frères.

properties.title: Château Hyot 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
properties.descrption: This wine is already attractively balanced with ripe red plum fruits giving weight. That is backed by the firm wood and fruit tannins that offer spice and a creamy texture. Drink from 2017. An Alain Aubert estate, it is run by daughter and oenologist Amélie Aubert.

properties.title: Château Jeanguillon 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur
properties.address: 33 Rte de Beaune, 21220 Gevrey-Chambertin, France
properties.descrption: Bold and fruity, this ripe, smoky wine has red berry and blackberry fruit flavors cut with acidity. This blend is smooth in texture, with a full, rich fruitiness on the palate. It will age further, although the wine is ready to drink now.

properties.title: Guarachi Family 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: From both Sun Chase and Gap's Crown vineyards, two stellar sites that neighbor one another, this is a medium-bodied expression of high-toned pomegranate and cherry. It unleashes big, soft waves of intense flavor and texture expansively and with panache.

properties.title: Joseph Carr 2012 Red (Rutherford)
properties.address: 9301 N US 75-Central Expy 1000 Tower I, Suite 500, Dallas, TX 75231, USA
properties.descrption: Soft, structured and grippy, this lovely blend will serve well both at the table and with a crowd. It's pleasing in its elegant concentration of ripe red cherry and peppery plum.

properties.title: Licenciado 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: Reduced, jammy aromas of boysenberry, plum and blueberry set up a woody, choppy feeling palate with tannins that need to mellow. Raisiny berry flavors are on the heavy side, while residual oak notes are prominent. A tannic, drawing finish is dense, woody and in need of settling. Drink through 2030.

properties.title: Luigi Oddero & Figli 2010 Rocche Riviera  (Barolo)
properties.descrption: Crushed aromatic herb, rose and red berry aromas take shape in the glass. The bright, structured palate is still very young, showing tart red cherry, chopped mint and cinnamon accompanied by firm tannins and vibrant acidity. A mineral note signals the close. Drink 2018–2028.

properties.title: Savage Grace 2015 Copeland Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)
properties.descrption: Light in color, this wine offers very pretty aromas of flowers, raspberries and rhubarb. The flavors are primary and appealing, showing a lot of elegance and restraint with a drawn-out finish. It shows no apparent new oak influence, giving a dazzling sense of purity.

properties.title: Saviah 2013 Une Vallée Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Cabernet Sauvignon (50%) and Merlot (38%) make up the majority of this wine with the rest equal parts Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. A blend of McClellan, Seven Hills and Anna Marie vineyards, it brings generous aromas of fresh herbs and cherry, with light barrel accents. The palate is soft and supple, showing a very pretty, elegant styling.

properties.title: Whistler 2013 Corvus Whistler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: From an 850-foot-elevation site four miles from the ocean, this offers a depth of dark cherry and Asian spice, lightly bodied and textured. It delivers a hit of bittersweet chocolate on the tangy finish, with an intriguing streak of charcuterie that's hard to shake.

properties.title: William Church 2013 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Dark plum, black-pepper and fresh herb aromas intertwine with light barrel spices. It's fresh, fruit forward and flavorful, bringing a whole lot of enjoyment and showing a real sense of deftness despite the warmth of the vintage.

properties.title: Eberle 2014 Cotes-du-Robles Mourvèdre--Syrah-Grenache-Durif Red (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: This blend of 39% Mourvèdre, 31% Grenache, 21% Syrah and 9% Durif shows black-plum pastry notes on the nose as well as crushed asphalt, dried rose petals and smoked pork. A line of graphite minerality grabs the palate first, then comes dark red and olallieberry fruit that are lifted by notes of lilac, lavender and potpourri, followed by grippy tannins that entertain the mouth for awhile.

properties.title: Enzo Boglietti 2012 Fossati  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Fontane, 18a, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of pressed rose petal, roasted herb and a funky but not unpleasant trace of game lead the way. The gamey note carries through to the ripe, chewy palate, together with juicy Morello cherry, raspberry compote, mint, clove and mineral while a saline note closes the finish. It's still young and tannic, but shows a certain rustic charm. Drink 2019–2025.

properties.title: Flywheel 2013 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
properties.descrption: Concentrated pomegranate, squeezed cranberry and fresh hibiscus juice pop on the nose of this elegantly restrained bottling that also has lots of wet cement and stony character. Once sipped, the body and texture are both quite delicate, but the flavors are strong: straweberry, cranberry, wet slate, sour plum, bay leaf, eucalyptus and sour juniper.

properties.title: Force Majeure 2013 Collaboration Series III Red Wine Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
properties.descrption: Exuberant aromas of espresso, smoke and dark fruit leap up from the glass. The palate is considerably more reserved with fruit and earth flavors that linger.

properties.title: Baer 2013 Callisto Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up half of this wine with the rest Syrah (40%) and Petit Verdot. Aromas of blackberry seed, spice, black licorice and dark fruit lead to ripe, full and appealing black-fruit flavors. It's a hedonistic delight.

properties.title: Borgogno 2012  Barolo
properties.address: Via Gioberti, 1, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This opens with earthy—almost funky—aromas of game, truffle, leather, a hint of overripe dark-skinned fruit and a balsamic note. The palate offers black cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and chopped herb alongside ripe tannins. An anise note closes the finish.

properties.title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2010  Listrac-Médoc
properties.address: 5 Rue Odilon Redon, 33480 Listrac-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: Now at its peak, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. It has a fine blend of dark tannins and dense plum and berry fruits. Maturing well, the wine is well balanced, with a smoky edge and still with a touch of acidity. Drink now.

properties.title: Alexandria Nicole 2009 Quarry Butte Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.descrption: A blend of approximately 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, with Merlot, Malbec, Syrah and Petit Verdot making up the remainder, this barbecue-ready wine is scented with dried herb and forest floor components. Brambly berry fruit and tart acids work to balance out the earthy tannins.

properties.title: Andis 2010 Barbera (Amador County)
properties.descrption: Andis's 100% Barbera tempts with ripe, dried black-cherry and mint flavors, and toasty layers of coffee and toffee that linger until the finish.

properties.title: Anthony Nappa 2010 Bordo Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 2885 Peconic Ln, Peconic, NY 11958, USA
properties.descrption: There's a savage appeal (what the French call sauvage) to this unabashedly rustic Cabernet Franc that was fermented entirely using wild yeasts. Initial notes of tomato leaf and green stem blow off to reveal aripe red fruit with a gorgeously floral character. Tart acidity and a concentrated red-cherry flavor are accented with graphite and black tea notes.

properties.title: Château au Pont de Guitres 2009  Lalande de Pomerol
properties.descrption: Packed with superripe Merlot, this is rich and round. It has wood flavors and sweet, juicy black-plum fruits that are balanced by firm tannins. The finish shows some bitterness from over-extraction.

properties.title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2006  Haut-Médoc
properties.descrption: Now maturing, this retains its red fruits; its bright texture and acidity go with the firm tannins and dark structure. It is balanced and ready to drink.

properties.title: Château Haut-Goujon 2008 La Rose Saint-Vincent  (Lalande de Pomerol)
properties.descrption: This is structured and firm, with its dry tannins prominent along with blackberry and black cherry acidity. The wine does have density, a dusty texture and the chance to further age.

properties.title: Château La Fleur Plaisance 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
properties.descrption: This shows the rich density of Merlot in 2009, giving a solid structure, with dried fruit and red berry flavors and a concentrated line of tannins. Big and dense, this is ready to age.

properties.title: Chatom Vineyards 2008 Touriga Nacional (Calaveras County)
properties.descrption: This is dark in color and plush, with rustic tannins. It's beautifully crafted, giving off perfumed notes of violet, dried cherry and leather. Fullbodied, it has a lingering spice note.

properties.title: EnRoute 2010 Les Pommiers Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Very good and delicious, if not quite up there with the warmer vintages of 2007 and 2008. The winemaker has done a yeoman's job with this wine—considering the difficult vintage—coaxing out pleasant raspberry- and cherry-jam flavors.The finish is dry and spicy. Drink now.

properties.title: Clovis Point 2007 Archeology Red (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 1935 NY-25, Laurel, NY 11948, USA
properties.descrption: This has a pronounced nose, with aromas of black fruits swathed in savory dried herbs, mushrooms, game and smoke. The palate, by contrast, is juicy with tart black-cherry and berry flavors framed with ripe, but grippy, tannins. Pleasant now, but it could improve over the next 3–5 years.

properties.title: Montalbera 2010 Laccento  (Ruché di Castagnole Monferrato)
properties.descrption: Aged only in stainless steel, this fragrant wine opens with floral notes of pressed violet and rose perfume. The palate is tight, sharp and fresh, but what really sets this wine apart is the delicate and feminine nature of its bouquet.

properties.title: J Vineyards & Winery 2010 Robert Thomas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: This vineyard produces quite good Pinots for J Vineyards. The 2010 is ripe enough in cherry, raspberry and cola flavors, with good balancing acidity. It's a bit heavy, though. Cellar at your own risk.

properties.title: Kessler-Haak 2009 Turner Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.descrption: Rich and dry, this has flavors of cola, cherry pie, bacon and black pepper. The tannins are firm, and there's a bright burst of citrusy acidity to make things lively. Not an ager, but it should benefit from another year in the cellar.

properties.title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2008  Médoc
properties.descrption: This has good balance among its ripe blackberry and red-plum flavors and its firm core. It's solid and chunky while also offering crisp, taut acidity. The aftertaste, with a touch of smokiness, is attractive.

properties.title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2009 Cuvée Lucie  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: 335 Rue Georges Bonnac, 33000 Bordeaux, France
properties.descrption: This is a smooth, rich, wood-aged wine. It has wood aromas, but on the palate the wood has softened the black currant fruit, creating a wine that's elegant and full-bodied, with herbal acidity on the finish. Age for 1–2 years.

properties.title: Longoria 2010 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 415 E Chestnut Ave, Lompoc, CA 93436, USA
properties.descrption: With an earthiness that weighs down the cherry, cola and currant flavors, this Pinot tastes a bit heavy. It's properly dry, with good acidity and modest alcohol.

properties.title: Milbrandt 2009 Brothers' Blend Red Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 707 US-2 unit d, Leavenworth, WA 98826, USA
properties.descrption: Malbec, Cabernet, Tempranillo, Petite Sirah, Grenache and Mourvèdre are all here. Fruity and forward, this shows the same strong streaks of vanilla, tobacco and chocolate flavors as the rest of the Milbrandt reds.

properties.title: Muscardini 2009 Tesoro Red (Sonoma Valley)
properties.descrption: There are lots of delicious flavors in this smooth blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. It impresses for its voluptuous flavors of blackberries, cherries, chocolate and sweet oak. It could be a little firmer in structure; it's soft and melted, like pastry filling.

properties.title: Château Haut-Sorillon 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur
properties.address: 1 Petit Sorillon, 33230 Abzac, France
properties.descrption: Profiting from the richness of 2009, this is a smooth blackberry-flavored wine. It has ripe fruit, a center of dry tannin and juicy acidity. The aftertaste is firm with some dryness.

properties.title: El Huique 2009 Reserve Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
properties.descrption: A jammy raspberry aroma comes with a herb note and a pinch of varietal green. The palate is fresh, forward and well balanced, a nice home for plum, cherry and herb flavors. On the finish this is clean and fairly light in body, with some snappiness.

properties.title: Vesevo 2010  Taurasi
properties.address: 129 W Baraga Ave, Marquette, MI 49855, USA
properties.descrption: This opens with subdued aromas of mature plum, espresso, dried herb and a whiff of forest floor. The dense rounded palate offers dried cherry, licorice, vanilla and coffee framed in velvety tannins. Drink this through 2022.

properties.title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
properties.address: Winter's Hill Estate, 6451 NE Hilltop Ln, Dayton, OR 97114, USA
properties.descrption: Pure Pommard, this has more concentration and forward fruit than the other single-block wines in this series. A pleasing mix of strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors, along with a dash of flat seltzer, it carries through clean and refreshing to a moderately long finish with a hint of herb.

properties.title: Lungarotti 2010  Montefalco Sagrantino
properties.descrption: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, cassis and a whiff of cedar. The robust palate offers mature black plum, ground pepper and clove alongside austere, rather astringent tannins that grip the finish. Drink 2018–2025.

properties.title: Marqués de la Concordia 2006 Federico Paternina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.address: Carretera de el Ciego, s/n, 26350 Cenicero, La Rioja, Spain
properties.descrption: First-take aromas of raisin and cotton candy are soft and sweet. Following that lead, this feels chunky but adequately acidic. Herbal, reedy raspberry and plum flavors finish with spice and chocolate notes. Drink now.

properties.title: Jean Josselin 2012 Cordon Royal Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
properties.descrption: Made exclusively from Pinot Noir grown in the best parcels of the Josselin vineyard, this Champagne has richness along with hints of maturity. Fruity with citrus and green apple flavors, it has a crisp texture that is just about to soften. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Karine 2012 Love Ranch Vineyard Syrah
properties.descrption: This is a sculpted, mature wine that has good complexity to its aromas, a core of vivid blackberry flavors and a seamless but moderately tannic texture. It's a very good example of a well-balanced dinner wine that's not a blockbuster.

properties.title: Oregon Territory 2014 Tempranillo (Oregon)
properties.descrption: From Paul O'Brien, a producer with multiple versions of Tempranillo, comes this budget offering. It spent 18 months in 30% new French oak, which suggests that these were declassified barrels originally meant for the pricier wines. Dried fruits, especially fig, a scent of leather, and strong highlights of cherry tobacco and coffee all support the notion that this got the fancy wine treatment.

properties.title: Paul O'Brien 2013 Reserva Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
properties.address: 609 SE Pine St, Roseburg, OR 97470, USA
properties.descrption: The very limited reserve bottling sees two years of barrel age in 100% new French oak. In this vintage, there isn't quite enough fruit ripeness to match that treatment. The light elegant fruit flavors of pomegranate and wild berry are a bit overpowered by the darker smoky oak flavors. A stiff streak of espresso runs through the finish. Best to drink this now through 2020.

properties.title: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Papa Joe's Private Stash Syrah (Applegate Valley)
properties.descrption: This young, tight tart wine is a fine example of pure Syrah, as if tasted fresh out of the fermenter. Tart black cherry, cassis, coffee liqueur, vanilla and a light streak of metal all combine to make this a full fascinating example. The odds are that another three to five years of bottle age will continue to improve this wine, but it's already quite flavorful and interesting.

properties.title: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Papa Joe's Private Stash Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)
properties.descrption: This is a nice amalgam of loose threads—leather, tobacco, earth and coffee, with purple plum and pie-cherry fruit. The fruit flavors lean toward fruit leather rather than fresh-picked, and the tannins are a bit astringent.

properties.title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Another accessible, complex and tasty wine from the Beckett brothers, this blend of 68% Zinfandel, 18% Petite Sirah, 8% Grenache and 6% Syrah offers baked and fresh blackberry notes on the nose, alongside slate, lilacs and clove. The layered palate shows blackened berries, espresso and a touch of caramel that ride a decent acidity deep into the finish.

properties.title: Eola Hills 2014 Barrel Select Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)
properties.descrption: This spent about a year in 30% new oak, and some portion was American. Those aggressive scents and flavors still dominate, with the typical vanilla and pickle-barrel highlights. More bottle age is in order for maximum enjoyment. At the moment the fruit is primary and the barrel notes not entirely integrated. Drink after 2020.

properties.title: Fattoria Ambra 2015  Barco Reale di Carmignano
properties.descrption: Fruity aromas of wild berry meld together with whiffs of violet, tilled earth and dark spice on this young juicy red. The round savory palate doles out ripe black cherry, black berry, white pepper and a hint of licorice alongside supple tannins. It's easygoing and made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.

properties.title: Fenestra 2013 Estate Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)
properties.descrption: Smoothness, calmness and a reserved fruit and spice character allow this medium-boded wine to glide effortlessly over the palate. It has moderate plum and rhubarb flavors, gentle acidity and tannins, and a lingering peppery finish.

properties.title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Rubrato Aglianico (Irpinia)
properties.descrption: Enticing scents of red berry violet and menthol lift from the glass. On the bright polished palate, juicy morello cherry, blackberry, licorice and a sprinkling of white pepper are set against vibrant acidity and lithe athletic tannins. Drink through 2019.

properties.title: Concha y Toro 2014 Marques de Casa Concha Carmenère (Peumo)
properties.address: Av. Virginia Subercaseaux 210, Pirque, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: Cheesy smelling oak and slightly overripe fruit aromas are a little less than spotless on the nose. In the mouth, this is raw and saucy in feel, with biting tannins. Sauvage berry flavors are gamy, while this is drying, scratchy and rugged on the finish. Drink through 2022.

properties.title: Foxen 7200 2008 Range 30 West Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
properties.address: 7200 Foxen Canyon Rd, Santa Maria, CA 93454, USA
properties.descrption: From the new Happy Canyon appellation, this wine is so close to being so good. It's dry and rich in acidity, and complex in blackberry, cherry and currant flavors that finish long and sweet. This new 7200 line from Foxen is worth watching over future vintages.

properties.title: Gainey 2007 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.descrption: Made with 15% Cabernet Franc, which adds a welcome cherry tart richness to the earthy blackberries and herbs, this Merlot is priced well for an elegant restaurant wine. It's dry and crisp and smooth, and so easy to drink with a fine steak.

properties.title: Beau Joubert 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)
properties.descrption: Crushed violet petals, plum, roasty coffee and cocoa dusted black cherry aromas all welcome you on the bouquet of this wine. The round mouth is just as opulent and inviting, with more dark fruit and mocha notes backed by sweet spice. Tasty and easy to drink.

properties.title: Chanson Père et Fils 2007 Les Dominodes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
properties.descrption: Lovely perfumed fruit with delicious, soft sweetness, raspberry and sweet plums. The acidity attractively cuts through this ripeness.

properties.title: Ruca Malen 2007 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Meaty, dense and rich aromas, with driving scents of prune, licorice, blackberry and cola. The palate is healthy and rich, and it keeps in step with flavors of blackberry, dark plum and savory spice. Finishes lightly roasted and dark, with a saucy aftertaste that separates it from the masses. A lusty Malbec to drink now.

properties.title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2008 Chorus Red (Thermenregion)
properties.descrption: A blend that brings together French and Austrian varietals into a smooth, rich wine. Licorice, sweet fruit jelly and spice go with toast and polished acidity to give a wine with an international feel.

properties.title: L. Tramier & Fils 2007 Collection Premier Cru  (Beaune)
properties.descrption: A dry wine with firm tannins over the juicy red-cherry fruits. It is structured, while likely to develop well over the next few years. The wood and fruit are both attractive at this stage.

properties.title: Maison Champy 2008  Volnay
properties.descrption: Rich, velvet-textured wine, this has weight and tannins surrounded by red berry fruits, soft acidity and a lingering sweet aftertaste.

properties.title: La Follette 2011 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
properties.address: 409A Healdsburg Ave, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: You can call this Pinot thin, or you can call it elusive. While it does show the lean profile of the 2011 vintage, it's quite complex, offering high acid-inspired flavors of raspberry sour candy, chamomile tea and cranberries, plus minerally, dried herb complexities. Drinking through 2020.

properties.title: Laird 2010 Jillian's Blend Red (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: The blend is Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Malbec. Cab Sauv brings rich black currants, as well as thick tannins. Merlot adds softer notes of cherries and violets. The Malbec increases the tannins, along with notes of grilled meat bone that Syrah, with its peppery, beef-jerky meatiness, enhances. The result is a young, vigorous wine, dry and balanced in acidity. It may or may not age, but there's no reason not to decant it now and enjoy with grilled beefsteak.

properties.title: McIntyre Vineyards 2012 Estate 25th Anniversary Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.address: 31901 Sanchez Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.descrption: You can criticize this as being too full-bodied for a Pinot Noir. Some will find it Grenache-like, with its lush, jammy flavors of cherries, raspberries and oak. But what can't be denied is how delicious it is. The fruitiness, acidity and tannins suggest pairing with charbroiled lamb chops or steak. Drink now–2020.

properties.title: Anam Cara 2011 Heather's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.descrption: This is a lovely, balanced wine, combining grip, texture and elegant details. It starts with clean fruit flavors of berry and cherry, bringing in delicate notes of root beer, vanilla and clove. There's a suggestion of brine also, the whole delivering marvelous complexity.

properties.title: Beauregard 2012 Bald Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
properties.address: 10 Pine Flat Rd, Santa Cruz, CA 95060, USA
properties.descrption: Right out of the bottle, it's all about acidity and fresh, primary raspberry and cherry jam fruit. Wait until 2018 allow more complex mushroom flavors to emerge, as the wine gradually sheds tannins and develops secondary bottle notes.

properties.title: Benovia 2011 Bella Una Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 3339 Hartman Rd, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
properties.descrption: The cool 2011 vintage has kept this bottling from being as ripe as previous wines from this producer. It's certainly leaner, but for all that, it's dry, silky and elegantly complex in its own way, with dried raspberry, tea and white pepper flavors. It could surprise after 2017.

properties.title: Château Cheval Blanc 2011 Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: 1 Cheval Blanc, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: The second wine of Château Cheval Blanc is packed with wood flavors and spice. A toasty wine, it also has solid tannins plus fragrant fruitiness. Already the fruit is coming through strongly and it is for medium-term aging. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Anam Cara 2011 Mark VI Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.address: 306 N Main St, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: The Mark VI (similar to the above Heather's Vineyard) is a sort of reserve reserve, this one from barrels chosen to showcase the most cellar-worthy aspects of the vintage. It succeeds nicely, delivering a solid, firm, tart wine with young raspberry and cherry fruit at its center. The tannins have a lightly herbal, leafy streak, and there's little doubt this will benefit from additional years in the cellar.

properties.title: Brick & Mortar 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: The hue is an elegant peach just starting to blush with pink. The wine is entirely dry, with low alcohol framing intricate flavors of peaches, limes and vanilla, brightened by crisp acidity.

properties.title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc
properties.descrption: This marks the first vintage of this Moulis estate under the ownership of the Barton family of Léoville Barton. Already the wine is showing breeding and an understated structure and richness. Lightly perfumed, full of black fruits and integrated tannins, it should age well. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Dão Sul 2009 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)
properties.address: Quinta Das Sarzedas, Currelos Aptd. 28, Carregal Do Sal, Viseu, 3430-211 Carregal do Sal, Portugal
properties.descrption: This complex, mature wine has plenty of red fruit flavors, but its main character displays concentrated, tannin and spice. Hints of leather and rich acidity add their notes to this dense, dusty wine. It is ready to drink although it will still mature until 2020.

properties.title: Roche de Bellene 2011 Pitures Premier Cru  (Volnay)
properties.descrption: Showing richness, this wine is smooth and well balanced between ripe red berry fruits and generous tannins. The wood aging shows in a slight burnt edge, but this will pass as the wine develops. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Campo di Sasso 2012 Insoglio del Cinghiale Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Piazza Antonio Gramsci, 9, 57020 Bibbona LI, Italy
properties.descrption: This delicious blend of Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, berries, tilled soil, blue flower and spice. The concentrated palate delivers fleshy black cherry, red currants, black pepper and graphite alongside smooth tannins. The long finish closes on a licorice note.

properties.title: Von Siebenthal 2008 Toknar Petit Verdot (Aconcagua Valley)
properties.address: Panquehue, Valparaíso, Chile
properties.descrption: An intriguing, well-made wine, it conveys saucy red-fruit aromas that come with notes of raw oak, leather and herbs. It smacks the palate with hard tannins and raw verve, while flavors of vanilla, mocha, licorice and berry fruits finish crisp and woody. Drink through 2017.

properties.title: Herdade das Servas 2010 Reserva Petite Verdot (Alentejano)
properties.descrption: A big, ripe wine, it shows richness from the superripe grapes. It is bold, full-bodied and packed with juicy black fruits. It's like a fruit bomb, but structure holds it together. Drink from 2015.

properties.title: Herdade do Rocim 2010 Olho de Mocho Reserva Red (Alentejano)
properties.descrption: This wine is full of fruit, dusty tannins and great structure. A smooth surface covers the complex, juicy black fruits, dense tannins and mineral texture. This wine will certainly age, so don't drink before 2017.

properties.title: Koyle 2009 Auma Los Lingues Red (Colchagua Valley)
properties.descrption: Dark berry, shoe polish and lemony oak are at the center of the bouquet on this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. The palate feels rich to the point of syrupy, while the flavor profile offers a condensed, jammy mix of wild berries, wood, herbs, chocolate and coffee. Additional herbal notes along with spicy flavors carry a thick finish to its conclusion. Drink through 2018.

properties.title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Estate Vineyards Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
properties.descrption: Mauve in color, this cold-fermented pink wine shows crystallized watermelon, effervescent pink lemonade and berry-lime sangria elements on the nose. It's very flavorful once sipped, with pomegranate and rose petal notes, proving ripe and tasty yet not overdone.

properties.title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.address: 9015 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Seductive aromas of raspberries, sandalwood, graphite and a pinch of allspice entertain the nose on this wine. The spiced wood character carries to the palate, where dried strawberries and pomegranate add riper fruit elements.

properties.title: Mazzei 2011 Belguardo Bronzone Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)
properties.address: Via Ottone III di Sassonia n. 5 Loc, 53011 Fonterutoli SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Purple flowers, ripe berry and tobacco aromas lead the nose on this Sangiovese-based wine. On the smooth, concentrated palate, notes of black pepper, anise and clove accent the core of fleshy black cherry. Velvety tannins provide support. Drink 2016–2020.

properties.title: Monchiero Carbone 2013 Pelisa  (Barbera d'Alba)
properties.descrption: Red berry, rose, tilled soil and a whiff of baking spice aromas almost jump out of the glass. The lively palate doles out juicy black cherry, raspberry, clove and orange zest alongside vibrant acidity and supple tannins that give this wine a smooth mouthfeel.

properties.title: Monterebro 2013 Selección Red (Jumilla)
properties.descrption: This ruby colored Syrah-led blend is stout, oaky, minerally and convincing, with ripe cassis, prune and licorice aromas. Full, rubbery tannins make for a choppy palate, while briny and earthy flavors of blackberry and plum finish with a punch of acidity.

properties.title: Paniole 2011  Maremma Toscana
properties.address: 8440 St Helena Hwy, Rutherford, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: This red blend offers aromas of black-skinned fruit, cedar, coffee and anisette. On the palate, dried black cherry and black currant make up the core while espresso, clove and tobacco play supporting roles. Grippy tannins hold it all together.

properties.title: Rocca di Frassinello 2013 Baffonero  (Maremma Toscana)
properties.descrption: Aromas of toasted oak, espresso, coconut and dried black fruit slowly take shape in the glass. Made entirely with Merlot, the dense palate offers blackberry extract, black cherry, coffee and grilled sage alongside rather astringent tannins that dry out the finish.

properties.title: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2013 Vecchie Vigne 50  (Barbera d'Asti)
properties.descrption: This opens with earthy aromas of forest floor, tilled soil, dark berry and a whiff of baking spices. Made with very old vines, the concentrated palate doles out black cherry, blackberry, clove and anise alongside fresh acidity.

properties.title: For a Song 2012 Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 1938 Occidental Ave S, Seattle, WA 98134, USA
properties.descrption: Brooding aromas of dates, herbs and cherry lead to full-bodied coffee and pit-fruit flavors that show a sense of balance and finesse.

properties.title: For a Song 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: This appealing offering has aromas of smoke, char, coffee and berry. It shows a sense of restraint and elegance while still displaying depth and balance to the lingering dark fruit and savory flavors.

properties.title: La Velona 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.descrption: Aromas of leafy underbrush, espresso, grilled porcini mushroom and dark berry take shape in the glass. The firm palate offers dried cherry, coffee beans and savory herbs but the midpalate is a bit hollow.

properties.title: Palmina 2011 Alisos Barbera (Santa Barbara County)
properties.descrption: One of the Steve and Chrystal Clifton's lively takes on this grape, this shows smashed black currants, boysenberry, gravel and dark spice on the nose. Allspice and cinnamon decorate the black-cherry core, which is not particular juicy or overly ripe, tightened up further by pencil shavings.

properties.title: Peju 2014 Rosé of Syrah (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 8466 St Helena Hwy, Rutherford, CA 94573, USA
properties.descrption: Made from 100% Syrah grapes, this rosé is the color of a light Pinot Noir, deeper red than pink, with flavors of cranberry, rhubarb and orange. Medium to fuller-bodied in weight, it's dry and textural, with a compelling bouquet of rose petals.

properties.title: Raphael 2013 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.descrption: Wet cedar, dried leaves and mushroom notes extend a woodsy, earthy tone to ripe black cherry and plums in this unusually savory, nuanced Merlot. Supple and ripe, it extends languorously on the palate, fringed by fine tannins and an appetizing touch of bitterness on the finish. Drink now through 2020.

properties.title: Roccheviberti 2011  Barolo
properties.descrption: Aromas of toast, sawdust, dark berry and cocoa lead the way. The firm palate offers black cherry, dark chocolate, espresso, oak and anise alongside tightly wound tannins and lively acidity.

properties.title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
properties.descrption: Crisp red cherry and plum flavors penetrate the core of this vivacious Pinot Noir. Accents of bramble and granite, cedar and spice lend complexity and depth to the midpalate. It's a briskly composed wine framed by fine, persistent tannins.

properties.title: Kings Mountain 2010 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
properties.address: 1549 Ike Brooks Dr, Kings Mountain, NC 28086, USA
properties.descrption: Lots of rich, ripe raspberry and cherry jam fruit in this dry, briskly acidic Pinot Noir. Oak shows up in the form of buttered cinnamon toast. It's a little irregular in tannins, but delicious for drinking now, after decanting.

properties.title: Abbey Creek 2012 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 31441 NW Commercial St, North Plains, OR 97133, USA
properties.descrption: Young, sappy and still quite tart, this wine needs a bit more time in the bottle to really pull itself together. Cranberry and raspberry fruit is at the core, clean and lip-smacking, with strong streaks of smoke and char from aging in 50% new French oak.

properties.title: Anam Cara 2011 Nicholas Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.descrption: Although this wine earns its reserve designation with extra concentration, it comes at the cost of complexity. The tart rhubarb and cranberry flavors are tight and the mouthfeel blocky; the wine seems to hit a wall and stop at the stiff tannins.

properties.title: Calera 2013 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
properties.descrption: Pale in color, it's bone dry and crisp in acidity. It shows subtle flavors of rosehip tea, orange peel and persimmons, with a scour of grape skin tannins. Perfect pairings include sausages and pâté.

properties.title: Caraccioli 2010 Limited Production Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.descrption: The cold vintage impacted this Pinot Noir. While it has raspberry and cherry jam flavors, with plenty of toasty oak, it's a bit one-dimensional, stretched to the limit of richness. Give it an hour or two in the decanter and drink up.

properties.title: Casal da Coelheira 2011 Reserva Red (Tejo)
properties.descrption: This rich, intense wine has a strong tannic element that is balanced with the red and black berry fruits. There's a burst of acidity, but the main thrust of this wine is structure and concentration.

properties.title: Casuccio Tarletti 2011  Chianti Classico
properties.descrption: It opens with aromas of violet, iris, ripe red berries and a whiff of vanilla. The soft palate offers fleshy black cherry, raspberry, black pepper and well-integrated oak alongside round tannins.

properties.title: Fullerton 2013 Five Faces Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.descrption: Opening aromas blend earthy red fruits with a whiff of leather. It's a nicely sculpted wine, tight and stiff, with pleasant berry and cherry flavors that stop abruptly as the finish turns a bit sour.

properties.title: Gooseneck 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
properties.address: 4 Brown St, North Kingstown, RI 02852, USA
properties.descrption: Gooseneck is based in Rhode Island but sources wines from around the world. This Pinot was produced at River's Edge, in the Elkton Oregon AVA. It sends out aromas of caramel and graham cracker, and enters the palate with a soft, silky mouthfeel and plum fruit. Though the vintage is recent, it drinks like a more mature wine, with granular tannins and flavors of coffee grounds running through the finish.

properties.title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.descrption: Old vines on schist soil have produced a wine that is so concentrated. It is spoilt by some bitter extract that comes from wood aging as much as from the fruit. If that softens, the wine will become rich and generous. Wait until 2017.

properties.title: Tabor 2011 Adama Merlot (Galilee)
properties.descrption: Aromas of black cherry and green frying peppers prepare the palate for flavors of cherry, blackberry, green bell pepper and licorice. Smooth tannins and strong fruit flavors are slightly overcome by green notes, and the cool bell pepper finish yields soft touches of cherry.

properties.title: Mackinaw Trail 2013 Unrestricted Passito Cabernet Franc (Lake Michigan Shore)
properties.descrption: Using shriveled, dried Cabernet Franc grapes, this appassimento-style wine is a new endeavor in the Michigan wine scene, yet it might merit further experimentation for such a cool climate growing region. Initial notes of balsamic blow off to reveal notes of brandied cherries and dried hay. Medium in weight, with fine, sandy tannins, the palate is condensed and ripe in fresh cherry tones that linger on the finish. As a result of the drying process, the alcohol hits over 15%, yet beyond the roundness on the palate, it's quite imperceptible.

properties.title: Piccolo 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.descrption: Two fistfuls of Petite Sirah are added to the mix here, the wine a mix of black cherry and berry around soft, sinewy layers of black pepper and firm tannins. Never overbearing, this wine will do well at the table around plenty of meats.

properties.title: Griffin Creek 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)
properties.descrption: This Grenache was made in a firm, tannic and quite oaky style. Dark flavors mix black cherry, black licorice and road tar, with some alcoholic burn running along the finish.

properties.title: Griffin Creek 2012 Griffin Red (Rogue Valley)
properties.address: 675 Shafer Ln, Jacksonville, OR 97530, USA
properties.descrption: Alone among a lineup of pure single-varietal reds, this reserve-level Meritage blend shows ample fruit, with juicy citrus and sour-cherry flavors. The blend is 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, filled out with Cab Franc, Merlot and Malbec. Chalky acids dominate a short finish.

properties.title: Hirsch 2012 San Andreas Fault Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: This wine starts with an enticing, perfumed spicy aroma. Once sipped, a big burst of dry tannins coats the mouth and makes the mild fruit flavors seem thin and spare in the middle. The structure and the texture seem to need more richness and depth from the flavors. Drink after 2020 to let the tannins mellow out.

properties.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Smart Dog Red (Alentejano)
properties.descrption: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira named after Pingo, the winemaker's dog. It's fruity, juicy and fresh with fine acidity and the right balance of spicy tannins. It is ready to drink now.

properties.title: Truchard 2006 Zinfandel (Carneros)
properties.address: 3234 Old Sonoma Rd, Napa, CA 94559, USA
properties.descrption: Carneros seems too cool to ripen Zin, and so it is with this wine, which is rather green and minty. But it's streamlined and clean, with pleasant sour cherry, anise and cinnamon spice flavors.

properties.title: Mounts 2006 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.descrption: Lots of new French oak gives this wine a pronounced taste of caramel, smoke and vanilla. That's on top of the massive blackberry, cherry, chocolate, green olive and pepper flavors. The result is delicious, but the wine is a bit too hot and soft for balance.

properties.title: Northwest Totem Cellars 2006 Grenache (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 11909 124th Ave NE, Kirkland, WA 98034, USA
properties.descrption: Acidic, chalky and sharp upon entry, this wine's light berry flavors quickly give way to those tart acids. Though the fruit shows some concentration, it's a one-dimensional effort that has not completely knit together.

properties.title: Xavier Flouret 2006 La Pilar Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Opens with fairly deep blackberry aromas, but there's also a stemmy edge to the bouquet. Generic flavors of baked plum and berry are lifted by slicing acids, while the finish bounces along before ending with some straightforward chocolate and berry notes.

properties.title: Hahn 2006 SLH Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.address: 37700 Foothill Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.descrption: Too sweet, soft and simple in cherry-cola flavors, this Syrah would benefit from more dryness and greater structure. It turns Porty on the finish. Drink now.

properties.title: Agur 2007 Kessem Red (Judean Hills)
properties.address: 17, Agur, 9984000, Israel
properties.descrption: Sweet cherry and baking vanilla aromas are followed by layers of plum, raspberry and spice in this kosher Bordeaux blend from Israel. The wine offers firm tannins and a lingering finish.

properties.title: Airfield Estates 2007 Spitfire Dolcetto-Primitivo-Sangiovese Red (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 14450 Woodinville - Redmond Rd NE #109, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: Airfield reds are thoroughly saturated with color, and often quite tannic, to the detriment of the lighter, more subtle fruit. This wine loses its definition and turns from pretty to pretty harsh as a result.

properties.title: West Cape Howe 2007 Pinot Noir (Western Australia)
properties.descrption: Dominated by the menthol and cedar notes of oak, this medium-bodied Pinot features a modicum of cherry fruit and a tart, crisp finish.

properties.title: Hey Mambo 2007 Sultry Red Red (California)
properties.descrption: Soft and fruity, with jammy flavors of cherries and currants edged with peppery spices. A nice, simple table wine based on Syrah and Barbera.

properties.title: Jekel 2006 Merlot (Arroyo Seco)
properties.descrption: Soft and fruity-sweet, with jammy flavors of cherries, teriaki beef, pepper and cedar. Drink now.

properties.title: Northwest Totem Cellars 2006 Elerding Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
properties.descrption: Co-fermented with 3% Viognier, this tart and sharp-edged Washington Syrah sports bright berry fruit and just a hint of earth in the tannins. The acids are a little chalky, and there is a slight medicinal quality in the back of the mouth as the wine finishes.

properties.title: Sausal 2006 Family Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
properties.descrption: Full-bodied and rustic, a simple wine to drown pasta with sausages and marinara sauce. It's dry and gritty, with blackberry, mulberry and pepper flavors.

properties.title: Señorío de Sarria 2005 Crianza Red (Navarra)
properties.descrption: Early tobacco and mint aromas quickly yield to mossy black fruit, and in the mouth it's fresh and zesty, with mild green-pepper infused plum and cassis flavors. Quite crisp and lean, with herbal influences showing up at all points. Classic Navarran red wine.

properties.title: Ocone 2006  Aglianico del Taburno
properties.address: Via S. Benedetto da Benevento, 93, 82030 Ponte BN, Italy
properties.descrption: Available at an attractively low price, this oak-aged Aglianico opens with dark, brooding tones of cassis, dark spice, resin, tar and black licorice. The mouthfeel is firm and tight, making this wine suitable for a fatty meat dish such as a juicy cheeseburger.

properties.title: Partnership Vineyards 2008 Shiraz (Western Cape)
properties.descrption: Sweet mocha is the heart of this wine, with stemmy fruit flavors of black cherry and mashed raspberry providing the supporting frame. A glimmer of hickory smoke accents the long finish. Drink now.

properties.title: Torii Mor 2008 Hawks View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.descrption: Well made in a lighter style, this offers strawberry and raspberry fruit, tart acids, and a tight, somewhat tannic exit. This winery has dramatically reduced the alcohol levels of their wines over the past few years—by what means we do not know—but the 13.1% listed here feels a little thin.

properties.title: Viña Requingua 2009 Toro de Piedra Reserva Syrah-Cabernet (Curicó Valley)
properties.descrption: Blackberry and balsam wood are the key aromas, but there's a pinch of cumin in there too. The palate is wide, broad and tannic, with leathery, roasted flavors of dark berry and black plum. Finishes savory and a bit salty, with a clacky, hard, tannic residue.

properties.title: Alpha Estate 2007 Hedgehog Vineyard Xinomavro (Amyndeon)
properties.descrption: The nose on this red starts with a slightly medicinal cherry cola nose, and a touch of smoked meat. On the palate, cherry, red berry and cigarbox flavors are carried by a lively acidity. Fresh and balanced, it will pair well with grilled meats, stews.

properties.title: Baldassari Family Wines 2007 Jemrose Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
properties.descrption: Fruity enough, with powerfully ripe blackberry, cherry, raspberry, currant, chocolate and licorice flavors that go on and on through the long, spicy finish. Could show greater structure, though, as it's somewhat soft, sweet and unidimensional.

properties.title: Château de Laville 2006  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux
properties.descrption: Black currant and stalky tannins, along with acidity, mark this attractive Bordeaux. It is dry, with some mineral austerity, lightly woody. The fruit is now mature.

properties.title: Château Grand Tayac 2008  Margaux
properties.address: Rue du Grand Soussans, 33460 Soussans, France
properties.descrption: From the north of the Margaux appellation, this is a wine that has tense, acidic, black berry fruits, soft tannins and a light, juicy character. Not for long-term aging.

properties.title: Esoterica by Kent Rasmussen 2008 Chavez-Leeds Vineyard Petite Sirah (Rutherford)
properties.descrption: Rich in blackberry tart, dark chocolate, grilled meat, pepper spice and smoky flavors, wrapped into firm tannins. The acidity is strong and a little unnerving. Drink over the next 2–3 years.

properties.title: Estate Biblia Chora 2005 Ovilos Red (Pangeon)
properties.address: Orfano 640 08, Greece
properties.descrption: Rustic, with a spin of smoke, this red has a nose of green herbs, black cherry and smoke, and flavors of dried herb, red berry and tobacco. Masculine and focused, it's perfect for spicy meat dishes and stews.

properties.title: Fournier Père et Fils 2006 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)
properties.address: Rte de la Garenne, 18300 Verdigny, France
properties.descrption: An attractive, soft wine, with a chewy, juicy character. It shows red fruits, a touch of licorice and acidity. The wine is now mature. Drink this year.

properties.title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 São Miguel Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)
properties.address: Redondo, 7170, Portugal
properties.descrption: Wines at 15.5% alcohol suggest too much of everything. This wine is no exception, with its heavily extracted character, bitter chocolate and wood perfumes. It should soften in 2–3 years, but will always be overweight.

properties.title: Waters Crest 2008 Campania Rosso Red (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 28735 Main Rd, Cutchogue, NY 11935, USA
properties.descrption: A touch of leather adds intrigue to bright cherry and fresh herb aromas in this Long Island Bordeaux-style blend, but hints of unripe stems lend a slightly green tone to the palate. Medium bodied in style with a refreshing spray of acidity.

properties.title: Poderi dal Nespoli 1929 2011 Prugneto  (Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore)
properties.address: Villa Rossi, 50, 47012 Nespoli FC, Italy
properties.descrption: Here's a very correct and clean Sangiovese with bright cherry nuances and blueberry followed by a touch of bitter almond. The mouthfeel is thin, easy and watery.

properties.title: Reustle 2010 Winemaker Reserve Prayer Rock Vineyards Syrah (Umpqua Valley)
properties.address: 960 Cal Henry Rd, Roseburg, OR 97471, USA
properties.descrption: An intriguing wine, with aromas of white pepper, smoked meat, herbs and red fruit. The palate can't deliver all that these aromas have to offer though, seeming underripe and without the structure to hold them together. Interestingly, it's aged in 100% new oak—half French and half American—but the wood doesn't show.

properties.title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011  Beaujolais
properties.address: 1584 St Helena Hwy: MAIN ENTRANCE 849 Zinfandel Ln: TRUCK ENTRANCE, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: The Beaujolais appellation is the source of most Nouveau. But it also produces attractively fruity wines, full of cherries, that can be drunk over the two years following the harvest. Enjoy this wine this year.

properties.title: Bertolani 2012 Rosè  (Lambrusco Reggiano)
properties.address: Via Pedemontana, 10, 42019 Scandiano RE, Italy
properties.descrption: Easy, simple and thin, this refreshing rosé sparkling wine offers aromas of pink grapefruit and raspberry. The mouthfeel is creamy and soft but the firm perlage keeps the palate clean.

properties.title: Castello di Borghese 2010 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 17150 Middle Rd, Cutchogue, NY 11935, USA
properties.descrption: Ripe stem and leaf notes lend a distinctly green tone to bright black-cherry and cassis flavors in this Cabernet Franc. It's a slightly austere wine, but brisk acidity and delicate structure make it an excellent food companion.

properties.title: Colle S. Mustiola di Fabio Cenni 2008 Poggio ai Chiari Sangiovese (Toscana)
properties.winery: Colle S. Mustiola di Fabio Cenni
properties.address: Via delle Torri, 86/a, 53043 Chiusi SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals red berry and vanilla. The evolved palate offers French oak, toast and cinnamon alongside teeth-coating tannins. Drink soon.

properties.title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2015 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)
properties.address: Ecluse, 69460 Odenas, France
properties.descrption: This is an early drinking style of wine. It is warm and ripe with attractive soft tannins and plenty of red fruits and balancing acidity. The wine will just need to calm its bubbly fruitiness and will be ready to drink during late 2017.

properties.title: Domaine des Gaudets 2015  Morgon
properties.address: 3 Rue de la Fontaine, 71510 Saint-Sernin-du-Plain, France
properties.descrption: This is a fruity wine, packed with red-berry flavors. It is lightly textured and with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. This wine, from the cru property's fifth generation, is going to mature over the next few months, so drink from mid-2017.

properties.title: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Les Charmes  (Morgon)
properties.address: 31 Rue Marechal Foch, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: From one of the top vineyard areas in Morgon, the wine is dense and full of red-berry fruits. It has concentration and a firm background of tannins. The cru wine needs to age further, so drink from 2018.

properties.title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine Du Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)
properties.address: 836 Rte de Fleurie, 71570 Romanèche-Thorins, France
properties.descrption: The cru wine is soft, full of cherry fruits and with a light touch of tannin. With its fruit, it is open and generous with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

properties.title: Alcance 2014 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)
properties.address: 43 Round Lake Rd Suite #3, Ballston Lake, NY 12019, USA
properties.descrption: Minty oaky aromas of baking spices share space on the nose with earthy black plum and berry notes. This feels tannic and resiny while the oaky spicy berry flavors finish with force and drying tannins.

properties.title: Assolati 2012  Montecucco
properties.address: 1620 Carneros Meadows Ln Suite 115, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: The nose isn't very expressive but eventually shows suggestions of leafy underbrush and sunbaked earth. The solid palate offers raspberry, tart cherry and a hint of ground pepper alongside firm tannins.

properties.title: Collemassari 2012 Poggio Ombrone Riserva  (Montecucco)
properties.address: Localita, 58044 Poggi del Sasso GR, Italy
properties.descrption: Hints of menthol and leather lead the nose on this robust red. The hearty, monolithic palate offers dried black cherry, clove and a hint of tobacco alongside firm tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol on the close.

properties.title: Mazzei 2014 Poggio Badiola Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Via Ottone III di Sassonia n. 5 Loc, 53011 Fonterutoli SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made with 70% Sangiovese and 30% Merlot, this easy-drinking wine has aromas of violets and vanilla. The straightforward palate delivers sour cherries and aromatic herbs alongside zesty acidity and lithe tannins. Enjoy soon.

properties.title: Paritua 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
properties.address: 2112 Maraekakaho Road Bridge Pa Triangle, Hastings 4171, New Zealand
properties.descrption: This Hawke's Bay-based producer has drawn fruit from Central Otago for this wine, which shows some austere tannins and minty overtones. Cherry and cinnamon notes join wintergreen, while the finish is clean, dry and firm. Worth holding a few years to see what develops.

properties.title: Poggio al Tufo 2012 Alicante (Toscana)
properties.address: Località Poggio Cavalluccio 6199, 58017 Pitigliano GR, Italy
properties.descrption: Made entirely with Alicante, this opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned fruit and a whiff of leather. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum and cooking spice alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

properties.title: Snake River 2012 Arena Valley Vineyard Cabernet Franc
properties.address: 786 W Broad St, Boise, ID 83702, USA
properties.descrption: Aromas of dried and fresh herbs, whole green pepper and tobacco lead to tart savory cranberry and citrus flavors. It trails toward the finish.

properties.title: Hudson-Chatham 2014 Casscles Vineyards Chelois (New York)
properties.address: 1900 NY-66, Ghent, NY 12075, USA
properties.descrption: Concentrated but crisp black-plum and cherry flavors are accented by savory hints of mushroom, toast and spice in this surprisingly elegant Chelois, a French-American hybrid variety. Slightly puckering acidity lends balance to a rich fleshy mouthfeel. Fine tannins frame a taut finish. Drink now through 2020.

properties.title: Wairau River 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
properties.address: 11 Rapaura Road, Blenheim 7273, New Zealand
properties.descrption: This light-bodied wine showcases the sometimes perfumed nature of Pinot Noir from Marlborough. Vanilla, cedar and mocha notes from oak maturation layer atop the delicate cherry fruit, finishing a bit dry. Drink it over the next few years, before the fruit fades.

properties.title: Altesino 2014 Rosso Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Strada Provinciale del Brunello, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Delicate aromas of red cherry and forest floor lead the way on this straightforward red. With a blend of 80% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, the easygoing palate offers red raspberry and clove alongside bright acidity.

properties.title: Williamson Vineyard 2012 Sangiovese
properties.address: 14807 Sunny Slope Rd, Caldwell, ID 83607, USA
properties.descrption: Aromas of herb, tobacco, tire rubber and leather lead to soft-feeling citrus and savory flavors. There are some interesting things going on but the variety seems hard to find.

properties.title: Fattoria Montellori 2011 Salamartano Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Via Pistoiese, 1, 50054 Fucecchio FI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made with 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 15% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black currant and baking spice. The evolved palate provides mature plum, oak and toast alongside gripping, rather drying tannins.

properties.title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2014 Campo al Capriolo  (Bolgheri)
properties.address: Località Cusona, 5, 53037 San Gimignano SI, Italy
properties.descrption: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Syrah, this opens with delicate aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit and a whiff of cooking spice. The easygoing palate delivers black currant and leather alongside round tannins.

properties.title: Henry Fessy 2015  Chénas
properties.address: 644 Rte de Bel air, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine is structured, layering tannins with black fruits and acidity. It is a wine to age at least for a couple of years. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Henry Fessy 2015  Chiroubles
properties.address: 644 Rte de Bel air, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: A solidly structured wine with fine tannins and ripe red-berry fruits. The acidity adds a piquancy to the fruitiness giving the wine a lift. The wine comes from Henry Fesse vines. Drink from late 2017.

properties.title: Henry Fessy 2015  Morgon
properties.address: 644 Rte de Bel air, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: An attractive, lightly structured cru wine that has juicy cherry fruits. It is balanced, ripe with acidity and gentle tannins in equal measure. Drink from late 2017.

properties.title: Henry Fessy 2015  Saint-Amour
properties.address: 644 Rte de Bel air, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: A rounded and soft wine that has juicy red fruits and gentle tannins. It just hints at a dry structure that will allow it to age for several months. Drink this attractive cru wine from late 2017.

properties.title: Leyda 2014 Single Vineyard Canelo Syrah (Leyda Valley)
properties.address: Leyda, San Antonio, Valparaíso, Chile
properties.descrption: Proprietary cool-climate aromas of spicy meaty black fruits are suggestive of peas. While this is raw, choppy and bumpy in feel, it's not ponderous. Roasted salty meaty plum flavors are spicy, while this remains herbal in character but fresh on the finish.

properties.title: Podere Ciona 2010 Le Diacce Merlot (Toscana)
properties.address: Loc. Montegrossi, 17, 53013 Gaiole In Chianti SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice. The mature palate reveals prune and vanilla alongside rather evolved tannins. Enjoy soon.

properties.title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 1997 Miravalle-La Perla-Chevalier Red
properties.address: 2805 Spring Mountain Rd, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
