properties.title: Tobin James 2012 French Camp Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 8950 Union Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Hailing from the recently designated Paso Highlands subappellation, this hearty wine shows earthy aromas of nutmeg, iron, hot rocks, loam and cherry extract. It's lush and ripe with cassis and black cherry fruit, yet shows a more elegant chalkiness on the palate as well, rounded out by cocoa powder.

properties.title: Château Grivière 2012  Médoc
properties.address: La Cardonne, 33340 Ordonnac, France
properties.descrption: Ripe and luscious, this is full of red berry fruits and black plums. Soft tannins pulse through the rich texture, giving shape while not taking away from the open character of the wine. It will age relatively quickly, so drink from 2016.

properties.title: Château Haut-Simard 2012  Saint-Émilion
properties.descrption: A parcel within the Château Simard vineyard gives this wine that features plenty of fruitiness, with attractive acidity and black currant flavors. It also has structure, a touch of minerality and final, dry tannins, all of which will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Château La Grave à Pomerol 2012  Pomerol
properties.descrption: Smooth, ripe and easy, this wine brings out the fruitiness of the vintage. It has some dusty tannins, although it is so approachable and generous. Ripe berry fruits and soft acidity come through at the end. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Château la Louvière 2012  Pessac-Léognan
properties.address: 149 Av. de Cadaujac, 33850 Léognan, France
properties.descrption: Dry and structured, this dense wine has some austerity that comes from the dry tannins and extracted, bitter flavors. The aftertaste shows more of the tannins and dryness. Drink from 2020.

properties.title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2011  Médoc
properties.address: 56 Rte de Laujac, 33340 Bégadan, France
properties.descrption: Ripe and attractively fruity, this wood-aged wine has ripe tannins that are still firm and strong. The fruit is still young, full of black currant flavors and bright acidity. These elements give a wine that has structure and needs to age. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Château Loudenne 2012  Médoc
properties.descrption: With vineyards close to the Gironde, this is a well-situated château. This 2012 is one of the best from the property for several years, giving ripe tannins, balanced wood and good black currant acidity. It's not for long-term aging, so drink from 2017.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14111 NE 145th St, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: Aromas of smoked meat, mesquite, green olive and tire rubber meld with barrel spice accents. It's soft and supple in feel with abundant savory flavors—an interesting wine that has some edge.

properties.title: Château Trimoulet 2010  Saint-Émilion
properties.descrption: Big and beefy, this has layers of dark tannins lying over the big black plum fruit flavors. With a solid texture that comes from this rich, dense vintage, the wine is still developing. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Thurston Wolfe 2006 Dr. Wolfe's Family Red Red (Washington)
properties.address: 588 Cabernet Ct, Prosser, WA 99350, USA
properties.descrption: It's sappy and just a bit rustic, with layers of leather and saddle sweat along with sweet blueberry and blackberry fruit. There is nothing serious about this wine, but you can't help but enjoy it; it's a perfect choice for simple, lighter grilled foods on a hot summer day.

properties.title: Tiamo 2007 Sangiovese (Puglia)
properties.descrption: Here's a simple, slightly sweet sipping wine with plump red fruit, blueberry and cherry. The wine has nice density and tart flavors of sour cherry. It would work well with easy, stay-home meals.

properties.title: D'Arenberg 2005 d'Arry's Original Shiraz-Grenache (McLaren Vale)
properties.descrption: Starts off a bit leathery and lacking fruit, but somewhere along the way raspberries start folding into the otherwise savory mix of leather and black olives. Medium in body, turning tart and tea-like on the finish. Drink now-2012.

properties.title: Viña El Cerno 2006 Utopía Roble Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Dry and short on fruit, with strong barrel aromas of pepper, cinnamon and resin. In the mouth, there's more wood than fruit, leaving heat, vanilla and spice to overshadow mild strawberry/raspberry flavors. What's best about the wine is the mouthfeel; it's round and creamy, with length. Anyone averse to forward oak should steer clear of Utopía.

properties.title: Valle dell'Asso 2003 Negroamaro (Galatina)
properties.address: Contrada S. Martino, 10, 64032 Atri TE, Italy
properties.descrption: There's a slightly aged quality to this Negroamaro (with 15% Montepulciano) evident both in its granite color and its aromas of resin tar and licorice. 2003 was a difficult vintage and this wine is close to being past its prime: Drink now.

properties.title: Bouchaine 2006 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.descrption: Light in body, with flavors of cherries, cola, mint and peppery spices, this Pinot is dry and silky. It has a sharpness through the finish that suggests a bit of unripeness or stemminess.

properties.title: Conti Zecca 2006 Donna Marzia Negroamaro (Salento)
properties.address: Via Cesarea, 73045 Leverano LE, Italy
properties.descrption: This is a meaty and mature Negroamaro with ripe notes of black olive, earth and leather. It has raw, gritty tannins and chewy succulence with some bitter cherry on the close.

properties.title: Finca El Retiro 2006 Barrica Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Belgrano, A4427 Cafayate, Salta, Argentina
properties.descrption: Melted fudge and asphalt are draped on this young wine's bouquet. Given that opening, a palate of black plum and cassis isn't surprising. Feelwise, it's a touch rough and tannic, which is probably to be expected. Turns more herbal the more you sniff and swirl.

properties.title: Budini 2007 Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Creamy and rooty at first, and then smokier and darker as it settles. For young Malbec it displays both a jammy fruit side and an acidic center. So there's both ripeness and heft but also a piercing sizzle. Perfectly good for parties and less-serious imbibing.

properties.title: Casa Catelli 2005 Primitivo (Puglia)
properties.address: Via delle Conce, 35, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy
properties.descrption: This hearty Primitivo is ripe and  jammy with tones of black cherry preserves and blackberry pie. There are gritty tannins and a chewy feel that gives this wine power and succulence.

properties.title: C&T; 2006 Patio Pinot Noir (Napa-Sonoma)
properties.address: 201 NE De Bell Ave, Bartlesville, OK 74006, USA
properties.descrption: A little harsh in the mouth, with minty, peppery flavors and tart acids, but you'll find enough cherry and cola flavor to satisfy, and the structure is silky and light.

properties.title: Felipe Rutini 2006 Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Smoky and big on the nose, with crusty black-fruit flavors backing that up. The wine is less deep and more hard and scratchy than some Mendoza Malbecs, but it's solid and sure-footed even if the mouthfeel is stark. Probably better with food than others due to its leaner, less opulent style.

properties.title: Fernwood 2005 Small Vineyard Selection Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
properties.descrption: More like Zin than Merlot, a peppery, full-bodied wine with some ripe to overripe blackberry, cassis and raisin flavors. But even if it's not particularly varietal, it's a pretty good wine, with a long, rich finish.

properties.title: Fidelitas 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Even in his less-expensive wines, such as this Columbia Valley Merlot, winemaker Charlie Hoppes gets excellent color extraction. Along with the color come stiff, substantial tannins; once in the mouth, however, the wine sets a different course, turning rather light and fruity. Tart cherry and wild berry flavors quickly give way to thick tannins and barrel flavors of baking chocolate.

properties.title: Rutherford Grove 2006 Estate Merlot (Rutherford)
properties.address: 200 Rutherford Hill Rd, Rutherford, CA 94573, USA
properties.descrption: With its tough, gritty tannins and forward cherry, red currant, orange and raspberry flavors, this light-bodied Merlot will pair well with something savory and fatty.

properties.title: San Rustico 2004  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
properties.address: Via Pozzo, 2, 37020 Marano di Valpolicella VR, Italy
properties.descrption: This vintage of San Rustico's Amarone seems more closed and reserved compared to last year. You'll get broad spice aromas and ripe cherry fruit, but the estate's characteristic intensity is less evident. It's an easy and genuine wine overall that will pair with lamb or pork.

properties.title: Sonnet 2006 Amber Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: A lighter-style Pinot, in both mouthfeel and flavor. Silky and gentle in the mouth, it has pleasant flavors of cherry and raspberry pie filling, sprinkled with anise, cinnamon, ground cloves, pepper, orange zest and vanilla.

properties.title: Swanson 2005 Merlot (Oakville)
properties.descrption: Nothing subtle about this strongly flavored Merlot, which smacks of perfectly ripened red and black currants, toasty oak and violets. It's a big, flashy, full-bodied wine and also a very tannic one. Best to age for a few years, or at least give it long decanting.

properties.title: Three Rivers 2006 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)
properties.descrption: There's 5% Malbec in the blend, but the austere, scrapey tannins of the Franc still dominate the finish. The fruit is pretty, with blueberry character to burn. The wine hits the palate well in the beginning, but seems to sag a bit midpalate before heading into that astringent finish, enlivened by toasty new oak. If you like blueberries, you'll like this wine.

properties.title: J. Jacaman 2006 Manchester Ridge Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
properties.address: 11447 Old Redwood Hwy, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Made from a mountain vineyard close to the ocean, in an area that doesn't yet have its own appellation, this dry, crisp Pinot resembles a warmer Russian River bottling. It's ripe in jammy cherry and currant flavors that finish firmly tannic.

properties.title: Lafond 2006 SRH Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.descrption: A little light in body and flavor, with dried Provençal herb flavors and a hint of cherry. Does a yeoman's job of expressing basic Santa Rita Pinot Noir character at a price that's about half that of the top bottlings.

properties.title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2006 Redemption Zin Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.descrption: A dry, soft and exceptionally pure Zinfandel. With a light, silky texture, it offers plenty of jammy raspberry, cherry, currant, cola, vanilla and cinnamon spice flavors.

properties.title: Flying Goat Cellars 2006 2A Rio Vista Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 1520 E Chestnut Ct unit a, Lompoc, CA 93436, USA
properties.descrption: Pale in color, delicate in the mouth, this Pinot is marked by dry tannins and a brittle acidity. The fruit is comparatively modest by Santa Rita standards, showing currants, cherries and oranges. Could develop with a few years in the bottle.

properties.title: Ram's Gate 2012 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.address: 28700 Arnold Dr, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: From an estate vineyard site run by one of the region's finest farmers, this Pinot is intense and vibrant in juicy red cherry and raspberry, with earthiness at its core. Exuberant and robust on the palate, it puts its time in oak on full display, and finishes light and bright.

properties.title: Roar 2012 Garys' Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.descrption: Warm aromas of mocha powder and spicy white pepper mesh with the boysenberry jam foundation on this wine by the region's pioneering Franscioni family. The intriguing palate shows a lot of fennel, tarragon and black pepper, with ripe but tart boysenberry fruit and prominent lavender elements. This great wine shows the grape's herbal potential.

properties.title: Standing Sun 2011 G-S-M (Santa Barbara County)
properties.descrption: Despite his head-turning concert series at his Buellton winery, John Wright isn't losing sight of good winemaking. This Camp 4 Vineyard blend of 40% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 25% Mourvèdre offers an elegant nose of purple fruit, aromatic herbs and restrained woodiness. Elderberries and dried blueberries emerge once sipped, with cedar down the middle and pepper and Italian herbs on the edges.

properties.title: Syncline 2013 McKinley Springs Cinsault (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.descrption: This lightly colored, 100% varietal wine offers light notes of bubble gum, red fruit, cream and plum. The pillowy-soft, sumptuous mouthfeel is the star of the show, displaying a dazzling feel that leads to an elegant, lingering plum-filled finish.

properties.title: Two Vintners 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Coming from five different Syrah vineyards across the Columbia Valley, this wine offers high quality and value. It conveys black olives, iron, an earthy funk, chocolate and floral accents. The coffee and earth flavors are rich while still showing exquisite restraint.

properties.title: Brave & Maiden 2011 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.descrption: Olallieberry fruit, charred meats and a bit of oak smoke introduce the nose of this wine from a newly renamed vineyard in the middle of Santa Ynez Valley, where Paul Hobbs recently signed on as consultant. Flavors are led by tar and herbs, with ripe purple fruit and black pepper arising on the midpalate and finish.

properties.title: Flying Trout 2012 Mary's Block Windrow Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 3796 Peppers Bridge Rd, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: This 100% varietal wine is unabashedly appealing with pure, direct notes of coffee and plum. It's the feel that truly dazzles, with a supple velvety texture and a tart uptick on the lingering finish.

properties.title: Lone Madrone 2010 Old Hat Red (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 5800 Adelaida Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Grapes come from heritage selection off the Osgood farm, and the wine shows licorice-berry-chocolate syrup aromas, as well as espresso with condensed milk and pipe smoke. The tannins coat the mouth and tickle the tongue in a pleasant way, offering rich plum fruit, graphite minerality and lifting mint, all balanced with strong acidity.

properties.title: Pascual Toso 2012 Alta Syrah (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Exuberant maple and coconut aromas are forward and announce aggressive oak. In the mouth, this beefy Syrah is full but fresh, with resiny richness offset by cutting tannins and acidity. Blueberry and blackberry flavors are oaky and bring related vanilla and licorice notes in front of a lush finish.

properties.title: Heron Hill 2012 Ingle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 9301 Co Rd 76, Hammondsport, NY 14840, USA
properties.descrption: There's a gorgeous floral lift to this silky-smooth wine. Red cherry and raspberry flavors are penetrating and ripe, but brisk with an invigorating mineral touch. Finely grained tannins linger on the finish.

properties.title: Idilico 2012 Monastrell (Yakima Valley)
properties.descrption: With grapes from Upland Vineyard and aged in neutral French oak, this wine offers aromas of nori, cherry and tire rubber. It's supple and lithe in feel with explosive, concentrated umami flavors that shimmer with intensity, with olive notes on the finish. The aromas and flavors don't entirely marry at present but the feel simply dazzles.

properties.title: Las Positas 2010 Meritage (Livermore Valley)
properties.address: 1828 Wetmore Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.descrption: This is full bodied and ripe in flavor, while keeping a firmly tannic but supple texture. The concentrated black cherry and black currant notes are delicious, and hints of black pepper and smoke add complexity. It is very tasty to drink now and through 2017.

properties.title: Lisini 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.descrption: Earthy aromas of violet, mature berry, sage, tilled soil and a funky note of game lead the nose. The funky note carries over to the palate along with dried plum and white pepper. Youthfully austere tannins provide the backbone.

properties.title: Envolve 2012 Evoke Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 134 Church St, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: A cured meat, salami-like bouquet is the curious opening of this wine, making it compelling if not entirely varietal, a robust, full-bodied expression of rich, ripe red fruit. Oaky and burly, it'll satisfy palates that prefer a concentrated style of velvety-textured raspberry compote and cinnamon.

properties.title: Louis Latour 2012  Beaune
properties.address: 18 Rue des Tonneliers, 21200 Beaune, France
properties.descrption: This is soft and rounded, with attractive red plum and berry fruits that bring in acidity and a light tannic character. The wine is ripe, with a dry core surrounded by cherry flavors and fresh acidity. It is not a wine for long aging, drink from 2017.

properties.title: Puklavec & Friends 2013 Red (Macedonia)
properties.descrption: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has aromas of coffee, black cherry and dark chocolate. It is tart in the mouth, with flavors of cherry and red raspberry.

properties.title: Castillo De Feliciana 2012 Reserve Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 85728 Telephone Pole Rd, Milton-Freewater, OR 97862, USA
properties.descrption: White pepper, toffee and vanilla aromas are followed by full-bodied flavors backed by rustic tannins. It needs some hearty food alongside it to be properly enjoyed.

properties.title: Chilcas 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
properties.descrption: Punchy out of the chute, this smells mostly of dry herbs and spiced plum. It's fresh on the palate, with good body and modest depth. Juicy plum and red-currant flavors finish lightly oaked, with peppery spice and acidic tang.

properties.title: Santa Carolina 2014 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)
properties.address: Til Til 2228, Macul, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: Aromas of tomato, plum and spice are fresh and medium in intensity. Flavors of plum, olive, spice and mild oak finish with toasty barrel notes and a spot of licorice.

properties.title: Viña Casablanca 2014 Cefiro Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)
properties.descrption: Coffee, herbal berry and a light whiff of green herbs announce a solid, well-built wine, with flavors of olive, herbs, plum and blackberry. The finish is smooth, healthy, and a bit toasty.

properties.title: Treleaven 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Cayuga Lake)
properties.descrption: While muted on the nose, this surprisingly expressive Pinot Noir balances elegant black fruit against layers of fallen leaves and floral potpourri. It's a delicate, soft-spoken wine but memorable, finishing on feathery-soft tannins.

properties.title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2013 Cuvée François Signature Red (Côtes de Provence)
properties.address: 605 Rte de St Honoré, 83250 La Londe-les-Maures, France
properties.descrption: Earthy aromas lead to a wine that is still young and tannic, firm with a dry core and dark-chocolate flavors. It will be a concentrated wine as it develops, so wait until 2017.

properties.title: Vistamar 2011 Enki Red (Central Valley)
properties.descrption: This blend of Carmenère and Carignan opens with very woody, resiny aromas as well as black-fruit depth to support all that oak. An austere, oaky, acidic palate is drawing, while toasty, herbal, roasted berry flavors are resiny and salty tasting prior to an all-wood finish.

properties.title: Morandé 2012 Vigno Carignan (Maule Valley)
properties.address: Rosario Nte 615, Las Condes, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: An opening blitz of stalky, rustic, leathery berry aromas comes with overt oak. This is high in acidity, but with only average body weight it comes across raw and sharp. Bright, juicy red-fruit flavors vie with stalky, baked notes prior to a loamy finish that runs low on vibrancy.

properties.title: Napa Cellars 2013 V Collection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.descrption: There's a reduced, concentrated effect to this wine, a bold expression of the variety rich in tobacco and black tea, the fruit bittersweet and elusive. Tightly wound, it benefits from air and time in the glass, and will please a Cabernet lover's palate most of all.

properties.title: Elias Mora 2014  Toro
properties.descrption: Heady cherry and berry aromas are forwardly potent. This young, grippy Toro is tannic and taut on the palate. Gritty blackberry and burnt, toasty flavors finish rough, with grabby, pronounced tannins. Drink from 2017–2023.

properties.title: Famille Laplace 2014 Aydie l'Origine Tannat-Cabernet Franc (Madiran)
properties.address: 64330 Aydie, France
properties.descrption: This wine is already finely balanced, full of a combination of black fruits and acidity. Behind this fruitiness there are solid tannins, a dry core and a concentrated aftertaste where the Tannat shows well. Drink this ripe, full-bodied wine now.

properties.title: Fielding Hills 2013 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 565 S Lakeshore Rd, Chelan, WA 98816, USA
properties.descrption: Vanilla, clove, baking spice and dark fruit aromas lead to a palate plush with full ripe generous fruit and barrel flavors. It's a hedonistic delight, with the barrel influence playing a prominent role.

properties.title: Atwater 2015 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 5055 NY-414, Burdett, NY 14818, USA
properties.descrption: Juicy and ripe, this pretty dry rosé offers a bounty of black-plum and berry flavors glazed with caramelized sugar. Zippy acidity refreshes the midpalate guiding an invigorating cherry-blossom finish.

properties.title: Bedell 2014 First Crush Merlot-Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.descrption: Ethereally light and brisk, this cherry and anise-scented red offers loads of quaffability and elegance without a lot of complication. Briskly concentrated flavors of blackberry and currant are delightfully refreshing. It's pleasantly puckering and the finish is framed by fine yet persistent tannins. Drink now through 2019.

properties.title: Biondi Santi 2013  Rosso di Montalcino
properties.address: Unnamed Road, 53024, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Vibrant and elegantly structured, this has delicate aromas of red berry, blue flower, aromatic herb and a whiff of cooking spice. The luminous, rather austere palate shows sour cherry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of pipe tobacco alongside youthfully assertive but refined tannins and racy acidity. This is one of the rare Rossos that will get better after a few more years in bottle. Drink 2018–2023.

properties.title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2014 Damana 5  (Ribera del Duero)
properties.descrption: Aromas saturated with roasted berry fruits and leather lead to a firm palate with rough tannins. Savory plum and black cherry flavors finish with integrated spice notes. Given that 2014 was a difficult year throughout Spain, this wines is in good shape; drink through 2019.

properties.title: Château de Pizay 2015 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)
properties.address: 443 Rte du Château, 69220 Belleville-en-Beaujolais, France
properties.descrption: The 16th-century chateau of Saint Lager is on the slopes of the local landmark hill of Brouilly. The wine comes from vines below. It has spice, cherry and blueberry fruits with attractive acidity. The wine, still with a strong tannic edge, will be better from 2017.

properties.title: Château Laurou 2013 Les Complices Red (Fronton)
properties.address: 2250 Rte de Nohic, 31620 Fronton, France
properties.descrption: Half-and-half Négrette and Syrah, this is typical blend for Fronton with its hints of the Mediterranean mixed in with a more Atlantic influence. The wine is soft and balanced with dusty tannins, red fruits and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.

properties.title: Chilcas 2012 Reserva Syrah (Maule Valley)
properties.descrption: Earthy aromas of leather, coffee grounds and blackberry are convincing. This feels full and ripe. Toasty plum and blackberry flavors offer notes of licorice and toast on a long, balanced finish.

properties.title: DeTierra Vineyards 2010 Russell Estate Merlot (Monterey)
properties.address: Mission St &, 5th Ave, Carmel-By-The-Sea, CA 93921, USA
properties.descrption: Wild red berries, crushed pepper, lilacs and a frame of asphalt show on the exuberant nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with meat, smoke, cedar, charcoal and easy boysenberry flavors, the perfect pairing for a hamburger. It is a tad light in body, especially since it hasaged for so many years.

properties.title: Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Las Brisas Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
properties.address: Leyda, San Antonio, Valparaíso, Chile
properties.descrption: Spiced plum, dried raspberry and cherry-cough-drop aromas are attractive. This feels medium in body, with plumpness cut by fresh acidity. Flavors of dried cherry and baking spices finish solidly and smoothly.

properties.title: Ellman Family 2010 Jemma Red (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1461 1st St, Napa, CA 94559, USA
properties.descrption: Cabernet Sauvignon comprises 95% of the blend, along with 5% Merlot. Sourced from the Beckstoffer Georges III vineyard, this wine shows the enormous ripeness and softness that vineyard is known for, with rich, opulent black cherry jam and mocha flavors, balanced by acidity and tannins. There's a lot of new oak. Drink now–2018.

properties.title: Foursight 2011 Charles Vineyard Clone 05 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 14475 CA-128, Boonville, CA 95415, USA
properties.descrption: Foursight's 2011 Pinot, from a very cool vintage, is savory, with mushroom and herb alongside a streak of red cherry. Light in color and texture, it's subtle yet expansive on the palate, with a peppery, juicy finish. It's a wine that can be enjoyed now, but put some away for a couple of years and the seams will come together even better.

properties.title: Bründlmayer 2011 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
properties.address: Zwettler Str. 23, 3550 Langenlois, Austria
properties.descrption: Smoky cinnamon dominates the nose, on the palate where notes of red currant and cranberry become apparent. The palate is tightly gathered in its finely constructed, tannic frame. Time in glass reveals riper cherry fruit at the heart. In two to three years it will mellow and show its true aromatic colors. The substance is evident now, but the aromas bid you to wait. Ready from 2016.

properties.title: K Vintners 2010 Morrison Lane Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 820 Mill Creek Rd, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: The fruit is sourced from the first Syrah plantings in the Walla Walla valley. Tannic and dense, it marries plum fruit flavors to streaks of earth, herb and licorice. A hint of green olive comes into the finish, bolstered by high alcohol and sharp acidity.

properties.title: Rieflé 2011 Côte de Rouffach Pinot Noir (Alsace)
properties.address: 32 Rue de la Lauch, 68250 Pfaffenheim, France
properties.descrption: The weight of the bottle seems to foretell this wine's weight, structure and judiciously layered oak influence. With ripe cherry and berry flavors, it's a wine that can age. Drink from 2015.

properties.title: The Gardener 2012 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 3006 Rucker Ave, Everett, WA 98201, USA
properties.descrption: This is a good value for a Sonoma Coast Pinot of this quality. The wine is dry, crisp and clean, with complex flavors of raspberry jam, pomegranates and heirloom tomatoes, which lend a satisfying earthiness to the fruit. New French oak is applied judiciously, and crisp acidity gives it delicious bite.

properties.title: Uvaggio 2011 Barile Primitivo (Lodi)
properties.address: 820 Randolph St, Napa, CA 94581, USA
properties.descrption: Made in a completely different style from Uvaggio's typical Primitivo, this is meant to be a reserve-tier bottling, with seven months in new and once-used oak. Crisp berry flavor, along with a hint of cranberry, makes this juicy and balanced. It finishes softly on a slightly nutty note.

properties.title: Raats Family 2010 Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)
properties.descrption: Pure and focused, Bruwer Raats's love of and attention to Cabernet Franc results in a wine that always impresses, and is a bit of an anomaly in the South African wine world. Bright notes of red cherry and currant unfold on the nose and mouth, with accents of ashy tobacco, foliage, pepper and just the faintest suggestion of vanilla bean. Medium weight, with dry, dusty tannins that lend grip to the finish.

properties.title: Imagery 2010 Malbec (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
properties.address: 14335 Sonoma Hwy, Glen Ellen, CA 95442, USA
properties.descrption: This is one of the first wines to bear this new appellation in Sonoma County. More importantly, it's one of the best California Malbecs out there. It's rich and juicy with ripe cherries and mocha, along with a sweet coating of toasty oak. It's soft enough to drink now, especially with a great grilled steak.

properties.title: Joseph Cattin 2010 Steinbach Pinot Noir (Alsace)
properties.address: 35 Rue Roger Frémeaux, 68420 Vœgtlinshoffen, France
properties.descrption: Steinbach is a village at the extreme southern end of the Alsace vineyard, known for its Pinot Noir. This is a rich, full example—a wine that has structure and concentration, as well as ripe cherry fruitiness. It can be drunk now, or until 2022.

properties.title: Larner 2010 Estate Grown Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.descrption: The heat and glycerine of high alcohol are integral parts of this 100% Syrah. The wine is big, juicy, jammy and frankly delicious, offering endless waves of cassis, chocolate, blueberries, black licorice, black pepper and vanilla-scented oak that last through a long, spicy finish. Drink now–2016.

properties.title: Mas de la Dame 2011 Cuvée Gourmande Red (Les Baux de Provence)
properties.descrption: Solid and firmly tannic, this is a wine with forward red-fruit flavors, a dry core and dense texture. The structure of this balanced wine along with its concentration promise aging. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Nelms Road 2012 Merlot (Washington)
properties.address: 11920 US-12, Lowden, WA 99360, USA
properties.descrption: This is a fine bottle of Merlot, released under Woodward Canyon's second label, Nelms Road. Firm blackberry and cassis fruit flavors anchor a substantial wine that has accents of smoke, licorice, tar and toast. Delicious!

properties.title: Netzl 2011 Anna-Christina Red (Carnuntum)
properties.descrption: Toast and caramel notes mingle with mocha and dark plum flavors, resulting in a sleek wine with soft yet palpable tannins. As it opens up, soft plum and cherry fruit is revealed. The concentrated midpalate also signals that this will age and develop well.

properties.title: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Luckenwald Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)
properties.address: Untere Hauptstraße 49, 7122 Gols, Austria
properties.descrption: Toasty oak and backed structure appear first, with lots of charming cherry fruit and savory notes of undergrowth, inside. Tightly knit and well made, with a dense core of red cherry and an appetizing length.

properties.title: O•S Winery 2011 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Roughly two thirds Merlot and one third Cabernet Sauvignon, this is the finest O•S Red since their 2007 vintage. Dark fruits abound, soaked in flavors of espresso, cedar, licorice and clove. It's a splendid wine for the price, one to buy by the case.

properties.title: Patz & Hall 2012 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 917 Business 141 N, Pound, WI 54161, USA
properties.descrption: It's hard to imagine any Pinot Noir being richer or riper than this one, which is made from a blend of vineyards from throughout the county's cooler areas. It's explosive with jammy raspberries, cherries, boysenberries and pomegranates, along with plenty of new French oak for buttery, toasty complexities. It will hold for a year or three.

properties.title: Pennywise 2009 Merlot (California)
properties.descrption: Good cherry, cocoa and sweet oak flavors in this dry wine. It's too soft, lacking structure, but is a pretty good buy for the price.

properties.title: Picket Fence 2009 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Tough and acidic in the mouth, but with a nice silky texture, and the finish is dry. Shows cherry and raspberry flavors, alongside less ripe ones of green mint, with a touch of the veggies.

properties.title: Red Pony Ranch 2008 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.descrption: Give this young Pinot a few hours in a decanter to let it air. Right out of the bottle, it's tough and tight, with polished cherry and oak flavors. Drink now.

properties.title: Caliterra 2009 Bio-Sur Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
properties.address: Palmilla, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: Sweaty and murky smelling, with leather, horse and earthy berry aromas. The palate is big and dense, with grabby tannins and then herbal, roasted berry flavors with green notes. Finishes peppery and mildly green. An herbal, old-style Carmenère.

properties.title: Odfjell 2009 Armador Merlot (Maipo Valley)
properties.address: Padre Hurtado, Santiago Metropolitan Region, Chile
properties.descrption: Sharp on the nose, with herbal, cabbage-like aromas. The palate is better, albeit rubbery in feel and infiltrated by bitter notes. Along the way, there's reasonably good berry fruit and then a piquant bite to the finish. Improves with airing; has its merits.

properties.title: Seifried 2007 Pinot Noir (Nelson)
properties.address: 168 Redwood Road, Appleby 7081, New Zealand
properties.descrption: Starts off with appealing cherry and spice shadings, but adds some rustic, adhesive bandage notes that build on the finish.

properties.title: Taj 2008 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 1129 Northern Blvd #404, Manhasset, NY 11030, USA
properties.descrption: Tough and gritty, with uneven tannins and some minty green flavors alongside the cherries, mulberries and red currants. Not going anywhere, so drink up.

properties.title: Skouras 2006 Synoro Red (Peloponnese)
properties.address: Argous - Sternas Rd (10th Km), Malandreni, Argos 212 00, Greece
properties.descrption: Smoked sausage, raspberry and cherry spice start this exuberant red blend. The wine has an overall spicy character and a bigger, open style. Easy drinking and fun, pair it with grilled ribs or duck.

properties.title: Tortoise Creek 2009 The Chelonian Zinfandel (Lodi)
properties.descrption: Tortoise Creek makes bargain wines from the Languedoc region of France as well as from Lodi. “The Chelonian” is a new label a portion of the proceeds of which will go to the Chelonian Research Foundation to help benefit the conservation of turtles and tortoises. The wine itself is a decent representation of Lodi's bigger, more raisiny style.

properties.title: Graham Beck 2009 Pinotage (Western Cape)
properties.descrption: Red berries and blueberry mix with stewed rhubarb and a hint of sweet spice. The ripe berry flavors carry through to the mouth, but the finish reveals a hint of Band-Aid.

properties.title: Château la Fontaine de Genin 2009  Bordeaux
properties.descrption: Stalky, dry, with attractive black currant fruits and a light tannin character. Showing little sign of its potential richness.

properties.title: Château Sainte Barbe 2008 Merlot  (Bordeaux)
properties.descrption: Berry fruits and dense red jelly flavors are the hallmark of this wine. It is full, although edging on stalky, its black berry flavors mixed with acidity and dry tannins.

properties.title: Appollis 2009 Shiraz-Cinsaut-Mourvèdre Red (Wellington)
properties.descrption: Fruity and herbal all at once with aromas of kirsch and black cherry competing with notes of wet forest floor and wild game. Lightweight and drinkable with a clean, fruit-driven finish.

properties.title: Durigutti 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Pje. de la Reta s/n, M5549 Las Compuertas, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Bold, rubbery aromas of dark-berry fruits and toasty oak precede a hard-driving palate with smoky, peppery black-fruit flavors that pour on the oak and related espresso and toastiness on the finish. Drink this generous Malbec through 2019.

properties.title: El Nido 2012 Red (Jumilla)
properties.address: 30520 Jumilla, Murcia, Spain
properties.descrption: Giant out of the blocks, this full-bodied, midnight-black bruiser delivers a heavy blast of graphite, vanilla, coconut, char and blackberry on the nose. A heavy, tannic, borderline syrupy palate is appropriate for flavors of toasted coconut, vanilla and oak. A chocolaty finish loaded with barrel resin is rich and heady. This is an extracted heavyweight from a warm year. Some will love it; others will find it too oaky and overripe. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Domaine de Grand Garant 2014 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)
properties.address: 6475 NE Hilltop Ln, Dayton, OR 97114, USA
properties.descrption: With broad, ripe fruit this is a rich, generous wine. The acidity gives fresh support to the warm cherry and red plum fruits. Underneath, tannins offer a dry core to the wine, allowing it to age. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Enrique Mendoza 2012 La Tremenda Monastrell (Alicante)
properties.address: Camino del Romeral, 42, 03580 Romeral, Alicante, Spain
properties.descrption: A mixed bag of appealing aromas include crushed stone, leather, black cherry and cough drop. The palate on this Monastrell is narrow and pinchy, but packs power. Flavors of toasty oak, mint, black plum and cherry charge across the finish due to popping acidity. Drink through 2019.

properties.title: Ferreira 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
properties.descrption: This is a dry, dark and dense wine. It has concentrated tannins and intense fruit that gives power. Spice tones, a hint of blackberry fruits and a strong need for aging all promise a wine that will develop slowly. Drink from 2019.

properties.title: River's Edge 2013 Elkton Cuvée Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
properties.address: 1395 River Dr, Elkton, OR 97436, USA
properties.descrption: Nicely aromatic, this offers scents and follow-up flavors of cherry cola, with a dusting of sweet hay. It's authoritative without being over-amped—the classic iron fist in the velvet glove. Notes of earth and iron add interest to the finish.

properties.title: Round Pond 2014 Proprietary Rosato di Nebbiolo (Rutherford)
properties.address: 875 Rutherford Rd, Rutherford, CA 94573, USA
properties.descrption: Made from 100% Nebbiolo, this wine is copper-orange in color, with a sense of candied peach, melon and orange peel on the front palate. Slightly spritzy and vibrant in acidity, it finishes dry and crisp, ready for another sip.

properties.title: Senses 2013 Hillcrest Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Smooth and delicious, this has vibrant cherry and raspberry aromas, a mouthfilling, supple texture and generous fruit flavors. Aged in 35% new French oak, the wine seems to build and intensify on the palate and linger on the finish.

properties.title: Siduri 2013 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 235 Healdsburg Ave, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: This young wine is finding its way, tight and grippy still, with a strong sense of oak and tannin. Leathery and savory, with a suggestion of the rustic, it offers a crispness of black cherry and plum on the finish. Drink now after a slight decanting.

properties.title: Bergström 2013 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
properties.address: 8115 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115, USA
properties.descrption: This is identified as the smallest estate vineyard, here delivering a light and pretty wine, perfectly proportioned in a small frame. Strawberry and raspberry fruit shows clean, crisp acidity. There is room for further bottle development; at the moment the wine does a quick, gentle fade.

properties.title: Valentin Bianchi 2011 Particular Malbec
properties.address: Ruta 143 y calle Valentín San Rafael Mendoza AR, Bianchi, M5600 BCJ, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Oak-based aromas of coffee, mocha, lemon peel, graphite and vanilla set up a wide-bodied, resiny palate with toasty, baked flavors of blueberry, cassis, blackberry and pepper. This midnight-black Malbec feels ripe, pure and consistent on the finish. Drink through 2018.

properties.title: Vie Winery 2012 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Los Carneros)
properties.descrption: From a rare vineyard growing the variety in Carneros, this wine has a pleasing rustic nature, with characteristics of leather and salty black olive knotted around juicy blackberry and blueberry. Remaining vibrant on the palate rather than heavy, the acidity balanced, it shows bacon and oak on the finish.

properties.title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Belairissime le Py  (Morgon)
properties.address: 1086 Rue Bruce, Dunham, QC J0E 1M0, Canada
properties.descrption: A big and dense wine, this is concentrated and mineral in character, reflecting the granite soils of the Côte de Py. It's concentrated with its black-cherry flavors cut by bright acidity and a tight texture. The fruit needs to assert itself more, so wait until 2018 before drinking.

properties.title: Zaca Mesa 2012 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.address: 6905 Foxen Canyon Rd, Los Olivos, CA 93441, USA
properties.descrption: A juicy nose of ripe pomegranates, warm cranberries, concentrated strawberry blossoms and a bit of smoked herbs makes for an enticing introduction on this wine from one of the region's earliest producers. The palate shows cola, blackberry juice and a lavender lift. It's a perfect hamburger pairing.

properties.title: Balletto 2014 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Light and pretty pinkish-orange in color, this crisp wine offers candied grapefruit and strawberry, made from both whole-cluster pressed grapes and a bleed off from the producer's regular fermentation. It dances in acidity, remaining bright and fresh on the palate throughout.

properties.title: Milbrandt 2010 Sentinel Red Wine Northridge Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 707 US-2 unit d, Leavenworth, WA 98826, USA
properties.descrption: Mostly Cabernet Sauvignon (94%) along with Malbec and Petit Verdot, it has the flavor of a Mounds bar with sweet notes of chocolate and coconut along with dark cherry, herbs, and moist soil. It's rich and full bodied with tannins adding a gritty mouthfeel.

properties.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: The latest Merlot release from Ethos pushes the alcohol up past 15%, and the wine remains stubbornly closed and tannic, even after several hours of breathing time. Blueberry and cassis fruit are in play, though the tannins take over quickly, leading into a finish with some chalky minerality.

properties.title: Château Trolliet Lafite 2010 Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
properties.address: Petit Caillou, 24500 Sadillac, France
properties.descrption: A structured wine that has berry fruits, black currants and a firm, dry core of tannins. It has the weight, texture and richness of the vintage, with a solid future as it rounds out and softens. Drink from 2015.

properties.title: Clos des Bachelards 2010  Fleurie
properties.address: Château des Bachelards lieu dit Les Bachelards, 69820 Fleurie, France
properties.descrption: A very perfumed wine, almost heady, with its herbal and wild flower aromas. The wine is still closed up, darkly tannic and very firm. At the same time, black fruits show the same perfumed character. This is very flavorful and structured. Drink this unusual wine from 2014.

properties.title: Domaine Dupré 2012 Vignes de 1935  (Morgon)
properties.descrption: A wine that has good concentration from the very old vines along with red cherry fruits and some tight, mineral acidity. The banana character does spoil the overall ripe, full effect, so give the wine another year for this to disappear. Acidity and tannins do promise this aging.

properties.title: Fabien Collonge 2012 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)
properties.descrption: This structured, full and ripe wine shows great cherry fruits, some chewy tannins and a delicious juicy character. It is balanced and with its tannins should age. Drink now and until 2017.

properties.title: Furthermore 2010 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
properties.descrption: Woodsy and thickly textured, this Weir Pinot is balanced in just-ripe cherry goodness that neatly scrapes the edge of sour-ness. Fine earth and herbal overtones show off its varietal qualities, more typical of its warmer climate than the Deep End of Anderson Valley.

properties.title: Marchiori & Barraud 2011 Malbec (Perdriel)
properties.descrption: Smoky aromas of jerky, bacon and ham blend with plum and raspberry. As you should expect from higher-end Malbec, this feels full and earthy but also chunky and undefined. Flavors of baked berry fruits carry a mild herbal hint, while the finish is earthy and chocolaty.

properties.title: Mastroberardino 2011 Aglianico (Campania)
properties.address: Via Manfredi, 75-81, 83042 Atripalda AV, Italy
properties.descrption: From one of southern Italy's leading producers, this hearty Aglianico offers earthy aromas of just-turned soil and blackberry. The delicious palate has a ripe core of black cherry accented with white pepper and balsamic notes. It's polished, round and very enjoyable now so drink soon.

properties.title: Marqués de Riscal 2008 Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.address: C. Torrea Kalea, 1, 01340 Elciego, Álava, Spain
properties.descrption: Dry, fresh aromas of red fruits come across crisp and racy. The palate follows the nose's lead with medium weight and traditional snappy acidity. Flavors of plum, berry and cassis are clean, while the finish shows some richness via molasses and oaky notes.

properties.title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
properties.address: 4326 Big Ranch Rd, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: Front-loaded with cherries, violets, red currants and mocha, this Merlot isn't just about flavor. It also has depth and length, in other words a complexity that lifts it above the average. It's already throwing some sediment, suggesting that even a year or two in the bottle will help it mellow.

properties.title: Red Sky 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Washington)
properties.descrption: Excellent fruit sources (Conner Lee and Boushey vineyards) provide the highlights here. Dense, dark, toasty and flavorful, this is loaded with ripe blackberry, black cherry and fig flavors. Good concentration and power throughout.

properties.title: Savage Grace 2012 Syrah-Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 19501 144th Ave NE Suite F1100, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: This young red blend marries sweet raspberry and blueberry fruit to peppery, drying tannins. It's drinking well already, and should continue to over the next 3–5 years.

properties.title: Script & Seal 2010 Syrah (Washington)
properties.descrption: Syrah is the best of the Script & Seal offerings, showing sharp-toned flavors of cassis, licorice, tobacco and ultra-dark chocolate.

properties.title: Bodega Noemía de Patagonia 2012 J. Alberto Single Vineyard Malbec (Río Negro Valley)
properties.descrption: he bouquet smells jammy and not that exciting. In the mouth, freshness takes over, but the acidity is hard. Flavors of wild berry are spicy and continue into the finish, with oak making itself known.

properties.title: Bodega Patritti 2010 Chúcaro Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Patagonia)
properties.address: -38.597623, -68.258987, Neuquén, Argentina
properties.descrption: Rooty aromas are ripe on one hand and lighty herbal on the other. This feels focused and crisp, with good structure and tannins in front of raspberry and cassis flavors. For the most part this is on the money, even with a finish that's flat in feel and earthy in flavor. The blend is 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Malbec.

properties.title: Jackson Estate 2014 Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 5007 Fulton Rd, Santa Rosa, CA 95403, USA
properties.descrption: This rich, mouth-filling wine starts with almost-sweet floral, plummy, oaky aromas, building toward ripe cherry, strawberry and black plum flavors and a smooth texture. Everything, from its deep color to its lingering finish, suggests a bold personality.

properties.title: Mvemve Raats 2014 MR de Compostella Red (Stellenbosch)
properties.descrption: This blend of 45% Cabernet Franc, 18% Malbec, 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot opens with attractive green, herbal notes of peppercorn, laurel, blackcurrant leaf and plum skin. Smooth at first, with ripe plum and berry flavors on the palate, the fine tannins offer a pronounced yet dusty grip throughout the long, dry finish. It's a well-balanced wine that should continue to gain complexity through 2022.

properties.title: Talisman 2014 Weir Vineyard Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
properties.descrption: Deep black plum and black cherry flavors lend fruit concentration to this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine from a tiny hilltop appellation in Mendocino County. Its dark fruit flavors are quite ripe but not sweet, and a good wrapping of fine-grained tannins supports the richness very well.

properties.title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
properties.address: 7525 Orcutt Rd, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, USA
properties.descrption: From one of the larger estates in the Edna Valley, this wine has sweet-smelling plum, cherry candy and grenadine aromas. The palate is front-loaded with sagebrush, thyme, dried lavender and rosemary notes, while a hibiscus flavor unfolds in the background.

properties.title: Cowhorn 2013 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)
properties.descrption: Black as coal, with a heavy, smoky, meaty nose, this is one of a growing number of excellent biodynamic Syrahs from Oregon. It marries tangy acids to chewy red and blue fruits, with streaks of coffee liqueur and caramel latté. Half was whole-cluster fermented, and it all spent time in 50% new French oak.

properties.title: Decroux 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.descrption: Subtle aromas of mulberry, mace and vanilla meet with more intriguing notes of animal blood, rust and iodine on the nose of this bottling by Jennifer Hoage. Snappy and tart raspberry pops on the palate alongside forest underbrush and sandalwood. It's a great, balanced and even-handed entry point for those looking to explore the less ripe side of the grape.

properties.title: Decroux 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.descrption: Exotically spiced mulberry and red currant aromas meet sumac, clove and sweet rose petal scents on the nose of this bottling from a promising new project by Jennifer Hoage. The palate blends dried sage, juniper and pine needle flavors with cherry and red plum fruit, showing complexity but a light texture.

properties.title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.address: 4 Quai Antoine Ferchaud, 33250 Pauillac, France
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. Big and densely ripe, this is an impressive wine. It has balanced weight, fine acidity and a sense of richness. Offering all the right elements, this is going to be a great wine.

properties.title: Château Montrose 2012 La Dame de Montrose Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a full and opulent wine comprised of 76% Merlot. The palate has weight, and coffee and black-plum flavors that lend richness and a smoky, spicy character.

properties.title: Château Talbot 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.address: Château Talbot, 33250 Saint-Julien-Beychevelle, France
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. This wine is heavily influenced by ample new-wood aging. It's deliciously juicy with black currant and plum fruits balanced by swathes of refreshing acidity at the end.

properties.title: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. With so much spicy fruit, intensely ripe blackberry flavors and solid tannins, all the elements of excellence are here, and powered by a firm structure. This wine has weight and a fine Cabernet concentration.

properties.title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2012 Les Pagodes de Cos Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. This wine boasts big chocolate character along with ripe fruit. The palate is solid and generous with rounded Merlot flavor. It has remarkable weight with tannins surrounded by layers of delicious fruit.

properties.title: Château Duhart-Milon 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. While initially severe with chocolate and dark coffee flavors, ripe fruitiness comes through on the mid palate. It's full bodied and dense in tannins, but a solid wine showing the continuing development of this property.

properties.title: Château Gloria 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. Solid and concentrated, this wine certainly shows great dryness as well as fruit. It has power and density, and a texture that balances new wood as well as the fruitiness.

properties.title: Château Langoa Barton 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.address: France, Saint-Julien-Beychevelle, Chateau Langoa Barton
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. There's great concentration here, on this powerful wine with very dry structure and dark character. The palate hints of a more perfumed character with fine fruitiness and lingering freshness on the finish.

properties.title: Château Gruaud Larose 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.address: 33250 Saint-Julien-Beychevelle, France
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. With so much spicy fruit, intensely ripe blackberry flavors and solid tannins, all the elements of excellence are here, and powered by a firm structure. This wine has weight and a fine Cabernet concentration.

properties.title: Chateau La Tour Carnet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. Wood and mint aromas yield a wine that is darkly tannic, with a distinct black-coffee flavor. It's a powerful, concentrated wine with fruit hiding behind the dense structure.

properties.title: Clos du Marquis 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.descrption: 92–94. Barrel sample. Made from grapes grown in a specific parcel in the Léoville Las Cases vineyard, Clos du Marquis is a ripe wine that's also promises seriously good aging. Tannins and structure dominate the black fruits and acidity.

properties.title: Château Beaumont 2012 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: 28 Rue Beaumont Nord, 33460 Cussac-Fort-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a densely tannic wine with juiciness showing quite tardily through the tannins. The wine has a very dry, firm character with acidity that finishes on a bright, fresh note.

properties.title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. There's a dry character to this wine. It's concentrated in tannins with a bitterness that leads to a new-wood and spice character. The fruit is still in the background here.

properties.title: Château Belgrave 2012 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. Rich blackberry fruits are surrounded by a dense structure on this wine. The palate is ripe, but balanced with acidity, juiciness and a solid concentrated character.

properties.title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. Rich, smooth mint and polished tannins give this wine a ripe, opulent feel. It benefits from the fine Cabernet of Pauillac, which adds structure and juicy black currant acidity.

properties.title: Château Le Boscq 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.address: Château Bosq, 33180 Saint-Estèphe, France
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. Showing both a firm tannic structure and jammy black fruits, this is a finely ripe and full wine. It has spice, sweet fruits and a solid tannic core. A wine that is likely to age well.

properties.title: Château Le Crock 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. From the same stable as Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien, this is a finely structured, ripe and serious wine. It has dark tannins, big blackberry fruitiness and a generous while firm character.

properties.title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.address: Chateau Ducru-Beaucaillou, 33250 Saint-Julien-Beychevelle, France
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. This wine is the second wine of Ducru-Beaucaillou, sourced from a vineyard in the heart of Saint-Julien. It's rich and dense, with plenty of firm tannins. The fruit is already delicious and ripe with black currant and berries.

properties.title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2012 Carruades de Lafite Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.address: 33250 Pauillac, France
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a rich and soft wine made predominantly from Merlot. The wine has good depth of flavor with fresh black currants and soft tannins.

properties.title: Château Pichon Longueville 2012 Les Tourelles de Longueville Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.address: D2, 33250 Pauillac, France
properties.descrption: 91–93. Barrel sample. There is a fine depth of flavor here, with solid tannins as well as ripe fruit. This second wine of Château Pichon Longueville is packed with the vintage's hallmark of perfumed black-currant fruit.

properties.title: Château Capbern Gasqueton 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.address: 1355 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This wine is very smoky with firm tannins typical of Saint-Estèphe. Layers of fruit surround the core of dryness in the heart of the wine. Floral and fragrant, the wine finishes with good acidity.

properties.title: Château d'Armailhac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
properties.address: 33250 Pauillac, France
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This fruity wine is soft and open with flavors of ripe red-berry fruits and fresh acidity. It's expressive with immediately attractive tannins.

properties.title: Château Peyrabon 2012 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This wine is made from property owned by the Bernard family of Domaine de Chevalier in Pessac-Léognan. It's a finely-made wine with great acidity and swathes of blackberry fruits. Well balanced and likely to age.

properties.title: Château Sérilhan 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.address: 5 Rue Edouard Herriot, 33180 Saint-Estèphe, France
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This dense, structured and solidly tannic wine is balanced by dark black fruits that are juicy and ripe. The wine will always be dry, mineral and fairly severe in style.

properties.title: Château Lamarque 2012 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a dark, extracted wine with coffee flavors and dense tannins. The palate has a bitter character to it, and a structure that's very firm and dry.

properties.title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2012 Le Petit Lion de Léoville las Cases Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
properties.descrption: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a ripe and fruity wine with smooth tannins within a densely-textured palate. It's weighty in the mouth with richness, elegance and a purity of character. The acidity on the finish is already delicious.

properties.title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2012 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)
properties.address: Château Mouton Rothschild, 33250 Pauillac, France
properties.descrption: This wine is soft and fruity with ripe berry fruits and gentle tannins. For a major second wine, it's surprisingly easy and soft, developing fast with its berry fruits, chocolate and wood flavors at the end. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2012  Médoc
properties.address: 1 Montignac, 33340 Civrac-en-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: For the vintage, this is a ripe, bold wine. Layers of delicious black fruits are supported by firm tannins and the right amount of wood aging. Balanced and dense, it will age well. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Château Teyssier 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
properties.descrption: Big and dry, this wine shows the tannic, firm character of the vintage. It has a dark, dense core of wood tannins while the juicy black currant fruit is still developing. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.

properties.title: Château Teyssier 2012  Saint-Émilion
properties.descrption: This shows both the fruit of the vintage and a more structured tannic side. Black currant flavors are up front, offering a generous feeling. They are balanced by the backdrop of tannins and tight acidity. Together they make a wine that is concentrated and likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Citille di Sopra 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.descrption: Aromas of forest floor, Mediterranean herb, dark berry, turned soil and game mingle in the glass. The tight palate delivers clove, ground white pepper, grilled herb and dried black cherry alongside bracing tannins.

properties.title: Columbia Crest 2012 Grand Estates Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 178810 WA-221, Paterson, WA 99345, USA
properties.descrption: Aromatically pleasing, this suggests fresh blueberry pie, with a whiff of smoked meat. It's straightforward with huckleberry and mocha flavors, trailing slightly toward the finish.

properties.title: Domaine de la Solitude 2012  Pessac-Léognan
properties.address: Rte de Bédarrides, 84230 Châteauneuf-du-Pape, France
properties.descrption: While this wine is lean initially, it also shows weight and the potential of ripe fruits. Concentrated tannins still allow room for a little juicy fruit. The overall effect is of structure triumphing over fruitiness. Made by the team at Domaine de Chevalier, the wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2019.

properties.title: Domiciano de Barrancas 2012 Cosecha Nocturna Syrah (Mendoza)
properties.address: Maipú, Mendoza Province, Argentina
properties.descrption: This meaty, ripe Syrah is smoky and deep on the nose, with lusty berry aromas. The palate is tannic but supported by bold, fleshy blackberry flavors backed by maple, vanilla and burnt toast. Caramel richness makes its way onto the finish, which is rocky and tannic but tastes good. This value Syrah was built for grilled meat.

properties.title: Riglos 2012 Quinto Malbec (Tupungato)
properties.address: Km 32, RP15, M5509, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Jammy, reduced aromas of cassis, blueberry and animal hide lead to a juicy, fresh palate that's not too thick or concentrated. Blackberry and blueberry flavors are lightly peppered, while the finish is quick and light for Malbec. This is a new wine that aims at freshness and simple fruit more than power and weight.

properties.title: Urbina 2001 Reserva Especial  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: This rusty-colored Rioja shows funky aromas of leather mixed with hints of rose petal. A good mouthfeel with smooth tannins is suggestive of aged Burgundy or Merenzao (Trousseau), while rooty, earthy flavors of leaves and tea are interesting. Drink now.

properties.title: Carpineto 2012 Valcolomba  (Maremma Toscana)
properties.descrption: This lively Merlot from Coastal Tuscany conveys aromas of blackberry, spice and a whiff of underbrush. The juicy palate offers crushed black cherry, red currant and a note of white pepper alongside soft tannins. Enjoy it soon to capture the fresh fruit sensations.

properties.title: Convento de Las Claras 2012  Ribera del Duero
properties.descrption: Bright cherry aromas are youthful and draw you in. In the mouth, this young RDD is clampy and fresh. Plum, wild berry and salty notes define the flavor profile, while the finish is full in feel and reflective of a well-made Tinto Fino.

properties.title: Hamilton 2010 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: This wine doesn't seem to have fully ripened. Aromas that veer into the green compete with coffee, plum and woodspice. It's light and soft but concentrated in flavor, making up for any aromatic deficiencies.

properties.title: I Botri 2007 Vigna I Botri  (Maremma Toscana)
properties.descrption: Aromas recall forest floor, mature black-skinned fruit, leather, resin and tilled earth. The warm, round palate doles out ripe red cherry marinated in spirits, cinnamon, carob and grilled herb alongside polished tannins. It's extremely accessible so enjoy soon.

properties.title: Jamieson Ranch 2013 Light Horse Pinot Noir (California)
properties.address: 3105 Silverado Trail, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: A smoky, oaky aroma leads to meaty flavors with notes of rhubarb and red cherries. The texture is on the soft side and the body is medium. On the finish those oaky notes meld with the fruit for a soft finale. The grapes for this vintage come 84% from Paso Robles.

properties.title: Mark Ryan 2012 The Dissident Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: This blend holds 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot, 12% Malbec, 11% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, all from top Red Mountain vineyards. The wine shows notes of dried herbs, bay leaf, red fruit and dark plum. Considering the fruit sources, it's surprisingly reserved in its styling, very easy drinking with a light squeeze of tannins and a lingering finish.

properties.title: Máté 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.address: Strada Comunale di Santa Restituta, 53024 Sant'Angelo In Colle SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Leather, toasted oak, dried red fruit and plum cake lead the nose on this hearty Brunello. The robust palate offers jammy dark berry, dried plum, toasted wood, clove, savory herb and licorice alongside a tightly woven network of firm, astringent tannins. You'll also detect the heat of alcohol on the finish.

properties.title: Minassian-Young 2012 Estate Syrah (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: This dry-farmed whopper of a wine, which is boosted with 10% Counoise and 10% Mourvèdre, offers rich aromas of blueberry, pine sap and mushrooms. It proves tremendously lush on the palate, with jammy, ripe fruit, picking up tannins and a tiny bit of acidity to approach balance in the midpalate. It's for those who prefer power to finesse.

properties.title: Patterson 2012 Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 19501 144th Ave NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: A first varietal offering from this winery, this offers notes of green herbs, bell pepper and wood spices. It's satiny in feel with plum flavors with the oak giving some chalkiness to the tannins.

properties.title: Red Tail Ridge 2012 Obscure Red Varietal Series RTR Estate Vineyard Teroldego (Finger Lakes)
properties.descrption: Smoke and granite lend earthiness to luscious black cherry and plum flavors in this bold, powerfully constructed Teroldego. Framed with tannins and a dusting of licorice and spice, it's a highly promising wine made from an unusual Italian grape variety.

properties.title: Trapiche 2012 Broquel Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Cola, blackberry and dusty aromas amount to something nice and inviting. Cab Franc is new to the Broquel lineup, and this is lush, bold and fruity in style, with blackberry, black cherry and mocha flavors in front of a toasty, full-throttle finish.

properties.title: Agricola Punica 2012 Barrua Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)
properties.descrption: Made with 85% Carignano, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this open with aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and oak. The soft, round palate offers fleshy black cherry, black currant, licorice and ground pepper alongside soft acidity and smooth, silky tannins. Drink through 2020.

properties.title: Ascheri 2011  Barolo
properties.address: Via G. Piumati, 23, 12042 Bra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of ripe berry, forest floor and a whiff of cake spice mingle in the glass. The ripe, structured and surprisingly friendly palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, white pepper and clove. Packed but refined tannins along with fresh acidity offer support and provide balance. Drink 2016–2023.

properties.title: Brecon Estate 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Deep and dark blueberry fruit is laced with dark spices and clove extract on the nose of this two-grape wine by Welshman Damian Gridley. It's soft and juicy on the hedonistic palate, with a spicy acidity that lingers long and a touch of dill for decent complexity.

properties.title: Buena Vista 2012 The Aristocrat Red (Calistoga)
properties.address: 18000 Old Winery Rd, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Mouthfillingly juicy and jammy, this is a big, muscular red blend, dense and concentrated in red and blue fruit. Approachable and accessible, with a mellow structure, it finishes thick in wild vanilla.

properties.title: Icardi 2012 Montubert  (Barbaresco)
properties.descrption: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched soil, raisin, game and a hint of baking spice. The palate is fresher, showing dried black cherry, vanilla, mocha and Mediterranean herb alongside youthfully bracing tannins.

properties.title: John Duval Wines 2012 Plexus Shiraz-Grenache-Mourvèdre G-S-M (Barossa Valley)
properties.address: Artisans of Barossa, 24 Vine Vale Rd, Tanunda SA 5352, Australia
properties.descrption: Like all the Duval wines, this is amply structured. Cedar and vanilla notes frame dark fruit flavors in this blend of 51% Shiraz, 30% Grenache and 19% Mourvèdre. Its full bodied, with a long, dusty finish. Drink now–2022.

properties.title: La Posta 2014 Armando Bonarda (Mendoza)
properties.address: 2322 N Broadway Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73103, USA
properties.descrption: Cherry and plum aromas are ripe, sweet and inviting. There's plenty of body and roundness to this Bonarda, while exotic blueberry and boysenberry flavors finish fresh, with a light herbal aftertaste. Overall this shows lots of fruit and good balance.

properties.title: Livio Voghera 2012  Barbaresco
properties.descrption: Still young and nervous, this opens with aromas of resin, pressed rose petal, dark berry and a whiff of coffee. The tightly packed palate offers a ripe black cherry core backed up by notes of sage and anise. It's still tense, with youthfully assertive tannins that need to loosen up. Drink 2018–2025.

properties.title: MacLaren 2012 Samantha's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 211 Adobe Canyon Rd, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.descrption: Since 2009, the producer has sourced from this site, a relatively warm pocket of the northern reaches of the appellation. Vibrant in red cherry fruit, it's also layered and velvety smooth, with astructure and density that makes it complex and compelling. The fruit dances in blackberry as well as strawberry, with a subtle herbal undertone.

properties.title: Mitolo 2012 7th Son Grenache-Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.address: 141 McMurtrie Rd, McLaren Vale SA 5171, Australia
properties.descrption: The blend of 56% Grenache and 40% Shiraz also includes 4% Sagrantino, said to enhance structure. For its size, the wine is remarkably restrained, combining slightly resinous cherry fruit with hints of cinnamon, clove and mint. The finish is supple, suggesting early drinkability. Enjoy now–2017.

properties.title: Pala 2012 S'arai Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)
properties.descrption: Ripe and chewy, this earthy wine opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, scorched soil, grilled herb and game. The big, round palate doles out ripe blackberry, spiced blueberry, licorice and ground pepper alongside velvety tannins.

properties.title: Tenute Sella 2007 San Sebastiano allo Zoppo  (Lessona)
properties.address: Via IV Novembre, 128/130, 13853 Lessona BI, Italy
properties.descrption: A blend of 85% Nebbiolo and 15% Vespolina, this opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, leather, game and perfumed berry. The gamey notes carry over to the palate along with dried cherry, baking spice, mint, rosemary and mineral. Polished tannins balance out the rustic sensations. Drink through 2022.

properties.title: Harper Voit 2013 Perrydale Hills Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 707 NE 5th St, McMinnville, OR 97128, USA
properties.descrption: This sports some chewy, herbaceous qualities that hit you right away. That intensity puts the focus on the wine's edges rather than its core fruit flavors of rhubarb and cranberry. Tight and stiff, it's got a puckery bite that suggests further bottle age may be a good idea.

properties.title: Jefferson Vineyards 2012 Meritage (Virginia)
properties.descrption: A blend of about 50% Petit Verdot mixed with Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine shows ample breadth and concentration on the nose and palate. Aromas and flavors of ripe forest berries give way to dried hay and streaks of graphite. Silky upon entry, the midplalate is supported by sandy, soft tannins and a driving acid backbone.

properties.title: Maldonado 2012 Los Olivos Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1307 Lincoln Ave, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.descrption: This is a big, bold wine with a wild, slightly earthy and herbal character in the otherwise ripe blackberry and spicy pepper aromas and flavors. The texture is quite thick with tannins, and the body is full. It comes from the windy and cool Jameson Canyon corner of Napa Valley.

properties.title: Aril 2008 Syrah (Atlas Peak)
properties.address: 860 Napa Valley Corporate Way # C, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: Atlas Peak's reputation for Syrah can only grow as a result of this wine. It shows the massively dense fruit and firm mountain tannins of the appellation, as well as the ageability of Atlas Peak Cabernet Sauvignon, with which this Syrah could easily be confused. It has the blackberries and cherries and cassis, but that peppery, beef jerky sweetness is perhaps the giveaway. Cellar until at least 2014.

properties.title: Bodegas Leda 2005 Leda Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
properties.address: C. Mayor, 48, 47320 Tudela de Duero, Valladolid, Spain
properties.descrption: Early on it displays mild heat and jamminess, but with airing everything settles, and ultimately this old-vines Tempranillo from the lauded winemaker Mariano Garcia excels. The palate is rich, minerally and meaty, with slightly syrupy black fruit flavors, molasses and chocolate. Chewy, tannic and pure on the finish, with hints of herbs and lemon peel. Drink now through 2013.

properties.title: Allegrini 2004 La Poja Corvina (Veronese)
properties.descrption: This is a gorgeous wine with loads of intensity and personality derived from the native Corvina grape of Valpolicella, Italy. It's amazingly rich and smooth with long-lasting flavors of maraschino cherry, Indian spice and cola.

properties.title: Andriano 2007 Gant Riserva Merlot (Alto Adige)
properties.address: Wehrburgstraße, 5, 39010 Andrian, Autonome Provinz Bozen - Südtirol, Italy
properties.descrption: This Riserva expression of Merlot from cool-climate Alto Adige delivers fantastic intensity and purity. The aromas of cherry, spice, leather and red rose are chiseled and crisp. The wine is soft and velvety in the mouth with a long parade of berry fruit flavors on the long finish. Serve this wine with sophisticated meat dishes or cellar age five to ten more years.

properties.title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2007 Adrianna Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Cobos S/N, M5509 Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Fruity, pure and smooth on the nose, and maybe more dry and leathery than the blasting Nicasia vineyard wine. The palate has a deep, classy elegance along with power, and the flavors run toward huge black fruits, coffee and chocolate. Finishes dark, long and minerally, and overall it's yet another awesome top-flight Malbec from this world-class winery. Drink now through 2014.

properties.title: Stephen Ross 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 178 Suburban Rd, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, USA
properties.descrption: A stunningly delicious Pinot Noir, opulent in raspberry, cherry, red currant, red licorice, cola and beef jerky flavors. Impossible not to be impressed by the richness, yet the tannin-acid structure is wonderful and bracing. Doesn't seem likely to age well, so drink now.

properties.title: Viña Cobos 2007 Marchiori Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Young, fiery and rugged on the nose, but with exotic notes that suggest Middle Eastern and Asian herbs and spices. Like all Cobos Malbecs, this is big, chewy, brawny and a touch medicinal, with powerful dark fruit flavors, particularly black cherry, and a good deal of licorice, chocolate and overall richness. Handles its 15% alcohol better than many heavyweights; drink now through 2013.

properties.title: Krupp Brothers 2007 Stagecoach Vineyard Synchrony Red (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1094 Hardman Ave, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: The wine tastes and feels important. It has great weight and depth. The tannins are extraordinarily thick, but ripe and smoothly sweet. And then there's the fruit, a detonation of blackberries, cherries, blueberries and cassis, not to mention the oak, which seems as fine as oak gets. This superb wine seems like an obvious cellar candidate. It should ride out the decade effortlessly.

properties.title: El Nido 2007 Red (Jumilla)
properties.descrption: This Cabernet-Monastrell blend tips the scales at 15.5% and asks you straight out: how big do you like your red wines? It is smoky, sultry and massive, with spicy boysenberry aromas, a deep, syrupy palate and plodding flavors of molasses, roasted berry, cedar plank and herbs. Bullish but drinkble now and over the next few years; probably not one for the cellar.

properties.title: Aril 2008 Syrah (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 860 Napa Valley Corporate Way # C, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: An interesting wine that needs time to resolve its internal conflicts.
