At less than three years, it's jammy, almost candied in raspberry and cherry fruit, sprinkled with freshly ground pepper and with a trace of beef jerky. Yet such is the acid-tannin framework that the wine could surprise with extended cellaring. Try after 2014.

properties.title: Bella 2008 Maple Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 9711 W Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Unmistakably Zinfandel, and Dry Creek at that, with its robust texture, firm tannins and briary, brambly flavors of wild summer berries, chocolate-covered raisins, red licorice and cola, liberally spiced with black pepper. It's a big, voluptuous wine that never loses its sense of balance and harmony. Drink now.

properties.title: Tulpen 2007 Coalesce Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 3131 S 3rd Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: This Bordeaux blend is three fifths Cabernet Sauvignon, yet deftly weaves in smaller percentages of Merlot, Cab Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Fruit-driven and complex, it's a smooth ride through fresh fruit flavors of plum, blueberry and cherry, focusing into a finish with ripe, polished tannins.

properties.title: Stroppiana 2009 Gabutti Bussia  (Barolo)
properties.descrption: This Barolo shows funky aromas of rubber and animal—common for the scorching 2009 vintage in this area. Despite its core of dark cherry fruit, this is very astringent and brutally tannic, with a short finish. Don't think this will evolve well.

properties.title: Three 2011 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
properties.descrption: From the old fields of Oakley, this Zinfandel, made by Matt Cline, is big in black fruit and a touch of smoke, particularly vibrant on the finish.

properties.title: Vinum Natura 2011  Bordeaux
properties.address: 499 Devlin Rd, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: A balanced wine, showing attractive fruitiness, ripe black currants and soft tannins. It's likely to be ready to drink soon.

properties.title: Château Penin 2011 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
properties.address: 39 Couponne, 33420 Génissac, France
properties.descrption: Hard and extracted, this wine shows little more than tannins. The fruitiness is hard to discern and may never come through.

properties.title: Apaltagua 2012 Estate Grown Rosé Carmenère (Central Valley)
properties.address: Millahue de s/n - Apalta, Santa Cruz, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: Briny citrus and sulfuric match-stick aromas lead to an edgy but fresh palate. Flavors of dry citrus and generic tropical fruits finish with citric acidity and monotone juiciness. Overall, this is a tart, fresh cleanser.

properties.title: Cocobon 2011 Red (California)
properties.descrption: At this price, buy a bunch and pour it in paper cups at your next big party. You won't get any complaints. Blackberry, chocolate and oak-like flavors are front and center.

properties.title: Hermann Moser 2012 Rosi Mosi Red (Niederösterreich)
properties.descrption: Red fruit and citrus notes show through tight acidity on this slightly bitter wine touched with sulfur aromas. It's dry and sharp in style. Screwcap.

properties.title: 10Span 2011 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
properties.descrption: Some overripe and green notes dilute the cherries of this Pinot. It's dry and silky, a sound wine for drinking now.

properties.title: Château des Tourtes 2011 Classic  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
properties.descrption: This soapy, unfocused wine has tannins and red berry fruit but little structure. The fruit shows a green streak that will not improve.

properties.title: Château du Retout 2011  Haut-Médoc
properties.descrption: A very juicy wine that shows overripe fruit and an herbal character. It's soft, fruity without great definition and likely to develop quickly.

properties.title: Château Noblet 2011  Côtes de Bourg
properties.address: 291 Winery Rd SW, Floyd, VA 24091, USA
properties.descrption: Very dry and with too much wood, this is an attenuated wine with a hard facade. It doesn't offer enough fruit for the future.

properties.title: Mounts 2010 Estate Grown Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 3901 Wine Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Too ripe, with prune, chocolate and raisin flavors that taste hot and sweet in high alcohol. With hard tannins, it could almost be a minor Port.

properties.title: Dogwood 2010 Sargentini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)
properties.address: 3995 Campbell Ridge Rd, Salyer, CA 95563, USA
properties.descrption: This old-vine Zinfandel also has Carignane and Petite Sirah and is full of red fruit and decent spice but it falls flat under the weight of alcohol on the finish.

properties.title: Kasuari 2010 Syrah (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: Marred by aggressively hard tannins and acids, this Syrah's berry-cherry flavors finish thin and bitter, with a green edge. The chilly vintage took its toll. Drink up.

properties.title: Carma 2010 Estate Grown Carmenère (Maule Valley)
properties.descrption: Soft aromas of raisin and prune lack vitality and indicate what's to come. The wine feels flabby and awkward on the palate, with only light acidity pumping up generic flavors that include coffee, herbal berry and chocolate.

properties.title: Château Laride 2011  Haut-Médoc
properties.descrption: Juicy but not quite ripe, this is a green and herbal wine that is not worth aging. Drink it over the next few years.

properties.title: Domaine du Claouset 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
properties.descrption: A hard and tannic wine, with too much dryness for pleasure. It's not likely to soften enough to balance out.

properties.title: Zinfandelic 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 2160 Guntly Rd, Philo, CA 95466, USA
properties.descrption: A dusty Amador County-dominant old-vine Zinfandel with plenty of spicy berry, mocha and licorice flavor. Packaged in a psychedelically inspired label, it'll go down easy on those late-night when listening to music is the best thing to do and plenty of barbecued meat is lying around.

properties.title: Banfi 2011 Poggio alle Mura Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
properties.descrption: Aromas suggesting ripe plum, exotic spice, blue flower and a whiff of pipe tobacco take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate doles out ripe black cherry, raspberry, vanilla and a hint of star anise while velvety tannins give it a polished feel. An espresso note signals the close. Drink 2018–2026.

properties.title: Bien Nacido 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.descrption: The spicy and earthy nose on this sprightly bottling from the iconic vineyard is superb: pressed mulberry, beet and rhubarb aromas lifted by thyme, star anise and bay leaf. The palate is slightly mellower, with rounded pomegranate and cherry notes cut by pine needle-like spice.

properties.title: Giornata 2013 Luna Matta Vineyard Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 470 Marquita Ave a, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Vibrant red plum and cherry aromas meet hibiscus, cinnamon and a touch of inviting cotton candy on the nose of this bottling. The palate brims with cinnamon spice, baked strawberry and red plum, further enhanced by licorice and ginger snap flavors. The structure is elegantly grippy.

properties.title: Grimm's Bluff 2014 Estate Petit Verdot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
properties.descrption: Lush caramel, crème de cassis and crushed black rock aromas are backed by a structure that's apparent even from the nose in this bottling from winemaker Paul Lato. Soft and plush on the palate, it's full of black fruit, peppercorn spice and charcoal flavors, bound by fluffy tannins and measured acidity.

properties.title: Capanne Ricci 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.address: Podere il Casello, 53024 Sant'Angelo In Colle SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Red berry, pressed violet, tilled earth and new leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this. On the concentrated palate, notes of licorice, clove and tobacco accent a core of black cherry set against a backbone of firm fine-grained tannins. A coffee note wraps up the finish.

properties.title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Escolha dos Enólogos Red (Alentejano)
properties.descrption: A blend of the winemakers' two favorite vats, this is intended to give the best impression of the vintage. It's bold, ripe and full of dark fruit and big tannins. With nine months of barrel age, it has filled out and will be ready to drink from 2019.

properties.title: Castello Romitorio 2012 Filo di Seta  (Brunello di Montalcino)
properties.descrption: Aromas of red berry, espresso, underbrush and French oak lead the nose along with a balsamic note. The bright, sleek palate evokes wild cherry, crushed raspberry, pipe tobacco and licorice alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins that lend refined support. Drink 2020–2028.

properties.title: Château Lamartine 2014 Expression Malbec-Tannat (Cahors)
properties.descrption: The combination of two naturally tannic grapes has inevitably produced a tannic wine. But the ripe layer of rich black fruits acts as a foil to the density of the wine and gives it both balance and a good future. This is a serious wine that needs to age, so drink from 2020.

properties.title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Grande Reserve Malbec (Tupungato)
properties.descrption: Tarry aromas of blackberry and freshly applied asphalt set up a full-bodied palate with sandpaper tannins. Blackberry and toast flavors taste a little burnt, while an oak-based blackened element is present on a stout finish. Drink this blocky and lusty Malbec through 2023.

properties.title: Dujac Fils & Pere 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin
properties.descrption: A fine blend of ripe fruit and crisp red berry flavors, this negociant wine produced by Domaine Dujac is structured and generous. The bright acidity reflects the vintage while the structure and tannins reflect the appellation. Together, they will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

properties.title: Eric Kent 2014 Small Town Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Rich in rose scents, this is an extremely light, crisply textured wine, with subtle pomegranate, tart cherry and orange flavors. Silky and delicate, it offers a wealth of acidity.

properties.title: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Château de Mercuès Malbec (Cahors)
properties.descrption: The flagship estate of the Vigouroux family, this medieval castle on a hill is also a hotel. The vineyard produces powerful wines like this, packed with dusty tannins and with dark berry fruits and fine concentration. It is a wine to age, drink from 2020.

properties.title: Kaiken 2013 Mai Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Roque Sáenz Peña 5516, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Black in color, this smells of olive, eucalyptus and tarry berry, much like you'd get from a high-end Chilean red. An extracted massive palate is dense and layered, while this tastes of salty black plum and black currant. A toasty smooth finish with mild tannins is herbal and balsamic. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Puramun 2014 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)
properties.descrption: Potent, inky aromas of blackberry and licorice reflect this beefy Malbec's opaque black color. In the mouth, this is energetic and not just heavy and extracted. Lightly salted black-fruit flavors are lifted by acidity, while this finishes deep and strong. Drink through 2022.

properties.title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.address: Quinta do Portal, 5060, Portugal
properties.descrption: This reserve wine is a ripe and smooth blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. New wood aging for nine months has brought out the ripeness of the fruit and added a spicy edge. Still young, its black fruit and structure need further developing. Drink from 2019.

properties.title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2011 Red (Douro)
properties.address: Quinta Dona Matilde, Bagaúste, 5050-435 Canelas PRG, Portugal
properties.descrption: An old vine field blend from the family-owned estate, this wine is dense with both tannin and ripe black fruit. Plum and blackberry flavors are balanced by acidity and chalky texture. Drink now.

properties.title: Château Andron Blanquet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. Rich and sweet, with fresh tannins and solid fruit flavors. The wine is dark, but has vivid acidity.

properties.title: Château Bel-Air Ouÿ 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. Owned by Jean-Luc Thunevin of Valandraud, this is an intense - maybe too intense - spicy wine, packed with new wood. There is a juicy character, but structure dominates.

properties.title: Château d'Issan 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
properties.address: Château d'Issan, Chem. de la Ménagerie, 33460 Margaux-Cantenac, France
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. The wine has a rustic edge, over very juicy fruit, very blackcurrant, and with a high acid content. It feels light.

properties.title: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. Solid, but still fresh wine, good acidity, some sweetness, but more pure blackcurrant and berry fruits.

properties.title: Château la Tour de Pin Figeac 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.winery: Château la Tour de Pin Figeac
properties.address: 4 Cheval Blanc-Ouest, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. Sweet fruit, soft tannins, ripe wine. The structure takes a while to show with dusty, almost velvet tannins.

properties.title: Château Puy-Blanquet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: 1 Puyblanquet, 33330 Saint-Étienne-de-Lisse, France
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. Powerful, but smooth, with ripe milk chocolate and sweetness. Very velvet in texture, with just enough acidity.

properties.title: Château Bonalgue 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. A solid chunky sweet wine, with lots of ripe bright fruits, and vivid blackcurrants. With this structure it will age.

properties.title: Château Grand Barrail Lamarzelle Figeac 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 89-91 Barrel sample. A smooth wine, almost velvet, very polished. The fruits are ripe, sweet, very soft.

properties.title: Château Latour-Martillac 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
properties.address: 8 Chem. la Tour, 33650 Martillac, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very ripe fruit aromas, the fruit ripe, full of sweetness, showing signs of super maturity.

properties.title: Château Haut-Carles 2009 Barrel sample  (Fronsac)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Light, ripe, fresh with pleasant acidity and the freshest of blackcurrants.

properties.title: Château Haut-Simard 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: Lieu dit, Simard, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. This is rich, with sweet fruits and delicious sweet plum flavors, good tannins, a lovely juicy character.

properties.title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Packed, fruity wine, dominated by very fresh acidity. The wine is crisp as much as rich, maybe on the lean side.

properties.title: Château Montviel 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.address: 9 Rue du Grand Moulinet, 33500 Pomerol, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Ripe and sweet, plush fruit, balanced sufficiently with acidity and some firm tannic character. The wine is chunky, but there is balance.

properties.title: Château Plince 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.address: Rte de Montagne, 33500 Libourne, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Some spice here, from the rich Merlot. The wine has ripe blackberry, sweet fruits as well as concentrated tannins.

properties.title: Château Anthonic 2009 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
properties.address: Rte de Maliney, 33480 Moulis-en-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very soft, rounded wine, the tannins a mere hint as the fruit rolls forward. Fine, juicy spice.

properties.title: Château de Lamarque 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: 51T Rue Principale, 33460 Lamarque, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. There is a high level of new wood, toast that dominates both the aroma and the flavors. It gives the wine a hard-edged feel at this stage.

properties.title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.address: Blanquet Ouest, 33180 Saint-Estèphe, France
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Sweet vanilla aroma, fruit that is ripe, soft, fleshy. This seems to have suffered from super-mature, fruit, although a final juiciness does help.

properties.title: Château Teyssier 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Dark bitter chocolate coated wine, soft in texture, but with a good stalky chewy edge. Final flavors are of cedar, new wood and spice.

properties.title: Marojallia 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. A hugely extracted wine, very dark and tannic, solid, spicy wood.

properties.title: Château Beaumont 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Barrel sample. Lots of spiced wood, with sweet blackberry fruits. The wine is initially soft, but the tannins do kick in. The fruit finally has great freshness

properties.title: Zanoni 2007 Zovo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
properties.descrption: On the bold and powerful side, this deals lush flavors of dark chocolate, chewy cherry, leather, tobacco and barbecue smoke. Packed with intensity and soft richness, it also delivers a fine point of fresh acidity on the finish.

properties.title: Gratallops 2007 Partida Bellvisos Red (Priorat)
properties.descrption: Compared to the excellent 2006, this wine is heavier, riper and jammier at every check point. The nose is baked and raisiny, while the palate feels saturated to the extreme and gritty as well. The primary flavors run toward baked plum and blackberry, while licorice, leather and raisin notes carry the finish. Give this lots of air after opening, about an hour or so.

properties.title: Atalaya 2010 La Atalaya Garnacha-Monastrell (Almansa)
properties.descrption: Big, smoky and concentrated on the nose, this has a ton of black fruit and char notes. This is mouth-filling, deep and powerful stuff, with a potent mash of baked blackberry, molasses and barbecue sauce filling in the flavor profile. It finishes long and roasted, with savory oak and saucy spice flavors. A blend of 85% Garnacha and 15% Monastrell.

properties.title: Zymè 2008  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
properties.descrption: This offers beautiful intensity and staying power. Layer after layer peels away to reveal black fruit, spice, leather, tobacco and cured meat notes. The soft, velvety mouthfeel would pair with pork, lamb or veal.

properties.title: Le Bertarole 2008 Podere Le Marognole  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
properties.descrption: Modern and oak driven, this has aromas of toasted almond, chocolate, tobacco and crushed clove. The fruit nuances tend to be on the dark and jammy side. It gains focus on the palate thanks to its firm structure and bright cola and licorice endnotes.

properties.title: Louis Latour 2010 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)
properties.descrption: Rich, round and concentrated, this is developing fast. The acidity is already comfortably embedded in the ripe red-berry fruit..

properties.title: Gino Fasoli 2007 Alteo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
properties.address: San Zeno di, Via C.Battisti, 47, 37030 Colognola Ai Colli VR, Italy
properties.descrption: The 17.5% alcohol is a bit much, but the burning effect is dampened by the mouthfeel's extraordinary thickness and richness. It's big and bold, with intense aromas of toasted nut, vanilla, chocolate fudge, blackberry jam and exotic spice.

properties.title: Giuseppe Campagnola 2008 Caterina Zardini Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
properties.descrption: Compared to past vintages, this edition of Caterina Zardini Riserva shows slightly pungent aromas of red apple, plum, cherry and cassis. The bright fruit gives the wine support and endurance, which is further reinforced by the soft, velvety mouthfeel

properties.title: Tedeschi 2010 Capitel San Rocco  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
properties.address: Via Giuseppe Verdi, 4/a, 37029 Pedemonte di Valpolicella VR, Italy
properties.descrption: Tedeschi is one of the benchmark producers of Valpolicella. This wine is bursting with fresh fruit intensity and lush background notes of spice, leather and moist pipe tobacco.

properties.title: Bolla 2007  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
properties.descrption: This offers vibrant aromas of red cherry, blackberry, leather, spice and cigar box. There are dark touches of resin and brown sugar that are followed by notes of smoked bacon and cured meat. This is dark, masculine and concentrated.

properties.title: Cesari 2010 Mara  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
properties.descrption: This offers a slightly less formal and austere expression compared to Cesari's Bosan. Perfect for chicken or pork roast, this delivers fresh acidity beyond the tones of cherry, cola, leather and barbecue spice.

properties.title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin
properties.descrption: Concentrated and complex, this has structure and acidity, with a black cherry flavor. It's a ripe, powerful wine that could become more generous as it ages.

properties.title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Pommard
properties.descrption: This shows the richness of the vintage in its ripe red fruits. It has weight as well as tannins, with a solid, firmly structured base of red plum fruit.

properties.title: Degani 2009 La Rosta  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
properties.descrption: This shows sweet, plush fruit aromas, with background tones of leather and tobacco. By no means is this wine over the top, in fact, it shows a firm but elegant quality throughout.

properties.title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2010 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
properties.address: Clos de la Maréchale, 21700 Premeaux-Prissey, France
properties.descrption: For a Premier Cru, this is surprisingly open and ready. It has a light structure, offering delicious, forward, juicy fruit that has been rounded out by wood aging. With its ripe character, it will be ready to drink in a year.

properties.title: Ramón Bilbao 2008 Limited Edition Crianza  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: This is leathery and earthy up front, with cherry and berry aromas that come with a flower accent. It feels snappy, alert and slightly citrusy, with raspberry, red plum and vanilla flavors. It's relatively short and choppy on the finish, but it's fresh, with the proper amount of oak.

properties.title: Wait Cellars 2009 Devoto Garden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
properties.descrption: This has flavors of cherry and blackberry jam, cola and spice. It's crisp in acidity and dry, as Pinot should be. This is direct and polished; it's not likely to get better with age, so drink now.

properties.title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2009  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
properties.address: Château Moulin, 87330 Nouic, France
properties.descrption: Soft, warm and smoky wine, this has a finely layered wood flavor to go with the black currant and red berry fruits. It's dry, yet warm and ripe, finishing with freshness.

properties.title: Cornarea 2009 Cornarea  (Roero)
properties.descrption: The bouquet offers intensity and character, with subtle accents of crème de cassis and toasted almond.

properties.title: Gerovassiliou 2007 Avaton Red (Epanomi)
properties.descrption: This offers aromas and flavors of plum, savory spice and cigarbox, with an overall dry and focused character. A smoky spice note finishes the wine. Pair this with grilled lamb, pizza or steak.

properties.title: Dusted Valley 2009 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 980 Merlot Dr, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Heavy accents of vanilla and black tea as well as sharp acids and drying tannins characterize this Petite Sirah. If you like your reds big, brawny and oak soaked, this is your poster child.

properties.title: Gård 2009 Lawrence Vineyards Don Isidro Red Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: A popular 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah blend, this sports a distinctive floral note, like a whiff of baby powder. Light cherry fruit anchors the core, remaining balanced throughout the medium finish.

properties.title: Germano Angelo 2008 Mondoca Dardi  (Barolo)
properties.address: Frazione Annunziata, 24/a, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Ripe and concentrated, this has a thick, extracted appearance and abundant aromas of cherry liqueur and chocolate. There's a touch of sweet candied fruit on the finish.

properties.title: Giacomo Grimaldi 2008 Sotto Castello di Novello  (Barolo)
properties.descrption: This wine opens with aromas of leather, old spice and candied fruit that seem past their prime. There's a sour note on the finish.

properties.title: Pech Merle 2010 Treborce Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.descrption: This has a powerful, briary character, with a spicy, high-alcohol kick. It erupts in the mouth, with flavors of wild berry, tobacco, cola, anise and white pepper that should pair well with equally spicy fare, preferably fatty meats and cheeses.

properties.title: Silver Palm 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
properties.descrption: Slight touches of smoked meat, iron, slate, cranberry, raspberry and dried sage show on the nose of this wine. The palate is a bit weak, with tangy strawberry and rust flavors.

properties.title: Lawer 2015 Rosé of Syrah (Knights Valley)
properties.descrption: Entirely varietal, and given five months to gel in stainless steel, this is a dark copper-red wine that's noticeably earthy on the nose. Dry, woody and a touch sour in cherry and strawberry, it should be enjoyed chilled and with ceviche.

properties.title: Torres 2012 Escaleras de Empedrado Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)
properties.descrption: Scattered aromas of horseradish, cotton candy and vinegar are all over the map but don't convey varietal character or purity. This new wine from terraced vineyards in deep, rural Maule feels clipped, with heavy tannins. Mixed berry flavors are bitter and rubbery, and the finish is grabby and awkward. This is a first release; suffice it to say it needs more work to justify its price.

properties.title: La Clarine Farm 2014 Jambalaia Rouge Red (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 7721 Snowbird Ln, Somerset, CA 95684, USA
properties.descrption: This wine has potent berry, funky earth and herb aromas. Its fruity-floral flavors are tinged with a balsamic nip and a tart, rather tannic mouthfeel. To taste a little pioneering in terms of wine style, don't be alarmed at the sediment in the bottle.

properties.title: Mano A Mano 2013 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
properties.address: 1919 Cherry St, Kansas City, MO 64108, USA
properties.descrption: Jumbled, earthy aromas suggest pork and beans. This feels hard and choppy, with drying tannins. Baked, stewy, saucy flavors finish peppery and minty, with unyielding hard tannins.

properties.title: Montes 2014 Twins Red (Colchagua Valley)
properties.descrption: Heavy aromas of oak, char and syrupy berry fruits don't smell entirely natural. This feels tannic and scratchy, with missing parts. The flavor of candied, sweet, dominating oak is front and center, while mint, carob and stewed berry flavors finish this off.

properties.title: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Zee Original Malbec (Côtes du Lot)
properties.address: Lieu dit Circofoul - Plaine du Port - R.D.9 Albas rive droite, Plaine du Port, 46140 Albas, France
properties.descrption: The wine is perfumed and full. It is so soft, missing tannins, and already easy to drink. Black fruits are super-ripe and generous. Drink now.

properties.title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
properties.descrption: The wine is so soft that only the light wood flavors give it shape. It is smooth with red plum fruits that are rounded and sweet in style. Acidity seems to be an afterthought. Drink now.

properties.title: Jelly Jar 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lake County)
properties.descrption: This extreme wine has vivid earthy aromas like wood smoke and cured meats and equally smoky, meaty flavors. The mouthfeel is quite dry and tannic, and any fruit flavors take a back seat to the gamey character.

properties.title: McManis 2014 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)
properties.address: 18700 E River Rd, Ripon, CA 95366, USA
properties.descrption: This wine has strong aromas like wood smoke and grilled beef, then equally smoky, peppery flavors and a tart, rather tannic texture.

properties.title: Montalvo Wilmot 2013 MW Quintos de la Tejera Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
properties.descrption: Floral, spicy plum aromas come with notes of lemon and chili pepper. This Tempranillo is rudimentary, with a creamy, pasty palate. Baked cherry and berry flavors end with almost syrupy thickness and a touch of chocolate flavor.

properties.title: Rio Madre 2014  Rioja
properties.address: C. de la Construcción, 74, 46340 Requena, Valencia, Spain
properties.descrption: Reedy red-fruit aromas lack the clarity that the best wines of this style show. Grabby on the palate, this tastes of basic plum and raspberry. A raw, tannic, rubbery finish is the final act.

properties.title: Parducci 2009 Small Lot Blend Pinot Noir (California)
properties.descrption: Good price for a deliciously drinkable Pinot Noir. It's silky and a little sweet in raspberries, brown sugar and bacon flavors. Easy to drink and at this price, it can be your house Pinot.

properties.title: Murphy-Goode 2009 Merlot (California)
properties.descrption: This is the kind of Merlot people will love. It's smooth, soft and silky, with rich, sweet flavors of raspberries and cherries. There's even a candied note of chocolate-covered mint.

properties.title: Nuna 2010 Reserve Bonarda (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Lots of fruit is apparent right from the start, with cassis, raspberry, red plum and cotton candy aromas. Lively as can be, but under control, with huge berry flavors touched up by oaky chocolate and vanilla. Not complex but definitely all-out with the berry fruit.

properties.title: Paul Cluver 2009 Pinot Noir (Elgin)
properties.descrption: Approachable now with an enticing mocha streak throughout that's lifted by the bright red cherry and raspberry fruit flavors. Low tannins and medium acidity make this an easy-pleaser for fans of the grape.

properties.title: Rock Wall 2010 Obsidian Red (Red Hills Lake County)
properties.descrption: Rock Wall seems to release its wines pretty young, and this too could use a little time. A blend of half Zinfandel and half Petite Sirah from the obsidian-laden hills of Lake County's Red Hills area, a very promising spot for Cabernet in particular. Still hugely tannic, this mix is yummy in dusty black fruit, leather and dark chocolate.

properties.title: Coelho 2009 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.descrption: Pure fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry, tart and forward, introduce this light and approachable Pinot. Elegant and stylish, without much staying power, it's a good choice for drinking now while your heartier Pinots rest in the cellar.

properties.title: Foris 2009 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
properties.descrption: Foris wines reveal a winemaker with a deft touch on both white wines and Pinot Noir. Nuanced scents and accents of berry, herb, earth and stem come together in this subtle, balanced, and honest wine. There is no fakery or blending trickery to boost the color or tannins.

properties.title: Testarossa 2006 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
properties.descrption: Testarossa's track record with this wine has been on an upward spiral. The '06 shows the winery's usual deft hand at crafting delicately structured, elegant but powerfully flavored wines. Cherries, black raspberries, currants and blood oranges flood the mouth, ending in a swirl of clove and anise. Best now–2010.

properties.title: Alma Rosa 2006 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 1623 Mission Dr, Solvang, CA 93463, USA
properties.descrption: Impresses for the body and depth that lifts it into sheer deliciousness. A powerful wine, it's stuffed with pure flavors of black cherries, currants, beef jerky and spicy mu shu plum sauce, all wrapped into thick but finely ground tannins, and brightened with crisp coastal acidity. Beautiful now, and should develop over the next 6 years.

properties.title: Kynsi 2005 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.descrption: This pretty Pinot Noir is drinking well now, but has the depth to last for a while. It's succulent and forward in black and red currant, Dr. Pepper, clove, smoky vanilla and pepper flavors. Really a beautiful, alluring wine.

properties.title: Von Strasser 2005 Reserve Red (Diamond Mountain District)
properties.address: 965 Silverado Trail N, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.descrption: The very tannic '05 reserve is a blend of Petit Verdot, Cab Sauvignon, Merlot and Cab Franc. It's fleshy and rich in blackberry, cassis and tobacco flavors, with lots of new toasty oak, and there's something meaty, like ground hamburger with a splash of tamari. Utterly delicious and very fine, this low-production bottling should evolve over many years.

properties.title: Testarossa 2006 Fritschen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: A beautiful Pinot Noir, lilting, refined and utterly delicious. Testarossa stumbled with the '04, but otherwise their track record is great, and the '06 is right up there with the marvelous '05 and '03. The wine's cherry, licorice and smoky oak flavors are captured in a rewarding texture of silk and satin.

properties.title: Domaine Alfred 2005 Chamisal Vineyards Califa Syrah (Edna Valley)
properties.descrption: Here's a dense, dramatic young Syrah. It's potent in black currant, cherry, anise and dark chocolate flavors, with plenty of toasty new oak. But more notable is the structure. Fine, ripely sweet tannins, good acidity and moderate alcohol make it balanced and even ageworthy over the next 6 years.

properties.title: Fontodi 2004 Riserva Vigna del Sorbo  (Chianti Classico)
properties.address: Località San Leolino, 89, 50022 Greve in Chianti FI, Italy
properties.descrption: This is an extremely elegant and beautiful wine that is tight and compact while being intense and generous at the same time. It offers luscious notes of ripe cherry, blueberry fruit and piquant highlights that recall Asian spices (10% Cabernet is added to the blend). It has a gorgeous mouthfeel, bright fruit flavors and silky tannins.

properties.title: Arista 2005 Longbow Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Here's a young, hedonistic Pinot that captures the essence of RRV from a perfect vintage. Although it's ripely forward in cherry, pomegranate, Dr. Pepper, red licorice and cinnamon spice flavors, it shows a structural sophistication that elevates the score. Beautiful now, and should improve over the next 6 years.

properties.title: C. Beck 2005 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: A shade less opulent but finer and more structured than the '04. The tannins are as fine as in any Napa cult Cab, yet the flavors are exotic, with tiers of black currants, red cherries, licorice, dark chocolate, violets, pepper, leather and Chinese mu shu plum sauce. Drink now with substantial roasts; should age for a decade.

properties.title: Clarendon Hills 2005 Hickinbotham Syrah (Clarendon)
properties.address: 11500 Burris Ln, Potter Valley, CA 95469, USA
properties.descrption: As might be expected from winemaker Roman Bratasiuk, this is a full-bodied, rich Syrah, loaded with dark scents of roast coffee, blueberries and baking spices. Blueberry, menthol and spice flavors dominate the palate, finishing long. Despite the massive richness, there's plenty of elegance, too. Imported by Wine Brokers Unlimited.

properties.title: Landmark 2006 Grand Detour Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: The vineyard sources of Landmark's Grand Detour Pinot have varied, but the wine's quality is as high as ever. Made from five well-regarded properties, the '06 is intricately detailed, with complex flavors of dried cherries, red currants, mocha, licorice, sautéed mushrooms splashed with balsamic and smoky, vanilla-infused oak. The silky texture and spicy finish make it irresistible.

properties.title: Mitolo 2006 G.A.M. Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.descrption: Already approachable, Mitolo's 2006 G.A.M. should nevertheless age 10–15 years. The aromas are slightly peppery and spicy, accented by hints of smoke, while the flavors are dark and savory, blending cedar, coffee, black olive and cola. The soft tannins amply frame the long, mouthwatering finish.

properties.title: Ramos-Pinto 2006 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.descrption: A deliciously ripe wine, all structure, intense black plum fruits, and sweet licorice and tar flavors. Bringing all these great flavors together are the fresh edge, the tannins and the dense fruits.

properties.title: Testarossa 2006 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.descrption: Despite the pale color, this is a powerful wine. It comes from this famous vineyard that pioneered the Santa Rita Hills. Erupts in the mouth with cherry, currant, licorice, cola and vanilla flavors that finish dry and spicy. The tannic edge suggests ageability, which Pinots from this vineyard are easily capable of. Best now–2012.

properties.title: Carpineto 2004 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
properties.descrption: This is a lovely Riserva with thick and penetrating tones of cherry, spice and cola—the holy trinity of traditional Chianti Classico. The wine is dense, concentrated and intense without being too powerful or overwhelming. It would make an excellent companion to veal in a wine reduction sauce because of the natural succulence and structure.

properties.title: Iron Horse 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
properties.address: 9786 Ross Station Rd, Sebastopol, CA 95472, USA
properties.descrption: Right up there with the wonderful '05, Iron Horse's '06 shows the brisk acids and long hangtime flavors the wine is known for. The cherry, currant, licorice, root beer and Provençal herb flavors are rich and savory, leading to a complex finish.

properties.title: MacPhail 2006 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Quite a bit lighter in body than MacPhail's other single-vineyard '06s, this one benefits from the elegant structure. With its silky angularity, it offers complex flavors of cherries, raspberries, orange tea, vanilla, cinnamon, cloves and vanilla-rich new oak.

properties.title: Caparsa 2004 Riserva Doccio a Matteo  (Chianti Classico)
properties.descrption: Very rich, opulent and ripe with oak-driven aromas of vanilla, chocolate, licorice and spice, this is a dark Riserva with loads of personality and almost impenetrable density. It imparts a smooth, silky feel thanks to the quality of its tannins and ends with a chewy bite of plump cherry.

properties.title: Clarendon Hills 2005 Piggott Range Syrah (Clarendon)
properties.descrption: Like all of the Clarendon Hills wines, this is packed with intensity. It's full-bodied, with soft tannins and a slightly low-acid, natural feel. Aromas of menthol and roasted meat are backed by hints of blackberry and licorice on the palate and a long, lingering finish. Drink now–2020. Imported by Wine Brokers Unlimited.

properties.title: Artezin 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
properties.descrption: A young Zin still in need of time to develop, there's an intensity of raspberry and blackberry fruit in this wine, and a softness throughout. It's full bodied, and its finish falls flat.

properties.title: Zerba Cellars 2008 Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Dolcetto is still a rare sighting in Washington, and the vines that exist are still quite young. Not surprising then that this pleasant red is rather simple, with red fruit flavors and a subtle streak of pepper. The tannins are a little on the stemmy side.

properties.title: Zerba Cellars 2008 Wild Z Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: A “kitchen sink” blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot, the Wild Z shows far more flavors of vanilla and black tea than fruit. A popular style to be sure, fine for everyday drinking.

properties.title: Josef Weger 2008 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)
properties.descrption: There is a touch of sour berry on the bouquet, with white almond and menthol notes. The mouthfeel is subdued and silky.

properties.title: Michael Pozzan 2010 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: There is lots of charm in this soft, gentle Pinot Noir. It's not an ager, but it offers some nice cherry, Dr. Pepper and spice flavors.

properties.title: Maso Poli 2008 Pinot Nero (Trentino)
properties.address: Strada del Vino, 33, 38015 Lavis TN, Italy
properties.descrption: There's a savory, earthy element to this oak-aged wine, with bright tones of wild berry, cola, balsam and rosemary oil.

properties.title: Babcock 2010 Psi Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 5175 CA-246, Lompoc, CA 93436, USA
properties.descrption: Right out of the bottle, this wine smells and tastes tight and unappealing. It's marked by drying tannins and earthiness, giving it a rustic quality. Still, there's a good core of cherry fruit.

properties.title: Kuleto Estate 2009 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 2470 Sage Canyon Rd, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: This wine has flavors of wild blackberry, blueberry and mocha, with a rich vein of herb, tobacco and spice. However, it's hot in alcohol, and finishes with glyceriney sweetness—almost like a minor Port. Drink up.

properties.title: Frenchman's Gulch 2008 Syrah (Washington)
properties.address: Frenchman's Ct, Ketchum, ID 83340, USA
properties.descrption: Sourced from the excellent Lewis Vineyard, this toasty, chewy Syrah displays black cherry fruit against a strong background of vanilla. At first it seems tart to the point of being almost sour, but as it breathes, the oak mutes some of the acid and balances it out.

properties.title: Gamache 2008 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Hard and tannic at first, this young wine grudgingly reveals a core of very tart cherry fruit, encased in flavors of stem and wood. A coffee-infused finish does not conceal the chewy, tough tannins.

properties.title: Cooper Vineyards 2007 Norton (Virginia)
properties.descrption: There are just enough plush, woody tannins here to balance the intense boysenberry fruit. Lingering espresso and vanilla flavors infuse the palate while a slightly sharp note of acidity comes through on the medium finish. Try with grilled pork.

properties.title: Gilbert Cellars 2007 Estate Malbec (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 2620 Draper Rd, Yakima, WA 98903, USA
properties.descrption: This vineyard has proven it can ripen good Malbec, but here it seems as if something has gone sideways. There is a gluey scent underneath the blackberry fruit, and the wine seems chalky and disjointed in the mouth, with more of the band-aid flavors in the finish.

properties.title: Vivác Winery 2006 Merlot (New Mexico)
properties.address: 2075 NM-68, Dixon, NM 87527, USA
properties.descrption: Unusual aromas of singe and tar are interspersed with Chinese tea and vanilla while flavors in the mouth turn a bit soupy. Medium-bodied with some grippy tannins and a short finish. Drink now.

properties.title: Vivác Winery 2007 Tempranillo (New Mexico)
properties.descrption: All vanilla and mocha on the nose followed by pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit on the palate. Smooth, short-to-medium finish with just a touch of spice. Try with grilled lamb.

properties.title: French Rabbit 2007 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
properties.descrption: Smells a little warm with notes of stewed red berries and brandied cherries. Lightweight with medium acidity and virtually no tannins—this is an easy-to-drink option; given the Tetra-pak packaging, a great choice for concerts, camping and picnics.

properties.title: Berryessa Gap 2006 Reserve Petite Sirah (Yolo County)
properties.descrption: Tastes and feels rustic in the harshness of the tannins, which hint at unripeness, and the green, minty edge to the blackberries and cola. Ready now.

properties.title: Chateau Chantal 2008 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
properties.descrption: Better than in previous years but still brambly and stemmy smelling. The palate is sheer and fairly hollow in the center, with simple buttery raspberry flavors. Shows bits of burnt wood, oil and heat on the finish.

properties.title: Finca Agostino 2007 Agostino Familia Red (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Rustic and stemmy, with burnt, nutty aromas leading to a thick palate of stemmy black fruit flavors. Herbal, tannic and stemmy throughout, so at least there's continuity between the nose, palate and finish.

properties.title: O. Fournier 2008 Urban Uco Tempranillo (Uco Valley)
properties.descrption: Rough and stemmy smelling, and sort of scratchy. The palate is acceptable but that's about it, with creamy, sweet, wayward berry flavors. Finishes medicinal and a bit weedy. Similar in quality to the ‘07 Urban Tempranillo.

properties.title: Santa Ema 2007 Barrel Select Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
properties.descrption: Opens with generic red fruit and candy aromas, but the palate is overtly acidic, which causes a sourness to go with candied, medicinal berry fruit flavors. After the tartness subsides, there's regular red fruit notes left over.

properties.title: Sweet Valley 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 44 Winery Road, Lopez, PA 18628, USA
properties.descrption: Some wines can hit 15.4% alcohol, as this does, and make it work. But here the burn and scorch from the alcohol simply overwhelms some excellent fruit. Detail is lost, and what's left is a hot, jammy red.

properties.title: Finca Agostino 2007 ILKA Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: A baked, sweet, candied Malbec with a gritty, sugary mouthfeel and sweet, zappy cherry and plum flavors. Hot and breaks down on the finish. Rudimentary.

properties.title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
properties.descrption: Herbal, punchy aromas start it off, and the palate has strong acids and rubbery tannins in support of herbal, red fruit flavors that suggest rhubarb. Strains to show much ripeness.

properties.title: Michel Torino 2009 Cuma Malbec (Cafayate)
properties.descrption: Jammy and dark, with sweet, candied, offbeat aromas. Heavy in the mouth, with baked plum and berry flavors and then a reduced, short finish. Thick almost to the point of cloying. A strange wine.

properties.title: Cave B 2008 Cuvée du Soleil Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 348 Silica Rd NW, Quincy, WA 98848, USA
properties.descrption: A Bordeaux-style blend that is a barrel selection from estate fruit. The tannins are substantial in all the Cave B reds, but particularly so here––thick and astringent to the point of chalky. There is interesting depth and some high-toned red fruits.

properties.title: Chilcas 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)
properties.descrption: Smells like Italian herbs, dry red fruits and tomato sauce, or in other words, a nice pizza. The palate is a bit tight and astringent for the variety, with cherry, blackberry and licorice flavors. Not super spicy or complex, but still tasty and varietally correct.

properties.title: Clavesana 2008 Il Clou di Clavesana  (Dolcetto di Dogliani)
properties.descrption: Match this easy wine with brick oven pizza on sourdough crust or juicy grilled sausage. Made with the Dolcetto grape, the wine is loaded with bright fruit tones of blueberry and black cherry and offers a thick, creamy mouthfeel.

properties.title: Crayelle Cellars 2008 Syrah (Washington)
properties.address: 15 2nd St, Wenatchee, WA 98801, USA
properties.descrption: Peppery and herbal, with thin, tight veins of wild black fruits. It's an elegant style, with underlying minerality, though weighted toward a European palate.

properties.title: Enrico Serafino 2007 Diauleri  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)
properties.descrption: This is a silky and soft Nebbiolo with bright berry aromas and simple spice nuances. There's an elegant, feminine quality to this red wine, but it also shows power and determination.

properties.title: Il Vino dei Padri 2009 150 Anniversario Ruché (Monferrato)
properties.descrption: In homage to the 150th anniversary of Italian unification, this elegantly designed bottle sports a bright Italian flag on the label. That celebratory spirit continues thanks to the wine's aromas of sweet cherry, cola and raspberry. Its light consistency means it could be consumed slightly chilled with cod or fish soup.

properties.title: La Spinona 2008 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)
properties.descrption: This is a good portrait of Nebbiolo save for a pungent touch of powder or solvent that distracts from the overall harmony of fruit. Those strong elements are not outside the great boundaries of this important native Italian grape and are more than forgiven in this case.

properties.title: Morgan 2009 Twelve Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.descrption: A little off in texture, with a grainy mouthfeel that's part tart acids and part edgy tannins. However, it's lusty in forward cherry and raspberry fruit flavors, and will surely satisfy many Pinotphiles.

properties.title: Palladino 2005 San Bernardo Riserva  (Barolo)
properties.descrption: This vintage of Barolo Riserva San Bernardo (a wine that consistently scores in the 90-point range) appears much grittier and more oak-driven than past expressions. Carpentry shop and wood shavings come to the forefront of mature plum and blackberry jam.

properties.title: Pico Maccario 2010 Lavignone  (Barbera d'Asti)
properties.descrption: Lavignone is a simple but classy Barbera with solid aromas of forest berry, cassis and fresh tobacco leaf. The wine would pair with fried zucchini flowers stuffed with melted mozzarella cheese.

properties.title: Andretti 2009 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.descrption: A big Pinot Noir, extracted and thick in cherry and blueberry pie filling, red currant, sandalwood and dusty spice flavors. Delicious, but soft and atypical for a Pinot, lacking some life and charm. Drink now.

properties.title: Benessere 2007 Hollystone-Collins Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: Soft and candy sweet, with raspberry and cherry pie filling, raisin, vanilla, cocoa, brown sugar and cinnamon spice flavors. The tannins are lovely and the mouthfeel is bright. If you like your Zins on the sweet side, it's for you.

properties.title: Tasca d'Almerita 2008 Camastra Red (Sicilia)
properties.address: Contrada Regaleali, 90020 Sclafani Bagni PA, Italy
properties.descrption: This is a blend of Nero d'Avola and Merlot in almost equal measures. The first varietal offers aromas of red fruit, wild fennel and pistachio. The second grape lends softness and bright cherry flavor. There's a touch of tar and graphite on the close.

properties.title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2010 Nadir Syrah (Sicilia)
properties.address: Contrada Rapitalà, 90043, 90043 Camporeale PA, Italy
properties.descrption: This opens with loads of milled black pepper, which makes a strong statement. Behind that spicy tone are notes of black fruit, prune, tobacco and leather. Soft cherry and chocolate accents appear on the finish.

properties.title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2011 Tenuta Syrah (Sicilia)
properties.address: Contrada Rapitalà, 90043, 90043 Camporeale PA, Italy
properties.descrption: Bright, intense and compelling, this Syrah has bold fruit and a soft, velvety mouthfeel. A wine to be consumed at casual and dressy occasions alike.

properties.title: Valle dell'Acate 2009 Il Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
properties.descrption: This opens with aromas of blue flower, rose, almond paste, forest berry and sweet spice. The palate offers fresh berry fruit and a compact, streamlined feel.

properties.title: Valle dell'Acate 2011 Il Frappato (Vittoria)
properties.descrption: Il Frappato delivers loads of zest and bright aromas of berry, chopped mint, cola and ginger. There's a note of black pepper on the palate, followed by some almond bitterness.

properties.title: Casa Silva 2009 Los Lingues Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
properties.descrption: As usual for Casa Silva, this Carmenère is foreceful, minty, herbal and spunky on the nose, with a bold fruit aroma. The mouthfeel is robust and juicy, and the flavors run from herbal plum to berry to carob. The finish is herbal, with length and texture.

properties.title: Château Bessan Ségur 2010  Médoc
properties.descrption: Dense and dark in color, this wine has a black currant flavor. The tannins are ripe and soft, and the texture has a fresh lilt to it from the acidity and fruitiness. Only on the finish do the youthful tannins show, promising medium-term aging.

properties.title: Château Bouissel 2010 Classic Red (Fronton)
properties.descrption: Made using fruit sourced from vineyards on the highest terrace above the Tarn River, this fruity wine is made to be consumed young. It has a touch of minerality and some firm tannins, but the red berry fruit and flower note is already attractive. A blend of Négrette, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec.

properties.title: Château de Pizay 2011 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)
properties.descrption: From the eastern slopes of the hill of Brouilly, this attractive, open and fruity selection shows a fine red-fruit character that's laced with fresh acidity. It has a firm structure, which creates a solid base for the fruitiness. Drink now.

properties.title: Château du Port 2010 Tertre-Perdigous Malbec (Cahors)
properties.descrption: Soft and already approachable, this is a red-fruited wine, with ripe, well-integrated tannins and juicy acidity. It's round, fruity and ready to drink.

properties.title: Château Loudenne 2010  Médoc
properties.address: Loudenne, 33340 Saint-Yzans-de-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: A classically structured wine, this has a smoky wood flavor that's balanced by a fresh black-currant note. It has a juicy edge, a dark chocolate note and a slight bitterness that should fade. This needs to age for 4–5 years. Château Loudenne is situated by the Gironde estuary.

properties.title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
properties.address: Château Moulin, 87330 Nouic, France
properties.descrption: Using fruit sourced from a 20-acre vineyard in Castillon, this is dominated by Merlot, with a touch of perfumed Cabernet Franc. It has an age-worthy structure, showing good balance, firm tannins and ripe fruit.

properties.title: D'Alessandro 2010 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
properties.address: 801 E Wackerly St, Midland, MI 48642, USA
properties.descrption: This Nero d'Avola from the Agrigento area of southern Sicily opens with spicy nuances of cumin, clove and nutmeg, followed by plush red-fruit and dusty mineral endnotes. The palate is polished, bright and finely textured.

properties.title: Domaine Chasselay 2011 La Carrière  (Chénas)
properties.address: 123 Chem. de la Roche, 69380 Chatillon, France
properties.descrption: This is firmly tannic, with dark berry and black cherry fruits. Minerally and textured, it shows the full effect of Beaujolais's granite soil. It also has a rich feel that will evolve over the next several months.

properties.title: Leone de Castris 2009 50 Vendemmia Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)
properties.address: Via Senatore De Castris, n.26, 73015 Salice salentino LE, Italy
properties.descrption: This Riserva shows sweet ripe fruit, with rum cake, blackberry jam and cinnamon-cream notes. Some bright cherry and prune accents also appear.

properties.title: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
properties.address: Ruta 66 112, Peumo, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: This is a full and chunky wine, with thick blackberry and varietally correct herb aromas. The palate has a firm feel and good texture, while the flavors of herb, chocolate, pepper and black fruit settle on a secure, fresh and lively finish.

properties.title: Tres Sabores 2007 Estate Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1620 S Whitehall Ln, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: This is a robust wine. It has big, thick tannins, and the dryness accentuates a slightly rustic character. The flavors are well developed and complex, with blackberries veering into currants and a touch of raisin.

properties.title: Unti 2006 Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 4202 Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: With ripe blackberry and cherry flavors, the fruit of this dry wine stands out, making it enjoyable despite very tough tannins that currently make it astringently sandpapery. A good effort, although the challenge for Unti is to tame those fierce tannins.

properties.title: Verotto 2006 Vero Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.address: 700 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
properties.descrption: A fresh, crisp, clean young Pinot Noir that shows the silkiness and relative transparency of many Carneros Pinots. It's a bit thin, compared to more full-bodied versions, but elegant and dry, with flavors of cherryskins, cola and sandalwood. Now–2012.

properties.title: Wagner 2007 Meritage (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 9322 St Rt 414 Winery, Lodi, NY 14860, USA
properties.descrption: An impressive effort, with reticent black currant and cassis tones upfront followed by pomegranate in the mouth. There's good depth of flavor here though the marked acidity and broad tannins require pairing with hearty fare. Better after 2010.

properties.title: Kirkland Signature 2007 Grandmère Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
properties.address: 14030 NE 145th St, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: A bit overripe and hot in alcohol. That's the price of getting such rich fruit flavors. Dark chocolate, blackberry preserves, red currants, black raspberries and spicy satsuma flood the mouth, leading to a super-spicy finish.

properties.title: Lucas Vineyards 2007 Limited Reserve Syrah (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 3862 County Rd 150, Interlaken, NY 14847, USA
properties.descrption: The Lucas 2007 Limited Reserve Syrah shows the potential the Syrah grape has in upstate New York. Dense raspberry and strawberry fruit vie with aromas of barbecued meat on the nose while a thick layer of vanilla cushions the fine tannins and smokey notes in the mouth. The juicy finish throws up an enticing licorice note. Nicely done. Drink now to 2011.

properties.title: Raphael 2002 Estate Bottled Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 39390 NY-25, Peconic, NY 11958, USA
properties.descrption: A good choice for fans of older wines, the Raphael 2002 Merlot shows mature forest floor and earth scents but is still hanging on to some raspberry and blackberry fruit. The crisp palate has a mouthwatering character and a touch of singed plum flavor. Woody tannins chime in on the medium finish. Drink before 2011.

properties.title: Santa Alicia 2007 Reserve Malbec (Maipo Valley)
properties.address: Circunvalación Máximo Valdés 4135, Pirque, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: Opens with floral berry aromas and standard-issue black fruit notes. The palate has moderate weight and stickiness, while the flavors of cassis, berry and rubber are smoky. Juicy and alert enough, but also dense and rich, with caramel and berry syrup on the finish.

properties.title: Sobon Estate 2007 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)
properties.address: 14430 Shenandoah Rd, Plymouth, CA 95669, USA
properties.descrption: Give this young, fruity wine a few years in the cellar. The flavors are all primary blackberry, blueberry and cherry jam. The tannins and a touch of espresso bitterness might easily help this Zin develop through 2012.

properties.title: Stephen & Walker 2007 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 1300 3rd Ave N, Nashville, TN 37208, USA
properties.descrption: This is a robust, ripe and fruity Zinfandel that impresses for the sheer exuberance of its flavors. They range from black cherries and red currants to cola, chocolate, black pepper and the sweet, glyceriney taste of high alcohol.

properties.title: Swedish Hill 2007 Optiumus Red (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 4565 NY-414, Romulus, NY 14541, USA
properties.descrption: Plum and cherry notes struggle to show themselves under a heavy layer of coconut and sawdust from new American oak. This wine is tightly wound and dense in the mouth, with refreshing acidity and a medium-to-long finish. A year or two in the cellar will allow for better integration.

properties.title: Hogue 2007 Genesis Meritage (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 2800 Lee Rd, Prosser, WA 99350, USA
properties.descrption: Meritage wines must be Bordeaux blends; otherwise, they can be all over the map. This is an all-purpose, affordable red blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Black cherry and olive, smoke and some noticeable alcohol (14.4% is credited) define a sturdy red in wide distribution.

properties.title: Messina Hof 2007 Double Barrel Cabernet Franc (Texas)
properties.address: 4545 Old Reliance Rd, Bryan, TX 77808, USA
properties.descrption: Serious and solid, this Cab Franc delivers the goods with a complex nose of vanilla, coconut and orange clove pomanders layered over coffee and bittersweet chocolate. There's nice fruit in the mouth, with plum and blackberry shot through with notes of cinnamon. Medium, oaky finish. Serve with roast beef. Best 2011–2012.

properties.title: Bella 2007 Barrel 32 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 9711 W Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: This big, thick, oaky Zinfandel is powerful in flavor and not particularly subtle. It overwhelms with truckloads of blackberry and cherry jam, stewed plums, chocolate, mocha, pepper and cedar, and stings the palate with hard, astringent tannins and heat. The suggestion is ageability, but it's a gamble beyond 2012.

properties.title: Casa Montes 2006 Don Baltazar Reserva Syrah (San Juan)
properties.address: Pozo de Los Algarrobos, San Juan, Argentina
properties.descrption: Dark berry and meaty fruit on the nose, with plum and blackberry aromas. The palate is zestier, with bright acidity tempering any weight. The finish is solid, with nothing off or outlandish to consider. A good, solid, concentrated Syrah without a whole lot of varietal character.

properties.title: Château Cabezac 2006 Cariñu Red (Vin de Pays du Val de Cesse)
properties.address: 23 Hameau de Cabezac, 11120 Bize-Minervois, France
properties.descrption: Starts off a touch funky, but that subsides after a couple of minutes in the glass. Black plum and cassis are strong on the nose and mouth, backed by accents of vanilla, black pepper spice and roasted coffee granules. The finish is long and evolving, moving from black fruit flavors to cherry pits and ending on sweet oak flavors.

properties.title: Churchill Cellars 2007 Bella Luna Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: Canada, 350 Sheppard Ave E Second Floor, North York, ON M2N 3B4, Canada
properties.descrption: Here's a pretty, polished Pinot for drinking now with a nice steak. It's dry and silky, with good varietal flavors of cherries, cola, rhubarb, grilled mushrooms and smoky oak, finished with dusty spices. There's even a touch of barnyard.

properties.title: Fritz 2007 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 24691 Dutcher Creek Rd, Cloverdale, CA 95425, USA
properties.descrption: Very peppery and briary, with a slightly green, minty edge to the riper wild berries and tobacco. A good, gutsy Zinfandel of character and a sense of place.

properties.title: Massucco 2010  Barolo
properties.address: Via Serra, 21c, 12050 Castagnito CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of rose petal, violet, red berry and a whiff of baking spice lead the nose on this luminous red. On the accessible palate, notes of clove and chopped herb accent the wild cherry core. It's balanced, with bright acidity and velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.

properties.title: Muri-Gries 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
properties.address: Grieser Platz, 21, 39100 Bozen, Autonome Provinz Bozen - Südtirol, Italy
properties.descrption: Fruity and fresh, this opens with aromas of tilled earth, wild berry and cassis. The fresh, spicy palate doles out black cherry, white pepper, clove and a hint of green tea alongside velvety tannins. Enjoy through 2017.

properties.title: Ricossa 2011  Barolo
properties.address: 9030 Carroll Way Suite 8, San Diego, CA 92121, USA
properties.descrption: Pretty Nebbiolo scents of red berry, mint and leather emerge on this straightforward red. On the solid, balanced palate, firm tannins support red cherry, grilled herb and clove. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Tenuta L'Illuminata 2011 Tebavio  (Barolo)
properties.address: Località Sant'Anna, 30, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This opens with enticing scents of woodland berry, iris, wild rose and a balsamic note. The palate is still is still rather closed but offers raw red berry, chopped sage and star anise alongside bracing tannins and brisk acidity. Give this time to unwind and fully open. Drink after 2019.

properties.title: Bedell 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 36225 Main Rd, Cutchogue, NY 11935, USA
properties.descrption: Plummy blackberry and cherry flavors abound in this Cabernet Franc, anchored by a taut frame of fine, firm tannins and cranberry acidity. It seems lavishly oaked, but pronounced aromas of cedar and toast integrate smoothly on the palate. The long finish is marked by an enticing pencil-shaving edge.

properties.title: Corner 103 2012 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 103 W Napa St, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Light wisps of raspberry and strawberry highlight a restrained sense of winemaking, allowing soft tannin to buoy the fruit and medium acidity.

properties.title: Corner 103 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 103 W Napa St, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Structured and soft, this wine is also delightfully juicy, bright and succulent in red berry with a side of crumble, topped in milk chocolate and brown sugar. Full bodied, it remains balanced on the palate.

properties.title: Giacomo Fenocchio 2013 Nebbiolo (Langhe)
properties.address: frazione Bussia Soprana, 72, 12065 Monforte d'Alba CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of wild strawberry, rose petal, clove and a hint of tangerine unfold in the glass. On the fresh palate, notes of licorice and leather accent a core of black cherry offset by silky tannins. Enjoy soon to capture the vibrant flavors.

properties.title: Luigi Bosca 2013 Finca la Linda Smart Blend Red (Mendoza)
properties.address: San Martín 2044, M5507 Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Raspberry, red plum, chili pepper and balsamic aromas make for a complex, intriguing nose. This is 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, with 35% Syrah and 15% Tannat. It's juicy, rugged and spunky on the palate, with tomato-like acidity. Flavors of roasted plum and red pepper finish with heat, herbal notes and saltiness. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Margerum 2015 Riviera Rosé of Grenache (Central Coast)
properties.address: 19 E Mason St, Santa Barbara, CA 93101, USA
properties.descrption: Quite light in the glass but unmistakably pink, this Grenache-based rose shows a lime-driven citrus rind character on the crisp nose, gaining a touch of fruit from delicate watermelon and slight bubblegum scents. There is a touch of effervescence on the palate, where delicious and zesty lime, pink peach and more watermelon flavors come into play.

properties.title: Merry Edwards 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 2959 Gravenstein Hwy N, Sebastopol, CA 95472, USA
properties.descrption: An easygoing, approachable wine with lush texture and characteristics of soy, black olive and forest floor, this wine leans savory and quite minerally, with spicy acidity giving it a kick on the palate. Savory and juicy, it expands on the finish into a lushness of velvety goodness.

properties.title: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Meritage (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 7481 St. Helena Highway South, Oakville, CA 94562, USA
properties.descrption: Minty menthol surrounds red currant and berry in this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Savory black pepper dots a tightly structured texture and weight that mellows appropriately on the finish.

properties.title: L'Enclos des Braves 2013 Les Gourmands Red (Gaillac)
properties.address: 4371 Rte de Saurs, 81800 Rabastens, France
properties.descrption: Dominated by the local Duras grape, this spicy and fruity wine has an intriguing blend of juicy acidity and leathery tannins. It gives a wine that could benefit from aging while also being ready to drink now. Give it the benefit of the doubt and wait until 2016.

properties.title: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Excellens Rosado (Rioja)
properties.address: Av. Fuenmayor, 11, 26350 Cenicero, La Rioja, Spain
properties.descrption: Cherry and watermelon aromas are fair and easy, while raspberry and plum-skin flavors finish pithy and citrusy.

properties.title: Melrose 2012 Parker's Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
properties.address: 885 Melqua Rd, Roseburg, OR 97471, USA
properties.descrption: This is a barrel-selection reserve, with unusual scents of pine needles and baking spices co-mingled. Deep cassis and dark chocolate flavors prevail, and the tannins have not yet softened and smoothed. Give this a few more years of bottle age.

properties.title: Naggiar 2012 Mistero Red (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 18261 Rosemary Ln, Grass Valley, CA 95949, USA
properties.descrption: Not as full bodied as the tall bottle might indicate, this is instead a restrained, not-so-ripe wine that has an appetizing dryness, firm tannins and supportive acidity. It smells and tastes like dried cherries and cranberries, with a slightly astringent mouthfeel that will wash down rich foods well.

properties.title: Petra 2012 Ebo Red (Toscana)
properties.address: S. Lorenzo alto, 131, 57028 Suvereto LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Black currant, graphite and meat juice aromas lead the nose on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese. On the forward palate, notes of bitter dark chocolate and sweet spice accent blackberry jam and dried cherries. Tightly woven tannins provide the framework. Drink soon to capture what remains of the fruit richness.

properties.title: PoderNuovo a Palazzone 2011 Sotirio Sangiovese (Toscana)
properties.address: Località Le Vigne, 203, 53040 Palazzone SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Incense, exotic spice and red berries are some of the aromas you'll find on this Sangiovese. The palate offers menthol, coconut, oak extract, coffee and dried cherry alongside assertive, rough-edged tannins that dry out the finish.

properties.title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)
properties.address: N323, 5130, Portugal
properties.descrption: Soft, ripe and juicy, this wine is full of ready-to-drink fruit housed by soft tannins from light wood aging. Mainly fruit-forward in style, a bright acidity kicks on the finish to balance the palate out.

properties.title: Rainstorm 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
properties.address: 3004 NE Zimri Dr, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: Spicy cranberry/raspberry fruit is at the heart of this bright, quaffable and value-priced wine. There's a light dusting of pepper also, but it's the fresh fruit that stands out.

properties.title: Ravenswood 2013 Vintners Blend Zinfandel (California)
properties.address: 18701 Gehricke Rd, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Expressive, not expensive, this has an appetizing mixture of spice, herb and smoke aromas, plenty of blackberry and raspberry flavors, and a soothing texture. It smells like black pepper, dried thyme and wood smoke, then turns more fruity in the mouth. It is medium bodied and slightly soft in balance.

properties.title: Siegel 2013 Crucero Collection Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
properties.address: I-352 1360, Palmilla, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: Cherry and olive aromas are fair and sound, with a minty green touch. This offers a chunky, full palate and oaky, spicy flavors of black plum. The dark, toasty finish is solid, with kick and mild heat.

properties.title: Sierra Batuco 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)
properties.address: Batuco, Lampa, Santiago Metropolitan Region, Chile
properties.descrption: Earthy, dry and leathery on the nose, with slightly briny red-fruit aromas, this meets all the requirements of very good everyday Pinot Noir. Tea, brandied black cherry, spice and oak flavors darken up and turn chocolaty on the finish.

properties.title: Van Duzer 2012 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 11975 Smithfield Rd, Dallas, OR 97338, USA
properties.descrption: This is a forward, rather light, chocolaty wine. The berry fruit flavors are swathed in chocolate, and a suggestion of citrus keeps a frame around it.

properties.title: Argiano 2012 Suolo Sangiovese (Toscana)
properties.address: Località, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made solely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of roasted coffee beans, toasted oak and blackberry jam. The warm, jammy palate offers black cherry extract, licorice, clove and black pepper alongside massively stringent tannins that leave the palate feeling roughed up and dry.

properties.title: Georges Vigouroux 2013 Gouleyant Malbec (Cahors)
properties.address: Route de Toulouse CS20159 Cahors Cedex 9, 46003 Cahors, France
properties.descrption: Made to be drunk young, this surprisingly soft Malbec is ripe and full of smooth fruit. Juicy red berries come strongly through the light tannins that are accompanied by acidity and a fresh, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

properties.title: Guado al Melo 2013 Bacco in Toscana Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Località Murrotto, 130/A, 57022 Castagneto Carducci LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Bright berry and dark spice aromas waft out of the glass. A blend of Sangiovese and Syrah, the easy-drinking palate delivers blackberries, crushed raspberries and ground pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink soon.

properties.title: Indomita 2014 Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
properties.address: Ruta 68, Casablanca, Valparaíso, Chile
properties.descrption: This creamy feeling wine is dry and spicy on the nose more than bold and fruity. Candied cherry, raspberry and milk chocolate flavors carry mild spice accents, while the finish is lightly oaked in flavor and a touch chewy in texture.

properties.title: Celler Cooperatiu de Gandesa 2012 Somdinou Samsó Vinyes Velles Carignan (Terra Alta)
properties.address: Avinguda de Catalunya, 28, 43780 Gandesa, Tarragona, Spain
properties.descrption: Plum, berry and compost aromas are earthy and a bit herbal. Tight, drawing acidity drives the palate, while minerally plum and berry flavors are sinewy and tough, with raw tannins steering a rugged, staunch finish. Drink this gritty Carignan now through 2018.

properties.title: Finca Hispana 2011 Vina Hispana Roble Red (Priorat)
properties.address: 658 Co Rd 1334, Pittsburg, TX 75686, USA
properties.descrption: Interesting aromas of mint, Christmas spice, licorice and blackberry feed into a dense, blocky palate with firm acidity. Ripe, loamy flavors of blackberry and prune finish with oak-driven graphite, mint and resiny flavors along with a note of residual cassis. This is half Garnacha and half Carignan.

properties.title: Frei Brothers 2010 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 2018 Frei Bros Winery Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: There are lots of lusty flavors of briary wild berries, currants, sweet cured tobacco and peppery spices in this dry Zinfandel. It has smooth tannins and brisk acidity; by itself, it's rustic, but richly sauced meats should help tame it.

properties.title: Halleck 2008 The Farm Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 3785 Burnside Rd, Sebastopol, CA 95472, USA
properties.descrption: Soft and simple, this has flavors of raspberry and cherry jam and cola, which are slightly compromised by some unripeness. It's not likely to improve with age, so drink up.

properties.title: Hevron Heights Winery 2007 Judean Heights Tempranillo (Judean Hills)
properties.address: 4516 18th Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11204, USA
properties.descrption: Red cherry and raspberry aromas lead the bouquet, with secondary notes of red currant and savory herb in the backround. This is medium weight, with dusty but gripping tannins and a firm structure.

properties.title: Viña La Fortuna 2010 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Curicó Valley)
properties.address: Sagrada Familia, Maule, Chile
properties.descrption: Dark in color, this delivers black fruit aromas along with a toasty note. While it's slightly hollow in the middle, it's wide around the edges, tasting of mossy blackberry and herb. The finish is toasty, big and grabby.

properties.title: Calvet 2009 Réserve de l'Estey  (Médoc)
properties.address: Av. Jean Jaurès, 66460 Maury, France
properties.descrption: This has intense black-currant fruit, with stalky tannins and a bone dry, firm core. It's a finely structured wine, packed with tight fruit and acidity. Drink now.

properties.title: Château Lande de Bertin 2009  Bordeaux
properties.address: 8 Rte de Lamarche, 33910 Saint-Denis-de-Pile, France
properties.descrption: This is a fruity wine with a black currant flavor. As a contrast, the tannins offer a denser side, creating a food-friendly wine with fine dryness and a smoky flavor.

properties.title: Château Piron 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
properties.address: 2 route de Langlade, 33570 Montagne, France
properties.descrption: This is a soft wine, with attractive red-currant fruit and open, smoky tannins. It's well balanced between the fruit, tannins and acidity, which lends a crisp aftertaste.

properties.title: Cremaschi Furlotti 2008 Edición Limitada de Familia Red (Loncomilla Valley)
properties.address: L-15, San Javier de Loncomilla, San Javier, Maule, Chile
properties.descrption: The floral, candied aromas seem odd for Chile. On the palate this feels powerful and wide, with flavors of floral red berry, kirsch and spiced jam. It feels juicy and high in acidity; the finish lacks some texture.

properties.title: Cuevas del Sur 2010 Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)
properties.address: C. Triana, 90, 18813 Cuevas del Campo, Granada, Spain
