properties.descrption: Mouthfilling, mouthcoating and full bodied, this dark-colored wine blends ripe but not sweet blackberry and black-cherry flavors with dark chocolate and baking-spice nuances for a complex and delicious taste profile. It's rich enough in flavor and viscous enough in texture that the abundant tannins seem to be absorbed, and the mouthfeel is soothing. Best from 2018–2023.

properties.title: Keuka Spring 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 243 Route 54, East Lake Rd, Penn Yan, NY 14527, USA
properties.descrption: Gorgeous rose, plum and bramble notes perfume this exceptionally fragrant Merlot. Its complexity extends through the palate with bright cherry and plum flavors bolstered by savory nuances of olive and dried herb. Crisp acidity and fine persistent tannins guide a long finish.

properties.title: Enrique Foster 2006 IQUE Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: A draft of menthol and aromas of chocolate and mossy fruit work pretty nicely on the nose, while the palate is superripe, a bit candied and accented by spice and coffee. This is a strong starter, though it falls off a little on the finish.

properties.title: Hugh Hamilton 2005 Jim Jim Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.descrption: A good wine at a good price, the 2006 Jim-Jim Shiraz offers bouncy raspberry fruit, hints of cracked pepper and vanilla and a medium-bodied, reasonably lush mouthfeel. Multiple U.S. importers.

properties.title: Felipe Rutini 2005 Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Staunch cherry and grape aromas are indicative of what the wine will give. The palate pushes ahead with plum and cherry flavors, but the fruit isn't overly developed and the mouthfeel is more tight and sheer than cushioned and rich. Zesty and firm on the finish, which is par for this course.

properties.title: Brancott 2006 Pinot Noir (South Island)
properties.address: 180 Brancott Vineyard, RD, 2 Brancott Road, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand
properties.descrption: A lightweight, delicate Pinot Noir, with a light ruby hue and pretty cherry and herb flavors framed by oaky notes of brown sugar and vanilla. Good value.  Imported by Pernod Ricard USA.

properties.title: Maipe 2006 Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: 331 Victory Rd, Winchester, VA 22602, USA
properties.descrption: Sweet aromas that verge on syrupy set up a sweet and easy palate of black cherry and cassis. This has a nice texture as it shows good body, feel and fruit quality. Maipe means “lord of the winds” in a native language, and while this Malbec won't transport you anywhere, it's good for the price.

properties.title: Trapiche 2005 Oak Cask Syrah (Mendoza)
properties.address: C. Nueva Mayorga s/n, M5513 Maipú, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Big and boisterous, as if you're sniffing a bed of coal, menthol and macerated black fruit. The palate is sun-drenched and juicy, but not what you'd call elevated. And the finish mixes savory flavors with tight tannins. A good red wine that bears little semblance to Old World Syrah.

properties.title: Dutton-Goldfield 2009 Dutton Ranch - Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Mouthwatering acidity and berry freshness mark this muscular young Pinot Noir. It's gritty in tannins and brilliant in acids, with subtle flavors of sour red cherries, persimmons and cola, as well as a mushroomy earthiness to which oak adds exotic sandalwood notes. Very dry and fine, complex and provocative, a wine to let warm in the glass as it changes by the minute. Drink now–2015.

properties.title: Agricola Querciabella 2006 Camartina Red (Toscana)
properties.descrption: This luscious blend of mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese shows bright cherry and blueberry characteristics backed by smooth richness and velvety texture. The wine is soft, dense and delicious overall. It presents a beautiful portrait of Tuscan wine.

properties.title: Dutton-Goldfield 2009 McDougall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Somewhere between the acidity and dryness, this Pinot has a terrifically interesting core. It's a subtle wine, now suggesting cherry fruit, now retreating in favor of earthier mushrooms, minerals and pine needles, framed in firm tannins. Strikes out new territory for cool-climate Pinot Noir, less ripe, lower in alcohol and more exciting.

properties.title: Babcock 2009 Upper Crust Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 5175 CA-246, Lompoc, CA 93436, USA
properties.descrption: The real deal in a cool-climate Syrah. Dark and broodingly dry, it smells like grilled lamb, roasted rosemary, white pepper and other Provençal herbs, blackberries, cassis and smoky oak. High in alcohol but balanced, this 100% varietal wine is huge, powerful, dramatic and tannic. Drink it soon with the best grilled meats.

properties.title: I Giusti e Zanza 2007 Dulcamara Red (Toscana)
properties.descrption: This gorgeous blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot offers beautiful intensity and impressive complexity. Aromas here include black cherry, exotic spice, leather, fine tobacco and loads of plush, ripe fruit. It's a smooth velvety wine but the tannic backbone gives it lift and staying power.

properties.title: Fort Ross 2007 Fort Ross Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: A very beautiful wine that shows the exotic, feral quality of the greatest Pinot Noirs from the Fort Ross area. It's explosive in wild raspberry and cherry flavors, with hints of pine, cola, wintergreen, anise, bacon and smoky, sweet vanillins from oak barrels. A wine of great pedigree, it's showing well now, and should hold for the next six years.

properties.title: Keenan 2007 Reserve Mailbox Vineyard Merlot (Spring Mountain District)
properties.descrption: Just delicious, an important, elegant Merlot to drink with the finest steaks and chops. Even better than the fine 2006, with vast, deep flavors of blackberries, black cherries, cocoa, grilled meat and herbs, wrapped into rich, smooth tannins. Gets better and better as it warms in the glass. Drink over the next six years.

properties.title: Monteviejo 2007 Lindaflor La Violeta Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Dark and incredibly concentrated, with earth, black fruits, mint and exotic side notes. It's stout and tannic, but also rich and pure, with monster black fruit flavor and powerful coffee, toast and length on the finish. A smashing wine that's huge but delicious. Drink now through 2017.

properties.title: Vall Llach 2006 Red (Priorat)
properties.descrption: Earthy and deep as midnight, with spice, floral notes, herbal aromas, tobacco and mocha. The palate is super rich, almost to the point of syrupy, with blackberry, brown sugar and coffee flavors. Finishes chewy, ripe and deep, with no harshness or tannic grind. Drink now through 2013.

properties.title: Castello Banfi 2007 Summus Red (Toscana)
properties.descrption: Summus is a beautiful Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah that opens with a drying, dusty mineral feel followed by loads of plump, ripe fruit. Great care was executed in the clonal selection of Sangiovese and that variety delivers the wine's distinctive territoriality.

properties.title: Sheldon 2009 Ripken Vineyard Graciano (Lodi)
properties.descrption: This might be one of the most interesting wines being made in California right now, a tiny production, 12%-alcohol Graciano, a grape native to Rioja and barely found in California. The wine is bright and very European, full of white pepper, cranberry and leather notes, high in acid and very clean, though it's unfined and unfiltered. It lasts and lasts, getting better with every drop.

properties.title: Clendenen 2003 Brico Buon Natale Nebbiolo (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.descrption: One of the best Nebbiolos to ever come from California. The aroma dazzles with notes of tar, licorice, roasted meat, cherries, pepper and cedar. The wine is absolutely dry, with brilliant acidity, and seems to change with each moment in the glass. Just starting to dry out, but still fresh and lively. A remarkable wine at an amazingly affordable price for what you get.

properties.title: Arista 2009 Woodruff Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
properties.descrption: The oak sticks out now in the form of toast and sweet wood sap, but that's because it hasn't been integrated into this fine young wine. Give it 3–4 years to come around, by which time the barrel influence will equalize with the ripe raspberries, cherries, Dr. Pepper cola and red currants. Could be quite special around 2015.

properties.title: Dutton-Goldfield 2009 Devil's Gulch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)
properties.descrption: You can taste Marin's cool climate in the exotic, forest-scented pine needle, wild thyme and bitter cherry flavors of this elegant, complex young Pinot. It's completely dry and savory in acidity. An elusive, subtle, capitivating wine that should do interesting things over the next six years.

properties.title: Frenchie Winery 2009 Napoleon Red (Sonoma County-Napa County)
properties.descrption: With generic berry, cherry and chocolate flavors that are rich and ripe, this soft, simple red blend is O.K. for everyday drinking.

properties.title: Sutcliffe 2011 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
properties.descrption: Soft and heavy, tasting like the syrup of a cherry-cola drink. Ready for drinking now.

properties.title: Terra Jovia 2008 Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)
properties.descrption: This warm climate Primitivo opens with subtle tones of dried herb and light spice that give it a very Mediterranean feel. But there's also a touch of warm rubber that distracts from the overall picture. The high alcohol adds extra heat on the close.

properties.title: Finca Las Moras 2010 Reserve Malbec (San Juan)
properties.descrption: This is a hot, earthy Malbec with cover-up oak on the nose. A high-acid palate is drying and hard, with narrow, salty berry flavors and a peppery tasting, scratchy finish.

properties.title: Cosecheros y Criadores 2011 Sweet Torito Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
properties.descrption: Scratchy, dusty red-berry aromas are decidedly sweet yet hollow. This semisweet Garnacha tastes of gummy red fruits. A flat, cloying finish with candied flavors confirms its sweet status.

properties.title: Duca del Frassino 2010 Pinot Noir-Merlot Red (Venezia)
properties.descrption: A boxed wine, this blend of Pinot Noir and Merlot is exceedingly simple and one-dimensional but could be served at an outdoor baseball game. The mouthfeel is watery and thin.

properties.title: GEN 7 2008 Road to Zanzibar Red (California)
properties.descrption: Overripe and syrupy, Gen7's 2008 Road to Zanzibar—part Zinfandel, part Cabernet Franc and part Carignane—is big and soft, with the fruit in decline.

properties.title: O. Fournier 2012 Urban Uco Tempranillo (Uco Valley)
properties.address: Calle Los Indios s/n Valle de Uco, M5567 Eugenio Bustos, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: This is bright in color and loud on the nose, where it's distinctly medicinal and minty, with a strong green component. The palate doesn't differ; it's gritty and heavy in feel, with forced, jammy flavors of mint, grass and bitter black fruits.

properties.title: Opolo 2011 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 7110 Vineyard Dr, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Soft, and rich with glycerine and alcohol, this Zin is almost a Port wine on the palate. Drunk on its own, it's simple and awkward, but paté is kind to it.

properties.title: Opolo 2011 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Overripe, with raisiny flavors, and hot in alcohol. Tart acidity gives it cut.

properties.title: Opolo 2011 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Way too high in alcohol, giving it the ripe, hot, raisiny taste of a simple Port.

properties.title: Figgins 2010 Estate Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 2900 Melrose St, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: This is the third release of Figgins, a single wine produced by Leonetti's Chris Figgins from his Figgins Estate vineyard. Intensely aromatic, it explodes from the glass with baking spices and deep cassis fruit. Over the course of three days it opened into a sleek, stylish, complex mix of purple- and black-berries, dried herbs, bark, dusty cocoa and a streak of caramel. Long and lush, it's a wine to cellar for a decade or more.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2011 Terra de Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: A new bottling from the winery. The vineyard is in the Petaluma Gap, a cool area south of the Russian River Valley, toward San Francisco. The vintage was cool, too, so the wine is brisk in acidity and low in alcohol, but it still tastes amazingly ripe and complex. The wine dazzles with waves of black raspberry jam, sweet olive tapenade, sautéed brown mushroom, root beer, moo-shu plum sauce and mocha. If those flavors sound like they don't go together, just try the wine. It's seamless and compelling. Drink now–2020.

properties.title: Von Strasser 2010 Reserve Red (Diamond Mountain District)
properties.address: 965 Silverado Trail N, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.descrption: This is a 40-40 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, with the balance consisting of Merlot. It's a barrel selection of the winery's best lots, from its various vineyards, and has been aged in 100% new French oak. Yet it's not oaky at all, with the wood bringing only additional sweet, smoky richness to the red currants, cherries, dark chocolate and spices. This is a superb wine, delicious right out of the bottle, but it should develop and, depending on your tastes, improve over the next 20 years.

properties.title: Failla 2011 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Lucky Failla gets to source grapes from this vineyard that most winemakers would trade their left arm for. It's lush, ripe and amazingly generous in raspberries and cherries, yet retains an elegant balance, as well as fine, mouthwatering acidity. Part of the attraction is low alcohol, which lets the stones and earthy complexities of the wine shine through. This is really a brilliant wine—light, delicate and powerful. If you want to age it for eight years or so, you won't be sorry.

properties.title: Siduri 2007 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.descrption: Made in the fruit-forward, balanced and delicious style that is Siduri's, this is their basic Santa Lucia regional blend. It's quite a good wine, rich in currant, cherry, root beer, chocolate, mint and pepper flavors. Best now and for a few years.

properties.title: Siduri 2007 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
properties.address: 235 Healdsburg Ave, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Here's a big, thick, rich, jammy young Pinot Noir. With its eruption of berry, cherry, milk chocolate and anise spice flavors and dramatic tannic structure, it's not particularly subtle, but will excite fans of extracted Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noirs. Will probably age for many years.

properties.title: Fort Ross 2005 Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Quite rich and full-bodied, this dry young Pinot is loaded with oodles of red currants, cherries, mocha and cola. It's a little hard and angular in tannins, suggesting midterm ageability. Best now, with decanting, and through 2011 or so.

properties.title: Barrister 2006 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Cabernet Franc has been the signature wine for Barrister since the first release in 2001. Once again it comes out dark and smoky in the house style, but with more spine and muscle than the Barrister Merlot. It's fully ripe and not at all vegetal, though you will find that it has the characteristic Cab Franc streak of pepper and coffee behind ripe black cherry and cassis fruit.

properties.title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2006  Pessac-Léognan
properties.address: 48 Chem. de Martillac, 33140 Villenave-d'Ornon, France
properties.descrption: Smooth, ripe and immediate, this is a wine that is developing deliciously, but fast. There is a great fresh, juicy character that balances with the ripe, full tannins. Don't age, just enjoy.

properties.title: Château Margaux 2006 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux  (Margaux)
properties.address: 33460 Margaux-Cantenac, France
properties.descrption: Delicate and elegant wine, with smoky fruit, ripe but freshened with a tight layer of acidity. It has delicious black currant juice flavors, but the texture remains light and the tannins soft.

properties.title: Château Montrose 2006 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.descrption: The second wine of Château Montrose is at a high level. With its ripe chocolate and sweet black currant flavors, the structure comes from dark tannins, which, as so often in Saint-Estèphe, are dry, but not hard, and have delicious fresh berry fruits to envelope them. A wine that is great for aging over 4–5 years.

properties.title: Château Potensac 2006  Médoc
properties.descrption: This is an impressively complete wine, the fruit right in context with the dark, dry tannins. All the elements are in place, from the initial juicy fruit to the soft, fresh close.This is an impressively complete wine, the fruit right in context with the dark, dry tannins. All the elements are in place, from the initial juicy fruit to the soft, fresh close.

properties.title: Vilafonté 2005 Series C Red (Paarl)
properties.descrption: An alluring nose of mint, mocha and blackberry leads into like flavors in this elegant, mouthwatering red blend from Zelma Long. Lush and unfolding, the wine offers ripe tannins and a long finish. Overall, balanced and confident.

properties.title: Girolamo Russo 2006 San Lorenzo  (Etna)
properties.descrption: Light and tonic in appearance, this Etna-based wine is a profound expression of elegance. You'll get drying mineral tones backed by blue flower and sweet almond nut. The mouthfeel is polished and streamlined. Pair it with cold water fish or white meat.

properties.title: Hedges 2006 Three Vineyards Red Red (Red Mountain)
properties.descrption: Concentrated and slightly earthy, this has more density and grip (as it should) than the C.M.S. red, but a similar profile (51% Merlot, 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Cabernet Franc and 4% Syrah.) Black cherry and plum fruits are wrapped in light smoke and mocha flavors. The fruit-driven coregently leads into soft, silky tannins that leave an impression of black olive at the end of a lingering finish.

properties.title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2006  Moulis-en-Médoc
properties.descrption: With its well-handled new wood treatment, this wine instead has gone for full-bodied richness. The wood is definitely an important element, but its ripe, smooth black plum juice and blueberry flavors share the honors of this delicious wine equally. In 2–3 years, this will be a wine for luxuriating.

properties.title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2006  Margaux
properties.descrption: This is a serious wine, tight and closed up at this stage. Around the dry core, the fruit is structured, not offering richness, but with a good, solid base of black currants. It needs time to soften.

properties.title: Château Preuillac 2006  Médoc
properties.address: Château Preuillac Lieu dit, Preuillac, 33340 Lesparre-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: Very much in the food style of Bordeaux, this wine shows the freshness of the 2006 vintage, while also offering some ripe weight. Flavors of fresh black currants edged with black plum skin are supported by a firm line of tannins, finished with a sweet, juicy, fleshy aftertaste.

properties.title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2006  Pessac-Léognan
properties.descrption: With its prominent new wood, here is a wine that goes for spice, caramel and high toast flavors. It has great power, a wine that is currently all structure, leaving the fruit to gain in richness at a later stage.

properties.title: Doyenne 2006 Métier Red Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: Fruit compote—plum and strawberry—is melded to light toast and coffee. The wine has juicy acids and a thickly satisfying midpalate whose fruit flavors linger on, adding a little peppery spice as the wine evolves in the mouth. Just a whisp of chocolate leaves you ready for the next sip.

properties.title: Quivira 2006 Wine Creek Ranch Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.descrption: A beautiful Syrah perfect for drinking now. It's softly tannic and dry, but very fruity, with forward flavors of blackberries, cherries, raspberries and milk chocolate, and an earthier grounding of tobacco, anise and leather.

properties.title: Sparkman 2006 Ruby Leigh Red Red (Red Mountain)
properties.descrption: This nicely structured Bordeaux blend's aromas begin with violets and roll into cherry candy, while in the mouth the wine is sweet yet firm, with tart acids that are tightly wound. A mix of berry, cherry and cassis fruit is counterweighted with citric acids. Tannins are ripe with hints ofcut tobacco, moist earth and black olive.

properties.title: Navarro 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.descrption: This straightforward, well-balanced, medium-bodied wine has everything in place for the lunch or dinner table. Aromas and flavors resemble red cherry, cranberry and light spices, while the body is not too light or too full. The texture is tangy and a touch tannnic while staying smooth.

properties.title: Les Frères Perroud 2013 Améthyste  (Brouilly)
properties.descrption: With a year's age, this wine has softened its intense fruitiness and ripened with a rich, soft texture and well-integrated acidity. A structure gives a dry edge to the red currant and cherry fruits that are rounded out with a perfumed aftertaste.

properties.title: Von Strasser 2012 Sori Bricco Vineyard Red (Diamond Mountain District)
properties.address: 965 Silverado Trail N, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.descrption: Almost equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Malbec, with a smaller make-up of Merlot, this wine tastes of an Italian deli somehow, offering a wealth of black olive and antipasti. The full-bodied finish dances in forest floor and cinnamon.

properties.title: Waxwing 2014 Blair Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
properties.descrption: A yellowish salmon in color, this wine shows hints of watermelon, bubble gum and cotton candy in the light and pleasantly uncomplicated nose. There is great energy on the palate, with more focus on a steely, metallic texture rather than ripe flavors, proving fresh, bright and quick on the sip.

properties.title: Chronic Cellars 2013 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 2020 Nacimiento Lake Dr, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: An excellently priced blend of 70% Zinfandel, 14% Syrah, 11% Petite Sirah and 5% Grenache, this shows crystallized raspberry and rose petals on the nose. The palate offers light cranberry and pomegranate fruit, boosted by black and white pepper. This bottling has lots of life and energy, but it's drinking great now.

properties.title: Domaine de Foretal 2014  Beaujolais-Villages
properties.descrption: This is a structured wine, firm with tannins as well as bursting with ripe red fruits. Its acidity is well integrated into the rich fruitiness. It could well age for another few months, so drink from 2016. Jean-Yves Perraud, the fifth-generation winemaker, uses old vines on sandy granite soil for this wine.

properties.title: Gran Cruz 2011 Quinta do Ventozelo Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
properties.descrption: This is an initially austere wine. A fine blend of fresh acidity and concentrated black plum fruits give the wine elegance. The finish is balanced by a brisk final acidity.

properties.title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Capoeira Tinto Red (Tejo)
properties.descrption: A blend of Castelão and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a soft and smooth wine. Red berry fruits are balanced by spice and tannins from a short time in oak. The wine is ready to drink, although waiting until late 2016 would make it even more enjoyable.

properties.title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2012 Couvent des Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)
properties.descrption: This wine is all about red berries and fresh cherries. Some tannins and an earthy edge to the palate add complexity. Drink this fruity, juicy wine now.

properties.title: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2014 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)
properties.descrption: Named after the village of Emeringes where the vineyard plots are situated, this wine offers both tannins and the freshest fruit. A red plum-skin texture gives a tight edge that also adds great freshness. The wine will develop over the next few months; drink from 2016.

properties.title: Domaine de la Madone 2014 Tradition  (Beaujolais-Villages)
properties.descrption: This deliciously warm and ripe wine has swathes of red fruit that are full of energy and richness. It offers a touch of perfumed spice and good acidity. Drink now, although the wine will be better from early 2016.

properties.title: Domaine du Vissoux 2014 Cuvée Traditionelle Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)
properties.descrption: This ripe wine has rich black fruits, a smoky character and a rounded, full-bodied texture. The old vines bring concentration, while the acidity gives freshness and drinkability now.

properties.title: Domaine Dubost 2014 Cuvée Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)
properties.descrption: This wine has dry tannins and some concentration as well as the bright, cherry-fresh Beaujolais fruit. That gives it a serious side with structure and potential. The 100% Gamay vineyard is on slopes in the heart of Beaujolais Villages. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Domaine Dupré 2014 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)
properties.descrption: This is a soft wine with a great depth of red fruits and fresh acidity. The tannins are light, just a hint of dry behind the fragrant, bright fruitiness. The wine, made from old vines, is ready to drink.

properties.title: Patland 2013 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: This blends nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah with a quarter Malbec and smaller addition of Merlot. They get along nicely, offering a lush, full-bodied palate that remains balanced, showing an exuberance of succulent cherry, tobacco, graphite and meaty leather.

properties.title: La Perla Marco Triacca 2011 Elisa Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
properties.descrption: Vibrant, linear and complex, this dazzling red has enticing aromas of wild berry, pressed rose, graphite and a whiff of smoke. The luminous palate is all about finesse and energy, delivering tart red cherry, crushed raspberry, mineral and baking spice. Even though it has an ethereal quality, firm but extremely refined tannins and bright acidity provide structure and balance. Drink through 2026.

properties.title: Langtry 2013 Serpentine Meadow Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)
properties.descrption: This wine has dark fruit and spicy oak flavors, plenty of concentration and a full body. It maintains a sleek, balanced feel despite the potent tannins of this grape variety. The finish is flavorful and long-lasting. Drink a bottle or two now and cellar several more until at least 2020.

properties.title: Vasco Urbano 2013 Heine Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
properties.descrption: An unusually dark color, even for this notoriously black varietal, makes this powerful wine stand out from the first glance. Full bodied, it piles on the flavor and layers of tannic texture in a bold but pleasing way. Rich, concentrated blackberry, dark chocolate, wood smoke and baking-spice notes fill the mouth and linger on the long finish. It will be best after 2020.

properties.title: Ernest 2014 The Artist Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.descrption: Earthy rose petals and a stemmy tartness shine in this wine, sourced from the Bush Vineyard planted to the Calera clone. Vibrantly complex hits of cranberry and orange add spiciness atop a lithe texture, with the ripeness considerably subdued.

properties.title: Boheme 2013 Stuller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 3625 Main St, Occidental, CA 95465, USA
properties.descrption: From a beautifully cool coastal spot dotted in redwoods, this medium-bodied wine shows struggle in its tight layering of acidity and vibrantly fresh blueberry and black tea, Chewy in texture, still-resolving tannin and oak give way to a succulence that's just beginning to be revealed.

properties.title: Adega Viuva Gomes 1934 Reserva Velho Red (Colares)
properties.descrption: This rare survival comes from Ramisco grapes planted on their own rootstock on sandy soil close to the Atlantic Ocean. Considering its great age, the wine is remarkably fruity and fresh. With a tarry texture and firm tannins it also has layers of red-cherry fruit and acidity. The wine is impressive, and not just a relic. Drink immediately after opening; it does fade quickly.

properties.title: Arpepe 2011 Sassella Stella Retica Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
properties.address: Via del Buon Consiglio, 4, 23100 Sondrio SO, Italy
properties.descrption: Alpine herb, crushed stone, wild berry, pressed rose and a whiff of tar are some of the aromas you'll find on this wonderfully fragrant Nebbiolo. The racy elegant palate delivers succulent sour cherry, star anise, wild mint and a balsamic note while assertive but refined tannins and vibrant acidity provide ageworthy support. A vein of flinty mineral closes the finish. Drink 2018–2028.

properties.title: Bethel Heights 2014 Southeast Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
properties.address: 6060 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
properties.descrption: The unique flavors of this special block match pretty red-berry fruit to aromatic suggestions of potpourri and bouquet garni. It's detailed and nicely knitted together, with a pleasing hint of coconut carrying through the finish.

properties.title: Brecon Estate 2014 Reserve Petite Sirah (Monterey)
properties.descrption: Black plum sauce, milk chocolate, pressed blackberry, black currant, hot gingerbread and caramel combine in a very inviting nose on this bottling. It's rounded, ripe and yet racy on the palate, with loads of purple fruit and flowers, a touch of clove and some candied plum. An excellent example of what Petite Sirah can be: juicy, structured and layered.

properties.title: Château Lascombes 2014  Margaux
properties.descrption: One of the largest estates in Margaux, Lascombes is now performing well. With this vintage the heavy over-oaking of past years has gone to be replaced with a wine that is full of black fruits as much as rich tannins. There is concentration and a good potential for aging. Drink from 2025.

properties.title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2014  Margaux
properties.address: 34 Av. de la 5ème République, 33460 Margaux-Cantenac, France
properties.descrption: This is a concentrated wine, packed with tannins and black plum fruits. It has some of the fruity crispness of the vintage although with its dark structure and concentration it is obviously a wine that needs to soften over time. Rich and juicy at the end, it will be ready to drink from 2024.

properties.title: Cowhorn 2013 Sentience Estate Grown Syrah (Applegate Valley)
properties.descrption: This opens with inviting aromas of wet hay, espresso grounds, peat moss and pipe tobacco. In the mouth the fruit kicks in—cassis and black cherry—with plenty of acid. The tobacco note rings clearly all through a long, satisfying finish. Fermented with native yeasts, 43% whole cluster, and aged for nine months in new French oak, it's a wine with a solid decade of life ahead.

properties.title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.descrption: Rich and concentrated, this wine is produced from vines on hills above the Pinhão valley. It offers firm tannins and ripe black-plum fruits. Full bodied and ripe, it is also young with new wood flavors and a dark structure. This wine will repay aging. Drink from 2020.

properties.title: Richard Rottiers 2015  Moulin-à-Vent
properties.descrption: The producer has several parcels in Moulin-à-Vent which go into this blend. It is a firm and structured wine at this stage: dense and with both spice and black fruits. It is obviously made for some long aging, so don't drink this serious wine before 2019.

properties.title: Robert Biale 2014 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
properties.descrption: From a historic vineyard property that has gone through recent restoration and some replanting, Old Kraft lies in the heart of the warm appellation, on its western edge below the Mayacamas Mountains. Mouthwatering red fruit takes on a brandy-like velvety hint of molasses as sturdy tannin rides shotgun with softly integrated oak. Cinnamon stick shines through on the finish.

properties.title: Wine & Soul 2014 Pintas Red (Douro)
properties.descrption: This wine with great potential is produced by the husband-and-wife team of Jorge Serôdio Borges and Sandra Tavares da Silva. it is structured, although the fruit is already rich enough to indicate its ripe character. Drink this smoky, wood-aged wine from 2020.

properties.title: La Crema 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: This wine is made in decent quantities, enough to hopefully find, and that's good news, given its quality for the price. Juicy, spicy and just the right amount of herbal, it has sizzling acidity that livens and refreshens the palate, dotted in chocolate-covered cherry, plum and clove.

properties.title: Lost Blues 2013 Walking Boss Syrah (Paso Robles)
properties.descrption: Savory pepper and raw-beef notes mark on the nose of this tightly wound bottling, as well as nut brittle and teriyaki aromas. Plum skins, lavender and carpaccio show on the sip alongside a wash of flowers and herbs, from lavender to rosemary. The tannins are mouthcoating and need time to develop. Drink 2018–2028.

properties.title: Château Cissac 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Solid, chunky wine, firmly tannic and tough. The weight of fruit is there to give promise for the future.

properties.title: Château Laforge 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: 3S281 Williams Rd, Warrenville, IL 60555, USA
properties.descrption: 88-90 Smoky ripe fruit, big and bold fruit with some firm tannins. The wine is packed with ripe berry fruits.

properties.title: Château de Lamarque 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 88-90 Soft, ripe, smooth, with delicious acidity and berry fruits. Some good density.

properties.title: Château Beauregard 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Rich, though a wine that seems to lack an inner core. It is all beautiful fruit, super-ripe, laced with acidity, missing the structure.

properties.title: Château Greysac 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc)
properties.descrption: 87-89 With intense acidity, this is a structured, firm wine. The extract is considerable, leaving an edge of bitterness. At the same time, the freshness gives point to the wood tannins.

properties.title: Château Plince 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Solid, chunky wine, full of dense tannins, concentrated fruit. There is a powerful feel to it.

properties.title: Château la Couspaude 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 87-89 The wine seems hollow, all tannins, missing the weight of fruit. It's dark, certainly and concentrated, but one-dimensional.

properties.title: Château Reysson 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Ripe new wood and spice with blackberry juice flavors, very rich and concentrated. It has soft tannins, very juicy.

properties.title: Château Siaurac 2010 Barrel sample Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Ripe and juicy, a forward fruity wine, with acidity and freshness. A wine for early drinking.

properties.title: Château Simard 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Very cassis in character, with fruit, some weight and totally juicy acidity.

properties.title: Château Bourgneuf 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
properties.descrption: 87-89 A delicious spicy wine, keeping the freshness and acidity in a red fruit style. The spice from the wood is too defined.

properties.title: Château La Serre 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Lovely weight and fruit with freshness and acidity. A very attractive wine with blackberry fruits, dusty tannins. Almost opulent.

properties.title: Château la Tour de By 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Smooth, poiished new wood along with sweet, soft tannins. A velvet textured, smoky wine.

properties.title: Château Picque Caillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
properties.descrption: 87-89 The wine is out of focus, with fruit lost in a structure that hasn't come together. It has weight and acidity, plum fruits showing slowly.

properties.title: Chateau Desmirail 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
properties.descrption: 87-89 Firmly structured, dense tannins and wood, leaving the fruit behind. Extraction is a problem here.

properties.title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
properties.descrption: 86-88 A lean wine, with the over-ripe fruit battling with the tannins. It is hard and over extracted.

properties.title: Château La Grande Clotte 2010 Barrel sample  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)
properties.descrption: 86-88 Firmly tannic, stalky with black currant and an edge of extracted bitterness.

properties.title: Château Fonréaud 2010 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
properties.descrption: 86-88 Intense wood aromas that are translated through to the palate. This is all smoky plank and structure.

properties.title: Château Balestard la Tonnelle 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: Château Balestard La Tonnelle, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: 86-88 Sweet, soft fruit, ripe and attractive, with some spice and fresh tannins. The wine is open, already developing.

properties.title: Château de Fonbel 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
properties.address: 1 Fonplegade, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: 86-88 Fine fruit, lovely black currant character, with fine acidity and great freshness. A delicious wine. There is some Carmenère in the blend.

properties.title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: Château Caronne, 33112 Saint-Laurent-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: 85-87 Pushing dryness, and tannins, the wine feels extracted, hard. The fruit doesn't catch up with the structure.

properties.title: Château Clauzet 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
properties.address: 46 Rue du Médoc, 33180 Saint-Estèphe, France
properties.descrption: 85-87 The wine seems too ripe, the fruit very rich, opulent. It has weight, a jammy character, the tannins out of balance

properties.title: Château Barreyres 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: 46 Rte du Port, 33460 Arcins, France
properties.descrption: 85-87 A dark wine, the fruit tasting a little over-ripe. It does have structure and acidity, but feels soft and flabby.

properties.title: Château Liversan 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
properties.address: 146 Fonpiqueyre, 33250 Saint-Sauveur, France
properties.descrption: 84-86 Tough, only with tannins. Very hard wine, firm.

properties.title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.address: 701 W 11th St, Coffeyville, KS 67337, USA
properties.descrption: With minty wood flavors, this wine is smooth and polished. It offers berry fruits from the blend of 10 varieties in this old-vine vineyard. With spice and some firm tannins in the background, it is ready to drink.

properties.title: Altocedro 2014 Reserva Old Vine Malbec (La Consulta)
properties.address: Ejercito de Los Andes y, Arturo Tregea 1, La Consulta, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Interest-stirring aromas of tea, stewed berry fruits, vanilla and oak segue into a chewy, dense palate with bulk. Savory, lightly herbal berry flavors are draped with oak character, while this Malbec tastes of grainy oak and toast on the finish. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Authentique 2014 The Corridor Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
properties.address: 5100 SE Rice Ln, Amity, OR 97101, USA
properties.descrption: The dark label and enigmatic name give it a spooky air, but this wine merits your attention. Plum and black cherry flavors combine with streaks of cola and red licorice. It's tasty, smooth and ready for drinking now through the early 2020s.

properties.title: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
properties.address: 17655 Winery Rd, Barboursville, VA 22923, USA
properties.descrption: This Cabernet Franc starts off with dynamic aromas of red cherry, red plum, bramble, fig and incense. These scents translate to lovely flavors that are complex, yet elegant. In body and structure, this is an intense wine—ample crushed-velvet tannins harmoniously mesh with racy acidity and a full body. The finish is long and evolving.

properties.title: Mi Terruño 2011 Limited Release Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
properties.address: Lamadrid Norte y Carril Viejo, San Roque, Maipú, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Rich aromas of molasses, chocolate and fig paste announce a ripe, thick Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon blend. On the palate, this is grabby, intense and oaky. Flavors of oak grain, graphite, chocolate and berry fruits finish saturated and heavy, lacking elegance.

properties.title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Matthew's Station Vineyard Tannat (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 2916 Laguna Rd, Forestville, CA 95436, USA
properties.descrption: Fresh fruit aromas, dominated by black cherry, expand on the substantial palate. This wine is a rich, robust and ripely built expression of a dark-horse grape in these parts. Black licorice dots a jammy concentration of fruit and of the rich texture, rewarding those who like their wines powerfully packed.

properties.title: King Estate 2014 Pfeiffer Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 80854 Territorial Hwy, Eugene, OR 97405, USA
properties.descrption: This is part of the limited edition Vineyard Designate series. Plum and sour cherry fruit flavors claim center stage here, with sweet baking spice accents and a light touch of caramel from a year of aging in 30% new French oak.

properties.title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Tom de Baton Red (Douro)
properties.address: Quinta do Ribeiro Santo, 3430 Oliveira do Conde, Portugal
properties.descrption: Produced from old vines, this generous wine is ripe with black fruits, with a juicy, dense texture as well as ripe tannins. The structure is comfortably cushioned within the rich fruitiness, giving way to a crisp, lingering aftertaste. Drink now.

properties.title: Minassian-Young 2015 Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 4045 Peachy Canyon Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Very dark purple in the glass, this bottling shows leathery red cherry, subtle nutmeg and ginger spice, a touch of baked soil and stronger caramel notes on the nose. Rich black cherry meets with vanilla on the palate, which is slathered with a strong simmering acidity that's refreshing although almost too potent.

properties.title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 R de Romaneira Red (Duriense)
properties.address: Cotas, 5070-252 Alijó, Portugal
properties.descrption: The Syrah in this blend gives an extra perfume and spice to this rich wine. Its tannins and firm structure are balanced by the black fruits, acidity and Douro minerality. This wine is ready to drink.

properties.title: Ehlers Estate 2014 Merlot (St. Helena)
properties.address: 3222 Ehlers Ln, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: This producer makes a perennial standout of the variety. It is subdued and elegant in its approach to the lengthy layered weight and the integrated fruit. Plum, cedar and black licorice form a core of flavor over soft supple tannin and peppery oak, ending in a burst of spice and leather.

properties.title: Germano Ettore 2011 Lazzarito Riserva  (Barolo)
properties.address: 1, 12050 Cerretta CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Earthy underbrush, leather, scorched earth, dark spice and toasted hazelnut aromas lead the way. The firm palate shows dried cherry, licorice and tobacco flavors alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2026.

properties.title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Grande Rocim Reserva Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)
properties.address: Estrada Nacional 387, 7940-909 Cuba, Portugal
properties.descrption: Vineyard redevelopment and a new winery contributed to this fine expression of ripe Alicante Bouschet wine under the direction of Catarina Vieira. It's rich and structured, reflecting the grape. The dark color and powerful spice and black-fruit flavors are right up front to give a dense wine that will always be firm. The wine comes in a very heavy bottle.

properties.title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Petit Verdot (Howell Mountain)
properties.address: 150 Olive Ave, Angwin, CA 94508, USA
properties.descrption: With a taste of fresh blueberry cobbler and pie crust, this well-made wine is from the producer's mountainous estate. Powerful yet soft, it offers further concentrated flavors of cinnamon, clove and smoke, with just a touch of violet on the nose.

properties.title: Colombaio 2009  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.address: 23845 Colombaio, Province of Lecco, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas that recall nail varnish eventually fade to reveal raisin, prune, chocolate and coffee notes that carry over to the palate along with plum, toasted oak and vanilla.

properties.title: Cupano 2008 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
properties.address: Podere Centine, 31, 53024 Loc. Camigliano, Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: This wine begins with aromas of ripe black fruit, prune, spice, leather and a hint of espresso. The palate is dominated by oak, delivering toast, roasted coffee bean, prune and fig alongside excruciatingly dry wood tannins that generate an abrupt and bitter finish.

properties.title: Giacosa Fratelli 2011  Nebbiolo d'Alba
properties.address: Via XX Settembre, 64, 12052 Neive CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This Nebbiolo is at first closed down and inexpressive. It eventually reveals subdued aromas of black cherry and raspberry with a whiff of spice that all carry over to the palate.

properties.title: Gran Castillo Royal 2008 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)
properties.descrption: Friendly but standard aromas of berry fruits and creamy oak set up a mature, earthy feeling plate, with berry and coffee flavors. A soft, aged, mature finish is earthy in character and ultimately a bit hollow.

properties.title: Sculpterra 2010 Statuesque Estate Red (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 5015 Linne Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Ultraripe fruit, strong tannins and porty, high alcohol give this wine a certain rusticity. Blended from Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petite Sirah in almost equal parts, it's rich in blackberries, red licorice, crushed peppercorn and sandalwood.

properties.title: Piccini 2008 Villa al Cortile Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
properties.address: Loc. Piazzole, 53011 Castellina in Chianti SI, Italy
properties.descrption: This wine opens with aromas that recall burned tire rubber, asphalt, coffee bean and eucalyptus. The palate offers jumbled sensations of sweet, mature plum, blackberry and powdered sage alongside green, astringent tannins that generate a bitter close.

properties.title: Scopone 2009  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.address: 180 Localita' Pod. Scopone, Montalcino, Si 53024, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of oak take the forefront, with ripe plum, roasted coffee bean, smoke and meat juices in the background. The palate offers dark berry layered with oak sensations alongside astringent wood tannins. It has an excruciatingly dry finish. Superior Wines, Siema.

properties.title: Raphael 2010 La Tavola Red (North Fork of Long Island)
properties.address: 39390 NY-25, Peconic, NY 11958, USA
properties.descrption: Hints of earth and mushroom, soy sauce and brine add umami to succulent blackberry and cherry flavors in this Merlot-based Bordeaux blend. The palate is crisp with sour-cherry acidity, and finishes with bold, chunky tannins that linger. It's showing quite a bit of maturity already, so drink now with a quick decant.

properties.title: Juris 2011 Selection Pinot Noir (Burgenland)
properties.address: Marktgasse 12-18, 7122 Gols, Austria
properties.descrption: A trim, redcurrant fruited light red that is very refreshing: this might even take to being chilled. Red-currant flavors are uppermost, the tannins are soft, light and ready. Drink this now while it's fresh and fruity.

properties.title: Kenwood 2011 Merlot (Sonoma County)
properties.address: 9592 Sonoma Hwy, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.descrption: Despite the difficult vintage and this wine's high production, Kenwood has managed to wrest plenty of raspberry and cherry fruit out of the grapes. The result is a pleasant, clean Merlot for drinking now.

properties.title: Merry Cellars 2008 Winemaker's Select Silhouette Red (Washington)
properties.address: 1300 NE Henley Ct, Pullman, WA 99163, USA
properties.descrption: Already entering maturity, the 2008 Silhouette is a blended red (Merlot, Zinfandel, Sangiovese and more) with spicy, toasty flavors. The fruit is drying out, and the wine turning generic, but still fine for near-term drinking.

properties.title: Merry Cellars 2011 Seven Hills Vineyard Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 1300 NE Henley Ct, Pullman, WA 99163, USA
properties.descrption: Pure Carmenère can seem heavily tilted toward the green, stemmy side of the Bordeaux equation, as it is here. Cranberry fruit, tight and tart, hits a wall of tannins, not entirely ripe. The barrel flavors need more time to settle in.

properties.title: Phipps 2010 Heller Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma County)
properties.address: 200 Taplin Rd, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: This Merlot tastes hotter than than its official alcohol. A jalapeño pepper heat seems to accentuate the ripeness, so that raisins and prunes star. It's a robust, somewhat rustic wine of limited ageability, but it will pair well with strongly flavored, spicy beef stews and barbecue.

properties.title: Ca' Momi 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.address: 2515 Napa Valley Corporate Dr, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: The wine is a little candied, with stewed cherry, brown sugar and cinnamon flavors, set off with good acidity. It's also a bit hot and oaky. Hard to see it aging, so drink up.

properties.title: Caparzo 2008 Vigna La Casa  (Brunello di Montalcino)
properties.address: Strada Provinciale del Brunello, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas recall nail polish remover, overripe fruit, oak vanilla and coffee. The palate offers black cherry mingled with vanilla, chocolate and sweet oak. However it lacks intensity and persistence and doesn't have an age-worthy structure. It closes on a drying, tannic note before trailing off.

properties.title: Casa Raia 2009  Brunello di Montalcino
properties.address: 283 Localita' Pod. Scarnacuoia, Montalcino, Si 53024, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: A densely concentrated but unbalanced wine, it opens with aromas of stewed prunes, plum, oak, coconut and espresso. The heavy wood influence carries over to the palate. Black cherry notes are overwhelmed by oak, vanilla extract and coffee bean. Drying wood tannins dominate the finish.

properties.title: Chacewater 2011 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 5625 Gaddy Ln, Kelseyville, CA 95451, USA
properties.descrption: A savory, herbal Merlot with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blended in, Lake County-based Chacewater sources from the Sierra Foothills for this wine, which imparts dry tannins and leather saddle throughout.

properties.title: Chalone Vineyard 2012 Gavilan Pinot Noir (Chalone)
properties.address: 32020 Stonewall Canyon Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.descrption: The name pays homage to the Gavilan Mountains where the grapes were grown. It's a good Pinot Noir for drinking now. Dry, crisp and silky, it has flavors of raspberry tea and pomegranates, with toasty oak notes.

properties.title: Château du Perier 2011  Médoc
properties.address: 19 Rte de Lesparre, 33340 Saint-Christoly-Médoc, France
properties.descrption: While the wine is light, it has a good balance between its dry tannins and attractive black currant fruitiness. With good structure, it will age over the medium term, so drink from 2016.

properties.title: Château la Fleur Poitou 2011  Lussac Saint-Émilion
properties.address: 1 Cravignac, 33330 Saint-Émilion, France
properties.descrption: Fruity while still solidly tannic, this is a ripe Merlot-dominated wine. It has a touch of bitterness, but the main flavors are of black currant, fresh berries and a strong line in acidity. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Aresti 2008 Trisquel Syrah (Maipo Valley)
properties.address: Unnamed Road,, Río Claro, Maule, Chile
properties.descrption: Black cherry and cassis aromas are sweet and ripe. The palate is lively and shows zippy acids along with roasted berry flavors that are juicy due to the fresh acidity. Darkens up on the finish, showing coffee, chocolate and good length. Uncomplicated, fruity Syrah.

properties.title: Bergevin Lane 2008 Oui Deux Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 70 N Colville St #106, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: In sharp contrast to the heavily oaked companion Syrahs from Bergevin Lane, the Oui Deux puts the fruit up front. Spicy and sharp-toned, it was co-fermented with 5% Viognier, and for all practical terms is a Stonetree Vineyard bottling. It should continue to improve nicely with a couple more years of bottle age.

properties.title: Bodegas Faustino 2005 Faustino V Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.address: Carretera Logroño-pamplona (N-111), S/N, 01320 Oion, Álava, Spain
properties.descrption: A very good value-priced Rioja with rubber and hickory on the bouquet along with light touches of cassis and red plum. Feels smart, fresh and lively, with a good blend of tomato, herb and red berry flavors. Finishes spicy and crisp, with an herbal, peppery accent.

properties.title: Bodegas Muriel 2005 Vendimia Seleccionada Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.address: Ctra. Laguardia s/n, 01340 Elciego, Álava, Spain
properties.descrption: Solid up front, with sweet and spicy aromas of plum, vanilla and candied berry. Feels full and good, with weight and thickness boosting up toasty, woody berry flavors. Dries out on the finish, leaving spice and a resiny taste. Drink now through 2014.

properties.title: Il Borro 2006 Pian di Nova Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Località Borro, 1, 52024 Loro Ciuffenna AR, Italy
properties.descrption: This edition of Pian di Nova from the Ferragamo-owned Il Borro estate in Tuscany shows ripe notes of raspberry and black cherry with slight shadings of bitter chocolate and spice.

properties.title: J. & F. Lurton 2009 Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol Red (Lolol Valley)
properties.address: 998 W Will Rogers Blvd, Claremore, OK 74017, USA
properties.descrption: Slightly clipped and hard on the bouquet, which is narrow and settles on berry fruit. Feels chunky and bottom-weighted, with dark flavors of black fruits, plum and boysenberry. Becomes more stylish with airing, but it's always fairly hard and compact in character.

properties.title: J. Rickards 2008 Ancestor Selections Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 24505 Chianti Rd, Cloverdale, CA 95425, USA
properties.descrption: They can't call the grapes old vine, because the vineyard is only 15 years old. But it was planted from clones that constituted an old vineyard that contained Petite Sirah, Carignane, Mataro and Alicante Bouschet. The wine is robust and rustic, with bright, briary berry fruit and spice flavors that will stand up well against any roasted meats.

properties.title: Kokomo 2009 Gopher Hill Block Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 4791 Dry Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: A difficult wine to assess. It's so ripe and forward in sweet cherry jam and smoky, caramelized oak that it seems like a mere fruit bomb at first sip. But something about the structure goes well beyond simplicity. Could develop bottle complexity over the years, but it's unpredictable.

properties.title: Mercer 2008 McKinley Springs Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.address: 3100 Lee Rd, Prosser, WA 99350, USA
properties.descrption: Quite oaky, the barrel flavors not yet integrated into the fruit, this starts out rough, then rolls into clean, light, pleasant boysenberry fruit flavors. Should continue to improve with more time in the bottle.

properties.title: Pezat 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur
properties.address: Windsor, CA 95492, USA
properties.descrption: A rich, ripe concentrated wine, packed with red plum and cherry fruits, lightly layered with tannins. The wine is immediately attractive, juicy, ready to drink.

properties.title: Podere Guado al Melo 2007 Jassarte Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Località Murrotto, 130/A, 57022 Castagneto Carducci LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made with a blend of Mediterranean and Caucasian grape varieties, Jassarte shows a green note of medicinal herb with forest berry and bramble. The wine is tight, bright and nicely acidic on the close.

properties.title: Pratesi 2007 Vigna di Carmio Riserva  (Carmignano)
properties.address: Via Rizzelli, 9, 59011 Carmignano PO, Italy
properties.descrption: This vineyard-designated Carmignano Riserva (a blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot) shows superlush tones of mature fruit, plum, savory spice and a touch of cured meat. There's a hint of bitter almond on the close.

properties.title: Telmo Rodríguez 2009 Dehesa Gago  (Toro)
properties.address: 01308 Lantziego, Álava, Spain
properties.descrption: Muscular plum and black cherry aromas come with citrus peel and herbal notes. The mouthfeel is stout and healthy, with chewy tannins and lightly baked flavors of sweet blackberry darkened by pepper. Jammy and ripe overall; good Toro for under $20.

properties.title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2009 Le Dix de Los Vascos Red (Colchagua Valley)
properties.address: Pres. Alvear 151, M5504 ABH, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Harmonious aromas of cassis, vanilla and mocha are inviting. The palate, however, seems narrow and high in acidity; it's grinding and choppy, with herbal, tangy flavors of berry and cassis mixed with tobacco and herbs. Finishes rough and scratchy, with a lasting olive flavor. A very good wine but not the best Le Dix by any means.

properties.title: Fulvio Luigi Serni 2008 Acciderba  (Bolgheri)
properties.address: Località Le Lame, 237, 57022 Castagneto Carducci LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Ripe fruit, spice, strawberry, plum, prune and rum cake characterize the intense bouquet of this hearty Bolgheri blend. There's a touch of sharpness or bitter chocolate on the close.

properties.title: Anakena 2009 Ona Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère-Syrah Red (Rapel Valley)
properties.address: Requínoa, Requinoa, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: Dark and compact up front, with earth, blackberry, herbs and tobacco on the nose. Feels pure and bright, with staunch acidity pushing deep blackberry, cassis and spice flavors. Mellows on the finish, and overall it's a very nice mixture of Cabernet, Carmenère and Syrah.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2009 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Marked by immediately likeable fruit in the form of raspberries and cherries, this pleasant Pinot has a rich coating of sweet, smoky oak. It's the most accessible of Williams Selyem's new releases.

properties.title: Casa di Terra 2008 Poggio Querciolo Red (Toscana)
properties.address: Strada Comunale delle Ferruggini, 162/A, 57022 Bolgheri LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Poggio Querciolo (Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot) opens with bright fruit and rich overtones of smoke and toasted espresso bean. The wine is densely concentrated and soft with a bitter almond finish.

properties.title: Castro Pena Alba 2008 Quinta Picos do Couto Vale do Viso Red (Douro)
properties.address: Quinta Serrado, Castelo De Penalva, Viseu, 3550 Penalva do Castelo, Portugal
properties.descrption: Concentrated, dark-fruited wine, with a severe, mineral edge that cuts through the black currant fruits. It is a wine for aging, potentially rich although always with a dry core of tannins. Keep for 3–4 years.

properties.title: Château Grand Tayac 2009  Margaux
properties.address: Rue du Grand Soussans, 33460 Soussans, France
properties.descrption: A fresh wine, with some of the richness of the vintage showing in up-front red berry fruits. The tannins are already well integrated, allowing the wine to show a softer side. It is for medium-term aging.

properties.title: Palmeri 2005 Van Ness Vineyard Syrah (Alexander Valley)
properties.address: 83 Main St, Nyack, NY 10960, USA
properties.descrption: A noble red wine, based on the finely ground tannins and superb integration of fruit and oak. There's a purity to the complex waves of blackberries, currants, Canadian bacon, dried herbs, black pepper and sandalwood, with a minerally tang that must come from the soil. Wonderful now, this great Syrah should develop additional bottle nuances over the next six years.

properties.title: Alta Vista 2006 Single Vineyard Temis Malbec (Uco Valley)
properties.address: Alzaga 3972, M5505 Chacras de Coria, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: This mighty Malbec opens with toasty oak, a pinch of sawdust and perfumed black fruit, vanilla and spice notes. The palate is lofty and rich, with beautiful berry and plum flavors. A smooth, sexy wine from the Uco Valley that shows that vineyard sourcing absolutely matters. Best wine from Alta Vista to date.

properties.title: Cascina Ballarin 2005 Bricco Rocca  (Barolo)
properties.address: Frazione Annunziata 115, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Cascina Ballarin's Barolo Bricco Rocca comes from the La Morra area of the Langhe and offers intense aromas of blue flower, violets, almond flowers, cinnamon and powdered licorice. The focus here is on elegance and harmony and the mouthfeel follows through with power and determination. This is a truly beautiful wine

properties.title: Rubicon Estate 2006 Red (Rutherford)
properties.address: 1991 St Helena Hwy, Rutherford, CA 94573, USA
properties.descrption: The new Rubicon, which is almost all Cabernet Sauvignon, brings to mind the 2003 and 2004. It doesn't have the sheer force of 2002 or 2005, but it's certainly a classic Rutherford wine, and has a good future. Bone dry, it shows herb-infused flavors of blackberries, cocoa, spices and smoky sandalwood, and yes, the tannins are dusty. Drinkable now, with a good decant, and should develop in the bottle over the next 6–8 years.

properties.title: E. Pira e Figli (Chiara Boschis) 2005 Cannubi  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Vittorio Veneto, 1, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Vintner Chiara Boschis took over this historic estate after the death of its founder Luigi Pira. She continues in a precise Barolo tradition that pays attention to quality of fruit and vineyard designations. The Cannubi cru, for example, is celebrated for the elegant nature of its wines. Here you will encounter fine aromas of orange blossom, wild berries, white mineral and delicate floral notes.

properties.title: Giacomo Grimaldi 2005 Sotto il Castello di Novello  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Luigi Einaudi, 8, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This expression of Nebbiolo offers elegant layers of berry, smoke, spice and cola that build in intensity and persistency over the palate. This is a cellarworthy wine that will drink best five to 10 years from now. When it's ready, pair it with braised lamb with aromatic herbs.

properties.title: Gianni Gagliardo 2005 Cannubi  (Barolo)
properties.address: Borgata Serra dei Turchi, 88, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Here's a boutique winery that has pushed forward over the generations to offer beautiful expressions of Nebbiolo. Of its three Barolos, we especially love this wine from the Cannubi cru: it embodies delicate harmony and lingering flavors of wild berries, mineral and spice. The wine is dry and firm on the palate and leaves a lasting impression of freshness.

properties.title: Giuseppe Rinaldi 2005 Cannubi San Lorenzo Ravera  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Monforte, 3, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This is an extraordinary Barolo with deep and intriguing layers of wild berry, orange zest, almond skin, light graphite shadings and lingering smoke or dried tobacco. The wine feel smooth and supple in the mouth and closes with firm tannins that give it backbone and staying power.

properties.title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2006 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)
properties.address: Lieu-dit "Les poujols", 46700 Vire-sur-Lot, France
properties.descrption: A wine that is proof that not all powerful wines also need high alcohol, this intense 13% ABV wine is concentrated, almost black in its color, a classic Malbec. It has all the solid tannins, structure, the darkest of black plums and licorice flavors. It should age well.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2007 Forchini Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: A big, boldly powerful but elegant Zinfandel, full-bodied in the mouth and dry, offering waves of ripe fruits and spices. The cool 2007 vintage has kept the wine from being too ripe, resulting in balanced flavors of blackberries, currants, licorice, bacon, cocoa, black pepper and Asian spices. Just terrific. Drink over the next six years.

properties.title: Mitolo 2007 Savitar Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.address: 141 McMurtrie Rd, McLaren Vale SA 5171, Australia
properties.descrption: Mitolo's top Shiraz offering from 2007 is its Savitar bottling, from McLaren Vale. This full-bodied, creamy, lush, expansive wine features aromas of toast and vanilla upfront, followed by mixed berries that seem to grow in intensity with every sip. Drink now-2020.

properties.title: Palmeri 2005 Stagecoach Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 83 Main St, Nyack, NY 10960, USA
properties.descrption: Tight and hard in tannins now, with a dusty astringency, especially on the finish. But there's a considerable heart of blackberries, currants and dark chocolate, accented with complex notes of violets, leather, dried herbs and peppery spices. Not ready now, but should easily negotiate the next 4–6 years.

properties.title: Bric Cenciurio 2005  Barolo
properties.address: Via Roma, 24, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This base Barolo from Bric Cenciurio offers everything you should look for in an excellent Nebbiolo from the Langhe, Piedmont. The wine is delicate and layered with soft shadings of berry fruit and spice. The mouthfeel is supple but determined with a blast of berry freshness on the close.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2007 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: This is one of the darkest of Williams Selyem's new Pinots and also one of the ripest. It's jammy in the intensity of raspberry and cherry fruit, with a savory, Dr. Pepper cola richness. The spiciness, which is one of winemaker Bob Cabral's specialties in capturing, is exotic. It's a big, fat, rich wine that needs decanting now, and should age for 4–6 years.

properties.title: Bodega Chacra 2008 Cincuenta y Cinco Pinot Noir (Río Negro Valley)
properties.address: Río Negro, Argentina
properties.descrption: Still the king of South American Pinot Noir, Chacra's “55” offers a beautiful amalgam of dusty Middle Eastern spice aromas along with raspberry, cherry and cocoa notes. It's a finessed but forceful (read: high-alcohol) Pinot with penetrating black cherry, plum and chocolate flavors, and the finish is long but hot in its youth. Doesn't lack for much of anything. Best from late 2010 through 2013.

properties.title: Viñedos de Paganos 2006 El Puntido  (Rioja)
properties.address: Navaridas Errepidea, s/n, 01309 Páganos, Araba, Spain
properties.descrption: Another stellar El Puntido, this time with excellent concentration and full-load aromas of black fruit, leather, fine dried cheese and cola. The palate is tight, properly stretched and racy, with bursting black raspberry and cassis flavors. Coconut and resin on the finish is the first and only glaring announcement of oak. Drink now through 2014.

properties.title: Viña Antigua 2011 Special Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Costa Flores s/n y, RN7, M5509 Perdriel, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Initially, this smells green, with aromas akin to salad. With time, riper berry notes and oak rise up. In the mouth, this has a choppy feel and edgy freshness, while flavors of stalky, lightly green berry fruits finish with an oaky, minty character.

properties.title: Waterbrook 2012 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 10518 US-12, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: It's unusual to see a Washington Malbec at this price. This one is generally pleasant, with notes of plum, peppery spices and light oak accents. It's soft and elegant, yet with some tannic astringency that adds a subtle edge.

properties.title: Henri Schoenheitz 2011 Cuvée Saint Grégoire Pinot Noir (Alsace)
properties.address: 1 Rue de Walbach, 68230 Wihr-au-Val, France
properties.descrption: Spicy and fruity, this is a lightweight, attractive and smooth wine. It has some undergrowth aromas, followed by red berry fruits, with fresh acidity at the end. Drink now.

properties.title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Meritage (Rutherford)
properties.descrption: This young, firm wine offers aggressive tannins and prominent acidity, with cherry, blackberry and prune flavors. The wine shows ample structure, so give this time in the decanter before drinking now.

properties.title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Signature Series Merlot (Oakville)
properties.descrption: This Merlot currently offers a dry palate and firm tannins. As it warms in the glass, subtle blackberry, cola and pepper notes emerge. It's pretty tightly wound for a Merlot, but it's attractively priced and should soften with a little time to breathe.

properties.title: Sojourn 2012 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 141 E Napa St, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Soft and rather simple, it conveys raspberry jam, cola, sweetened herb tea and smoky oak flavors. It's an easy Pinot to drink now.

properties.title: Demetria 2011 Pantheon G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)
properties.address: 6701 Foxen Canyon Rd, Los Olivos, CA 93441, USA
properties.descrption: There's a steady aromatic focus of graphite, Bing cherry and a brief herbal lift to this offering from a sustainably minded winery run by the Zahoudanis family. Once sipped, the delivery is more subtle, with lavender, rose, fennel, dill and a finish of bitter mustard greens framing sour cherry fruit.

properties.title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011 Crais de Chêne  (Fixin)
properties.address: 21220 Brochon, France
properties.descrption: From the good-value Fixin appellation, this full wine offers minerality but, more noticeably, a ripe, red-fruited feel, with acidity to give freshness. Hints of licorice show the wood aging. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Gloria Ferrer 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.address: 23555 Arnold Dr, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Earthy and feral, this Pinot from the Sonoma County sparkling wine house of Gloria Ferrer shows the producer's attention to detail with still wines. With soft layers of balanced wild strawberry, cedar and distinctive brambly spice, it'll serve perfectly alongside roast duck.

properties.title: Harney Lane 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)
properties.address: 9010 E Harney Ln, Lodi, CA 95240, USA
properties.descrption: Imagine coffee ice cream drizzled with boysenberry syrup and you get the gist of the flavors of this full-bodied, rather sweet Zinfandel. Aromas of toasted oak barrels and fresh roasted coffee beans leap out of the glass as you sniff, then rich cherry and boysenberry flavors coat your tongue.  The alcohol is noticeable, but it carries so much flavor along with it that it comes off as decently balanced.

properties.title: Maison Ambroise 2011  Côte de Nuits-Villages
properties.address: 8 Rue de l'Église, 21700 Premeaux-Prissey, France
properties.descrption: Rounded and ripe, it has tannins nicely embedded in the red plum and strawberry flavors. It's full-bodied and already showing a delicious, seductive side. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Adams Bench 2010 Reckoning Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 13590 NE Village Square Dr Suite 1040, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: This Bordeaux-style blend of 48% Merlot, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 10% Cab Franc looks a bit murky, unfiltered, and is currently showing a lot of influence from barrel aging. Medium-weight blackberry and cassis fruit is married to dark chocolate, with a dash of black olive in the mix. It's tasty for drinking 2017–2019.

properties.title: Girolamo Russo 2011 Feudo Rosso  (Etna)
properties.address: via 95012 ct, Via Regina Margherita, 80, 95012 Passopisciaro CT, Italy
properties.descrption: Made with the native grape Nerello Mascalese, this structured wine opens with aromas of coffee, espresso, black berries and subtle oak. The palate offers  up ripe black cherry and licorice, alongside bracing tannins and evident alcohol.

properties.title: Chester Kidder 2010 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 1604 Frenchtown Rd, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: This gets an extra year in barrel and bottle prior to release. It's two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Syrah and 5% Petit Verdot. Still tart and tannic, the wine carries a full load of herb and earth characteristics, with less impact from the fruit than the high alcohol would suggest.

properties.title: Fernández Gómez 2010  Rioja
properties.address: 11 NW Lava Rd, Bend, OR 97703, USA
properties.descrption: Pointed red-fruit aromas of currant and plum are light but direct. This feels fresh, with mild raspberry flavors and not a whole lot else. On the finish, mellow notes of vanilla and red plum are supported by not overly aggressive tannins. Drink this fresh Garnacha through 2015.

properties.title: Foundry Vineyards 2011 Alla Prima Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 1111 Abadie St, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Though less expensive than the Artisan series releases from Foundry, the Alla Prima seems better balanced. There's less new oak (though 40% is not insubstantial) and the alcohol is well under 15%. The wine weaves together cherry, dark chocolate and espresso with plenty of tart acidity to buoy it up.

properties.title: Ryan Patrick 2010 Rock Island Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14450 Woodinville - Redmond Rd NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: This is 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Malbec and 8% Syrah. The influence of 18 months in oak is showing strongly, though some very pretty raspberry candy flavors come through also. Give it extra breathing time to help balance it out.

properties.title: San Martino 2011 Siir  (Aglianico del Vulture)
properties.address: 12512 State Hwy 205, Lavon, TX 75166, USA
properties.descrption: This opens with fruity aromas of plum and black berry, alongside whiffs of tilled earth and spice. It's still a bit closed but the palate reveals black cherry, raisin and clove supported by a tannic backbone. Drink 2015–2021.

properties.title: Planeta 2011  Cerasuolo di Vittoria
properties.address: Contrada Sciara Nuova, 95012 Castiglione di Sicilia CT, Italy
properties.descrption: Cerasuolo di Vittoria is a light, fragrant red wine that pairs with creamy shrimp risotto or white meat. Measured and elegant in terms of intensity, it offers pleasing freshness.

properties.title: Château Trolliet Lafite 2009 Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
properties.address: Petit Caillou, 24500 Sadillac, France
properties.descrption: A classic Bordeaux-style blend, but mainly Merlot, this wine has a ripe feel, with a firm, dense structure. It has weight and ripe blackberry fruit, plus a fine line of acidity. Wait for two years, although it is drinkable now.

properties.title: Rainstorm 2010 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
properties.address: 3004 NE Zimri Dr, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: The second vintage of Rainstorm is smooth and pretty, showing flavors of ripe strawberry and chocolate that last through the finish.

properties.title: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
properties.address: Calle Of 602 - Coyancura 2283, Providencia, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: This is a full and chunky wine, with thick blackberry and varietally correct herb aromas. The palate has a firm feel and good texture, while the flavors of herb, chocolate, pepper and black fruit settle on a secure, fresh and lively finish.

properties.title: Castello Monaci 2010 Liante Red (Salice Salentino)
properties.address: Contrada Masseria Monaci, 73015 Salice salentino LE, Italy
properties.descrption: Bright, brambly berry and forest floor notes open this bouquet of this 80-20 Nergroamaro and Malvasia Nera blend. Touches of cherry and sun-ripened prune also make an appearance, especially on the finish.

properties.title: Altadonna 2010 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
properties.descrption: A bright expression of Nero d'Avola, this shows a pretty fruit note, backed by prune, spice and wet earth accents. It feels silky and supple, with soft tannins.

properties.title: Barboursville Vineyards 2010 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
properties.address: 17655 Winery Rd, Barboursville, VA 22923, USA
properties.descrption: Opaque purple in color, the nose smells equally dark, boasting integrated aromas of blackberry, cedar, graphite and charred sugar. Full bodied with tight tannins, the palate still manages to show some finesse, plus dried herb, mineral and cocoa inflections.

properties.title: Black Stallion 2010 Zinfandel (Rockpile)
properties.address: 4089 Silverado Trail, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: This shows high alcohol and a full-bodied mouthfeel, plus massive concentration of ripe, slightly roasted fruit. It's enormous in flavors of blackberries, sweet black currants and licorice, sprinkled with cocoa and black pepper.

properties.title: Château Haut Barrail 2010  Médoc
properties.address: 8 Rue du Maquis de Vignes Oudide, 33340 Bégadan, France
