properties.descrption: A generous ripe wine that has tannins that have been tamed by the dominance of the black fruitiness. The wine is smooth, ready to drink with its soft generous texture. Great fruit and rich tannins are well integrated. The wine finishes with a lift of acidity.

properties.title: Rexford 2013 Regan Vineyards Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
properties.address: 429 Ingalls St, Santa Cruz, CA 95060, USA
properties.descrption: Father-and-son vintners Joe and Sam Miller consistently deliver solid wines, including this twist-top Merlot that's aged in 50% new French oak. Its boysenberry fruit is awash in the green peppercorn, herb and crushed graphite character associated with the mountainous region. That pyrazine touch hits the palate, along with black pepper and dark chocolate spice, accenting the tangy red fruit.

properties.title: Ruca Malen 2012 Kinien Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Ruta Nacional 7 Km. 1059, Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: This bulky bullish Malbec opens with big tarry aromas that go heavy on the oak. The palate is tannic like the clack-clack of heels on a tile floor. This tastes earthy, oaky and like blackberry, while the finish echoes with those same flavors. Drink through 2023.

properties.title: Ruca Malen 2013 Reserva Petit Verdot (Mendoza)
properties.address: Ruta Nacional 7 Km. 1059, Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Dry spicy aromas accent woodsy berry scents. A tight focused palate jabs with acidity and poking tannins, while this tastes of lightly herbal cherry and berry fruit. Spicy flavors on a healthy finish help this along.

properties.title: Sbragia 2013 Teldeschi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 9990 Dry Creek Rd, Geyserville, CA 95441, USA
properties.descrption: As gamy as foie gras, and just as rich, this 100% varietal wine fills the palate with baked plum, licorice and intense ripe fruit that borders on confected. Soft tannins and supportive oak give it structure and breadth.

properties.title: Scenic Valley Farms 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 12423 River Rd NE, Gervais, OR 97026, USA
properties.descrption: Oregon is loaded with inexpensive Pinot Noirs these days, but very few are estate grown and carry the Willamette Valley AVA. Pretty and aromatic with engaging scents of cherries and cream, this has immediate appeal. Drink with pork, poultry, salmon and salads—this is your go-to, anytime bottle.

properties.title: Skinner 2014 Six Horse Zinfandel (El Dorado)
properties.address: 8054 Fairplay Rd, Somerset, CA 95684, USA
properties.descrption: This full-bodied and robustly concentrated wine has chocolate and cherry aromas, rich and ripe plum and blackberry flavors and layers of chocolate and vanilla on the palate and finish. It feels broad and juicy in texture, too.

properties.title: Spindrift Cellars 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 810 Applegate St, Philomath, OR 97370, USA
properties.descrption: Pale salmon in color, but quite robust in flavor and alcohol, this brings concentrated flavors of watermelon and raspberries, with all the freshness of the newest vintage. It's bright and focused, the very picture of what is most exciting about these seasonal Northwest rosés.

properties.title: Trapiche 2012 Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)
properties.descrption: Piercing aromas of char and creosote are like a laser pop surrounded by a note of blackberry. This is raw, tannic and hard on the palate. Chunky berry flavors are heavily oaked, while this is jammy in feel and tastes of blueberry on the finish. Drink through 2021.

properties.title: Venta del Puerto 2013 No. 12 Selección Especial Red (Valencia)
properties.descrption: Ripe berry fruit and gritty oak aromas lead to a full-bodied blocky palate with grating tannins. This is a heavily oaked blend of Syrah, Tempranillo and Merlot. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and wood spice finish with barrel char and depth. Drink through 2023.

properties.title: Kunde 2013 Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
properties.address: 9825 Sonoma Hwy, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.descrption: From the mountains above the winery, this blends 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Cabernet Franc, 24% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec. The result is a harmonious palate of dried herb, cedar and pungent violet flavors. Full-bodied concentration makes it rugged, accented with toasted oak.

properties.title: Lone Madrone 2014 La Mezcla Roja Red (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 5800 Adelaida Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: Although not super complex, this wine offers a great taste of little used grapes like Counoise and Cinsault. A sharp red cinnamon spice note kicks off the nose, with rose petal and cranberry scents that follow. The palate offers candied sour cherry and peppercorn flavors.

properties.title: Indomita 2009 Duette Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
properties.address: Ruta 68, Casablanca, Valparaíso, Chile
properties.descrption: Scratchy and dry on the nose, this turns lean and borderline sour in the mouth, with acidity running the show. Very zesty, with mild oak influence, this is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Carmenère.

properties.title: Hug 2008 el Conquistador Red (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 2323 Tuley Rd #120, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: This Bordeaux-style blend—with an addition of Mourvèdre—is soft, simple and cloying, with vegetal flavors alongside the sweet raspberry jam note. High alcohol makes for a hot mouthfeel.

properties.title: Grove Ridge 2011 Merlot (California)
properties.address: 932 Hilltop Dr, Spring Grove, PA 17362, USA
properties.descrption: Aggressive on the palate, this has harp acids that frame flavors of sour cherry candy and green mint.

properties.title: Casa Silva 2009 Angostura Gran Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)
properties.address: Unnamed Road, Angostura, San Fernando, O'Higgins, Chile
properties.descrption: This is charred and burnt smelling, with a rubbery, hickory aroma that covers up the wine's cherry and berry scents. The palate bears flavors of raspberry, pie cherry and green herb, finishing quick as a flash, with tannic residue.

properties.title: Cielo Malibu Estate Vineyards 2008 Rouge Red (Saddle Rock-Malibu)
properties.address: 31424 Mulholland Hwy, Malibu, CA 90265, USA
properties.descrption: Somewhat underripe, this Bordeaux-style blend has modest cherry and boiled asparagus flavors.

properties.title: Hug 2010 el Magnifico Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 2323 Tuley Rd #120, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: This is hot in alcohol, and it has a vegetal note, with modest berry fruit. The finish seems sweet—like cola.

properties.title: Bryter 2009 Hayley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.descrption: This is acidic and sweet, with a medicinal taste.

properties.title: Muscardini 2009 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
properties.address: 9380 Sonoma Hwy, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.descrption: This tastes barely ripe, with a vegetal flavor compromsing the chocolate and cherry notes. It's soft, making it fall a little flat in the mouth.

properties.title: Rochioli 2010 West Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 6192 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: We can quibble over whether the cherries are red or black, or if it's persimmons or pomegranates, or if the mushrooms are fresh or sautéed, but that's the point. This wine is so complex, it initiates discussion. Fine acidity and rich tannins provide structure, and although the wine is silky enough to enjoy now, you really want to give it 6–8 years.

properties.title: Riglos 2009 Gran Corte Las Divas Vineyard Red (Tupungato)
properties.address: Km 32, RP15, M5509, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: This wine takes you on a trip to an outer wine world where deep, cushioned berry aromas come with exotic perfumes, bath oils and crushed flower petals. It's ultrasaturated and jammy, but not clunky or heavy. This tastes like a storm of blackberry, espresso and Swiss chocolate, while black spices and length bring up the rear. A blend of 50% Malbec, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cab Franc; drink now–2017.

properties.title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2009 Red (Douro)
properties.address: Quinta do Vale Meão 5150-501 Vila Nova de Foz Côa, 5150-501 Vila Nova de Foz Côa, Portugal
properties.descrption: With its concentration and dark tannins, this is a wine that will need many years of aging. It is a serious combination of great style and great power. From one of the top Douro vineyards, this is a wine with an impressive, long-lasting sense of presence.

properties.title: McIntyre Vineyards 2012 Kimberly Merlot (Arroyo Seco)
properties.address: 31901 Sanchez Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.descrption: Aromas of freshly cracked pepper and boysenberry introduce this wine. Once sipped, the promised complexity slips away, with plum flavors and even tannins but not much lingering finish. Serve with burgers and meatloaf.

properties.title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2009 Rioja Bordón Crianza  (Rioja)
properties.address: C. Cabo Noval, 2, 26009 Logroño, La Rioja, Spain
properties.descrption: Roasted, slightly stalky aromas override the wine's traditional dry fruit and tomato scents. This is tight in the mouth, with grip and firm acidity. Flavors of tomato, herbs, roasted plum and spice finish with lasting herbal notes and a good texture. This contains 20% Graciano along with Tempranillo.

properties.title: Sanpaolo 2008 Aglianico (Irpinia)
properties.address: Via Amedeo Gordini, 3, 41013 Castelfranco Emilia MO, Italy
properties.descrption: This dense Aglianico opens with aromas that recall resin, nail polish remover, stewed plum and chocolate. The meaty palate offers overripe black cherry and prune alongside aggressive tannins but it's evolved and shy on freshness. It finishes abruptly, with an astringent, tannic close.

properties.title: Shalestone 2012 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
properties.address: 9681 NY-414, Lodi, NY 14860, USA
properties.descrption: Smoke and crushed granite lend a mineral tone to bright raspberry and cherry notes on this concentrated, juicy Pinot Noir. Sour cherry and red currant penetrate the palate, extending to a slightly astringent finish. Drink now to enjoy its youthful, fruity character.

properties.title: TerrAmore 2013 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
properties.address: 20680 Shenandoah School Rd, Plymouth, CA 95669, USA
properties.descrption: This unpretentious wine has a light fragrance of blue flower and black berry, while the simple palate offers fleeting black cherry flavors.

properties.title: Terre del Principe 2010 Piancastelli Red (Terre del Volturno)
properties.address: Via Municipio, 4, 81010 Castel Campagnano CE, Italy
properties.descrption: This thick, extracted wine is made from 70% Pallagrello and 30% Casavecchia grapes, a portion of which was overripened on the vine. It opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, oak, toast, prune and vanilla. The lumbering, monolithic palate is sugary-sweet, offering vanilla extract, toasted oak and sugar plum.

properties.title: Three Rivers 2013 Rosé Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: This tangy rosé opens with a burst of tart strawberry fruit, and rolls into a lightly creamy midpalate. It's in the peppery, tannic style of rosé, making it a good match for more substantial foods.

properties.title: Vestini Campagnano 2011 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)
properties.address: Via Casilina, 81044 Conca della Campania CE, Italy
properties.descrption: This wine opens with aromas of sawdust, oak, tire rubber, coffee and mature black fruit. The palate is also dominated by wood sensations, offering oak extract, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and espresso that smother the hints of ripe black plum that peek through.

properties.title: Corvo 2012 Rosso Red (Terre Siciliane)
properties.address: 900 Armour Dr, Lake Bluff, IL 60044, USA
properties.descrption: A juicy blend of Nero d'Avola and Nerello Mascalese, this wine offers blackberry and black cherry flavors in a friendly, easy-drinking style. It's perfect for everyday dinners and informal occasions.

properties.title: Di Giovanna 2012 Poggionotte Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
properties.address: Contrada San Giacomo, 92017 Sambuca di Sicilia AG, Italy
properties.descrption: Made from organically grown grapes, this opens with earthy aromas of tilled earth and ripe black fruit. The simple, one-dimensional palate delivers mature blackberry and plum alongside a fleeting note of black pepper. Enjoy soon.

properties.title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2009 Terre di Rivolta Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)
properties.address: Contrada Rivolta, 82030 Torrecuso BN, Italy
properties.descrption: This Aglianico opens with aromas of new oak, vanilla, chocolate and overripe black fruit, all of which carry over to the one-dimensional palate. It seems tired, and the sugary sweetness, dense concentration and evident alcohol give the wine a lumbering character.

properties.title: Girly Girl 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14701 148th Ave NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: Tannic and earthy, it falls on the dark, herbal side, cloaking its cassis fruit in flavors of tannin and stem. It's best drunk with grilled meats, or a good, greasy pizza.

properties.title: Clos Gebrat 2011 Red (Priorat)
properties.address: 7801 St Helena Hwy, Oakville, CA 94562, USA
properties.descrption: Stalky aromas infiltrate schisty plum and berry scents, while in the mouth this Garnacha-led blend of five grapes is jammy feeling. Stalky, roasted berry flavors are strong, while the finish is stalky tasting and gritty in feel.

properties.title: Felix Callejo 2011 Flores de Callejo  (Ribera del Duero)
properties.address: Av. del Cid, km 16, 00, 09441 Sotillo de la Ribera, Burgos, Spain
properties.descrption: This is black as night, concentrated and shows aromas of asphalt, lemon peel and blackberry. The palate is round and soft, with mellow tannins. The flavor profile is very ripe and focuses on prune and blackberry, while the finish is loamy in feel, with a licorice hint.

properties.title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Abanico Reserva Red (Dão)
properties.address: R. Santo Amaro 3, 6290-093 Gouveia, Portugal
properties.descrption: Powerfully structured and concentrated, this is a rich, tarry and tannic wine. The dense texture doesn't lose sight of the jammy black currant and berry fruits that are just underneath. For the moment, even after four years, the wine is very young, firm and dry. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Kangarilla Road 2012 The Devil's Whiskers Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.address: 44 Hamilton Rd, McLaren Flat SA 5171, Australia
properties.descrption: Is there any doubt that 2012 is a superb vintage for South Australian Shiraz? Here's another fine example, boasting sumptuous levels of black cherry fruit framed by hints of brown sugar, roasted meat, cinnamon and allspice. It's full-bodied and richly textured, with a long, velvety finish. Drink 2018–2030.

properties.title: Grizzly Peak 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)
properties.address: 1600 E Nevada St, Ashland, OR 97520, USA
properties.descrption: A compelling effort, stylish and dark, this has a crisp minerality that underpins fruit flavors of black cherry, fig and plum. The texture, length and definition are first-rate.

properties.title: Hirsch 2012 Block 8 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
properties.address: 57 Front St, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: A seductive smoky, earthy aroma leads to big and tart cranberry and raspberry flavors, surrounded by a velvety blanket of fine tannins that make the wine lip-smacking and mouthwatering. There is somewhat more frame than filling, so this will appeal more to fans of tension and elegance than power.

properties.title: Cristom 2012 Sommers Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 6905 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
properties.descrption: This wine has pleasing richness, lending warmth across a full palate. Forward berry and cherry flavors fill the mouth, offering an accessible burst of fresh flavor in a somewhat blocky frame. There's a jolt of spice and a streak of cola, all quite tasty. The wine spent 19 months in 53% new French oak.

properties.title: Cristom 2013 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 6905 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
properties.descrption: Pretty is the word that comes to mind upon sniffing and sipping this wine, with its beguiling strawberry and cherry fruit. It gathers strength in its core, while maintaining an elegant, well-structured acid/tannin frame. It's an outstanding value in Oregon Pinot from a top producer.

properties.title: Domaine Serene 2012 Two Barns Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
properties.descrption: Broad berry/cherry fruit flavors open up quickly, with lighter accents of compost and leather. This is a smooth, somewhat loose-knit wine, with pretty baking spices decorating the finish.

properties.title: Pelter 2013 Matar Petit Verdot (Jerusalem Hills)
properties.address: Ein Zivan
properties.descrption: Violet red in the glass, this wine features a bouquet of cherry, violet and vanilla. Flavors of cherry, blueberry, anise, ground black pepper and green bell pepper are fixed in a framework of tannins that offer full mouthfeel right into the orange peel finish.

properties.title: Penner-Ash 2013 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir
properties.address: 15771 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: This fragrant, musky wine is scented with dried rose petals, spiced cranberries, pepper and chocolate. It rolls comfortably into a full-bodied core with cherry cobbler, medium length and polished tannins.

properties.title: Puramun 2013 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)
properties.address: 5500 Abercorn St, Savannah, GA 31405, USA
properties.descrption: Right away, this smells smooth and complete, with a proper mix of berry fruit, oak and earthy aromas. This is Salentein winemaker José Galante's personal wine, and it's juicy on the palate and doesn't overreach. Blackberry, boysenberry and salty, meaty notes finish with a persistent dose of salt, which should make this all the more appropriate when served with beef. Drink through 2022.

properties.title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Reserva Red (Tejo)
properties.address: Quinta Lagoalva De Cima, 2090-222 Alpiarça, Portugal
properties.descrption: The wine is ripe, still young with its fresh fruits and acidity. The elements are all there to produce a dark and dense wine that has fine structure. It's a complex blend of Alfrocheiro, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, all of which will allow the wine to age over a good few years. Drink this impressive wine from 2017.

properties.title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2011 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)
properties.address: R. Direita nº 3, 2665-113 Gradil, Portugal
properties.descrption: Almost black in color, this is a hugely dense, dark wine. It brings out the tannic side of the grape with hints of black coffee and dark chocolate. Under all this concentration, there is some fruit that is still waiting to get out: black plum and black currants with fresh acidity. Just wait until 2017.

properties.title: V. Sattui 2010 Merlot (Napa Valley)
properties.address: 1111 White Ln, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: A little rough around the edges, but otherwise a soft, juicy wine for drinking now. It has pleasant cherry pie and ripe red-currant fruit flavors. Air it in a decanter or in the glass for an hour before drinking.

properties.title: Valiano 2010  Chianti Classico
properties.descrption: An upfront aroma of red currant leads the bouquet of this wine, with a secondary hint of bell pepper that carries over to the palate. It has a tight core of red cherry and raspberry flavors alongside some green vegetal notes and brash tannins.

properties.title: Edwin Dyer 2011 Le Cadeau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 1501 Diamond Mountain Rd, Calistoga, CA 94515, USA
properties.descrption: Sharply herbal, this shows a bit of a green edge, which comes across as bitterness on the finish. The pale red-fruit flavors hint at thistle and bramble more than ripe berry, but the balance is there to carry the wine well with food.

properties.title: Fiuza 2012 Native Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)
properties.address: Largo Gen. Guerra nº2, 2080-184 Almeirim, Portugal
properties.descrption: This is a fruity, wood-aged wine, showing spice and coffee flavors that complement ripe blackberry fruit. It's smooth in texture and has just the right touch of acidity. The wine is ready to drink. Screwcap.

properties.title: Foris 2011 Maple Ranch Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
properties.address: 654 Kendall Rd, Cave Junction, OR 97523, USA
properties.descrption: Considering the coolness of the vintage, this wine seems surprisingly ripe with notes of cherry, strawberry, herbs and ash. It's thick and weighty in feel, making it seem a bit ponderous.

properties.title: Lornano 2010  Chianti Classico
properties.address: Strada Provinciale 119 delle Badesse, 11, 53035 Lornano SI, Italy
properties.descrption: This has aromas of toasted oak, espresso and spice that carry over to the palate along with dark fruit undertones. It's lean and linear without enough rich fruit to carry the assertive oak.

properties.title: Agricoltori del Chianti Geografico 2010  Chianti Classico
properties.address: Via del Mulinaccio, 10, 53013 Gaiole In Chianti SI, Italy
properties.descrption: This leads with violet, berry and chocolate aromas, followed by plum and black cherry flavors laced with hints of espresso. It's simply structured with fresh acidity and solid tannins.

properties.title: Candialle 2010  Chianti Classico
properties.address: Localita' Candialle, Kilometro 34, IV, SR 222 Chiantigiana, 50020 Panzano In Chianti FI, Italy
properties.descrption: This barrique-aged Chianti Classico shows cherry and espresso aromas. It has very ripe cherry and raspberry flavors that are just shy of overripe, along with vanilla and coffee notes. You'll also find drying wood tannins that cut the palate short. David Bowler Wines, Lemma Wine Company.

properties.title: Hilanda 2009 Término de Arriba Monastrell (Jumilla)
properties.descrption: Black fruit, clove, char and mocha are the primary aromas on this heavily oaked, saturated Monastrell. The palate shows bullish tannins, bold acids and weight, while dark-leaning flavors of blackberry, stewed plum and mint come with enough acidity to cut through the wine's fat and oak.

properties.title: Querciabella 2010  Chianti Classico
properties.address: Via di Barbiano, 17, 50022 Greve in Chianti FI, Italy
properties.descrption: Made with organic grapes, this internationally-styled wine is still very much on its oak and is dominated by toasted wood, coffee and espresso sensations. Although the palate also shows a ripe plum flavor, it has an abrupt finish from drying wood tannins.

properties.title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)
properties.address: Quinta Lagoalva De Cima, 2090-222 Alpiarça, Portugal
properties.descrption: Spice notes from wood aging gives this wine a rounded character. Ripe berry fruits show strongly so drink soon while its fruitiness lasts. Screwcap.

properties.title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2013 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)
properties.address: Av. Zaragoza, 16, 50108 Almonacid de la Sierra, Zaragoza, Spain
properties.descrption: Dark and ominous in color, with a grapy, rustic, smoky nose, this Garnacha is high in acid, rubbery and tannic on the palate. Semisour black-plum flavors finish equally tannic and acidic.

properties.title: Coto de Hayas 2012 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
properties.descrption: Odd aromas of clove are smoky but mostly come across as weird and forced. This has a lactic, creamy mouthfeel with soft edges. The flavor profile is all wood, and resiny, clove-driven wood at that. A severely sweet, cloying, resiny finish is a lot to deal with.

properties.title: Sembro 2012 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Ribera del Duero)
properties.descrption: Right away this goes wrong; the nose is smothered with charred, burning oak that smells harsh and like chemicals. A tannic, resiny palate is barely acceptable, as are bitter, burnt, resiny blackberry flavors.

properties.title: Teillery 2014 Organic Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
properties.address: Armijo 815, Isla de Maipo, Región Metropolitana, Chile
properties.descrption: This smells forced and grapy, with murky undertones. Flabby on the palate, this organic red tastes nutty and earthy. An aftertaste of mulch and peanut is off base and highly questionable.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2013 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Seductively smooth and intriguingly aromatic, this blend of several knock-out vineyards along Westside Road—Allen, Bacigalupi, Bucher, Rochioli Riverblock and Williams Selyem Estate—is instantly delicious, sharing a concentration of cherry, strawberry and citrus that perfectly captures the essence of the fruit, accented by a tease of black tea. An earthy minerality wraps around dry, polished tannins, with a streak of just-right acidity, giving it a realm of juiciness and flavorful sophistication. Enjoy through 2023.

properties.title: Le Macchiole 2010 Messorio Merlot (Toscana)
properties.descrption: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, truffle, leather, black cherry and cedar lead the nose on this rich but elegant wine. The concentrated, smooth palate delivers juicy blackberry, black currant, freshly ground peppercorn, licorice, milk chocolate and tobacco alongside velvety tannins. Stunning and delicious, it's already drinking beautifully but it will also maintain for years. Drink through 2025.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2013 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Silky, with pronounced tannins that should mellow in time, this is an earthy, stemmy and perfumed wine. Succulent and balanced, it's brightly exuberant in black cherry yet brooding and complex throughout, changing slightly from savory to floral and back again. It's an incredible wine out of the gate; cellar with confidence, through 2021.

properties.title: Gramercy 2012 John Lewis Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 635 N 13th Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: This wine is a blend of top sites Les Collines, SJR and Red Willow. It's perfumed with notes of green olive, violets, dried herbs, mineral and smoked meat. The palate is tightly wound, sensuous and supple, lithe yet rich with tart fruit and savory flavors backed by tannins that need more time to come into their own—but this wine surely deserves it. It has all of the stuffing to be a 20+ year wine. Best from 2025 to 2032. Give it an extended decant if opening in the near term.

properties.title: Gramercy 2012 Lagniappe Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 635 N 13th Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Blended from Red Willow, Marcoux and Oldfield vineyards, this 100% Syrah offers aromas of green olives, brown stems, dried herbs and raspberries. The palate has densely rich yet exceptionally well balanced fruit and savory flavors that are creamy in feel. It's flat-out stunning, winning on grace and elegance rather than sheer power alone.

properties.title: Roche de Bellene 2012  Clos de la Roche
properties.address: 39 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Nicolas, 21200 Beaune, France
properties.descrption: The superb Clos de la Roche has produced a powerful and complex wine. It has concentrated black fruits and solid tannins while also showing a beautiful velvet texture that will develop into a sumptuous wine. It's still in the first youthful flush and needs many years. Drink from 2020.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: This wine, a regional blend, shows remarkable achievement in winemaking. Wild strawberry and red cherry exude on the entry, alongside floral elements of violet and lilac. Velvety, resolved tannins make it enjoyable from the get-go, layered in acidity for a buoyant lift on the midpalate and finish, which suggests cinnamon and tea. Enjoy now and through 2020.

properties.title: Coulson Eldorado 2000 Kipp Vineyard Mataro (El Dorado)
properties.address: Placerville, CA 95667, USA
properties.descrption: Soft and jammy, with black and red wild berry flavors and low acidity. ItÕs so soft and sweetly fruity itÕs almost like raspberry syrup, although it does have some structure and heat from alcohol. Fans of sweet wines will like it a lot.

properties.title: T'Gallant 2000 Pinot Noir (Mornington Peninsula)
properties.descrption: A pretty, light-weight wine that offers up smoky, herbal scents along with almost ephemeral wisps of red fruit. It's dry and delicate; a waif-like Pinot that could benefit from a little more flesh. —J.C.

properties.title: Hunt Cellars 2000 Outlaw Ridge Zinphony #1 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
properties.address: 2875 Oakdale Rd, Paso Robles, CA 93446, USA
properties.descrption: The brawniest of Hunt's releases, it borders on Port-like, with 14.7% alcohol and a burst of plummy, raisiny fruit. Other notes include char, smoke and a caramelized, pie-crust scent. Drinks big, slightly sweet, hot and peppery.  —S.H.

properties.title: Firefall 2000 Lone Meadow Vineyard Rosato di Sangiovese Sangiovese (Fair Play)
properties.address: 12282 Punch Bowl Rd, Groveland, CA 95321, USA
properties.descrption: From a newish appellation in El Dorado County, this is a copper-colored wine with richly sweet strawberry flavors and a peppery streak that lasts into the finish. It's dry enough for the dinner table. Try with cioppino. —S.H.

properties.title: Malesan 2000 Rouge  (Bordeaux)
properties.descrption: Despite coming from a universally hailed vintage, this generic Bordeaux is still weedy, herbal and lean. But it also has decent cassis and cherry fruit, some tasty vanilla and cinnamon notes from oak aging, and a tart, dry finish. It's light, but it hasn't been dumbed down for the mass market.

properties.title: Temple Bruer 1998 Cornucopia Grenache (Langhorne Creek)
properties.address: 689 Milang Rd, Angas Plains SA 5255, Australia
properties.descrption: This round, soft, alcoholic wine deserves praise for its spicy-peppery warmth and abundant cherry fruit. Those same qualities are also its biggest shortcoming: The low acidity and high alcohol make it seem a bit heavy. —J.C

properties.title: El Coto 1998 Crianza  (Rioja)
properties.address: Calle Cmno. Viejo, 26, 01320 Oion, Araba, Spain
properties.descrption: Smoky oak and dark cherry fruit with herb accents complement each other well in this medium-weight, even red. Leathery hints add complexity, and this tasty, straightforward Rioja never get harsh or astringent. Drink now–2004. —M.M.

properties.title: Grant Burge 2000 Barossa Vines Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
properties.descrption: Packed with grapey, plummy fruit, smoke and vanilla, this is solid entry-level stuff. It's not particularly rich or concentrated, but it is something that's uncommon at this price: balanced. That makes it an attractive by-the-glass option or barbecue companion. —J.C.

properties.title: Kenwood 1998 Massara Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
properties.address: 9592 Sonoma Hwy, Kenwood, CA 95452, USA
properties.descrption: . Unfortunately, 1998 was not 1997, when this bottling was very good. This vintage is less ripe, and so the wine has some green aromas and flavors, in addition to  blackberry. That makes the tannins stick out more. There's nothing to contain them, but if you pair it with the right, rich foods, it will be just fine. —S.H.

properties.title: Castillo Catadau 1996 Reserva Red (Valencia)
properties.descrption: Tasty in a tart way, with licorice hints, this well-balanced, medium-weight red shows plenty of herb-tinged, sour cherry flavor. Good acidity and moderate tannins make this a good match for grilled veal. Think Claret, but from southern Spain. Drink now–2004. Best Buy. —M.M.

properties.title: Canyon Road 2000 Shiraz (California)
properties.descrption: They call it Shiraz instead of Syrah because it fits the stereotype of a young, jammy Aussie red. It's ferociously youthful, with blueberry and black cherry flavors that taste like they're fresh from the fermenting vats. A wine like this is sharp and edgy. But it's dry, and has a lot to like. —S.H.

properties.title: Sunset 1999 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 1535 S Burleson Blvd, Burleson, TX 76028, USA
properties.descrption: Smells funky, with forest floor, humus and mushroom aromas mingling with riper scents of wild berries and sweet oak. The fruity flavors are well developed, and drink sweetlyripe, yet the wine has a one-dimensionality and is excessively soft. —S.H.

properties.title: Tamás Estates 1999 AVA's: San Francisco Bay/Livermore Valley Zinfandel (California)
properties.address: 5565 Tesla Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.descrption: Decent everyday sipper, with heaps of sweet berry flavors wrapped in silky bright acids and dusty tannins. It's kind of thin in structure and in the finish, but is a perfectly nice quaff for the price. —S.H.

properties.title: Ventana 1999 Syrah (Arroyo Seco)
properties.address: 38740 Los Coches Rd, Soledad, CA 93960, USA
properties.descrption: You want to like this wine more than you do, because it's from a great vineyard and a great vintage. The problem is thinness. It's got great bones, superb texture and dry tannins, and it's easy to taste the quality of the blackberry, pepper-infused fruit because it flatters the palate. But everything is diluted. —S.H.

properties.title: Patrick M. Paul 2000 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: This tiny winery makes just a few hundred cases per year. The Merlot is grapey and rustic, with Grenache-like fruit flavors and some rough, chocolatey oak. —P.G.

properties.title: Covey Run 2000 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Washington)
properties.address: 4123 US-17 BUS, Murrells Inlet, SC 29576, USA
properties.descrption: This blend consists of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 41% Merlot and the rest Cab Franc. Spicy and peppery, it has the telltale bell pepper scents of not-quite ripeness. But good value nonetheless, and structured for hearty foods. —P.G.

properties.title: Montecillo 1998 Crianza  (Rioja)
properties.address: Ctra. Fuenmayor, km. 3, 26370 Navarrete, La Rioja, Spain
properties.descrption: Angular and tasty, Montecillo's regular offering  is an appealing, uncomplicated ready-to-drink red. Dried fruit, herb and oak flavors meld nicely in this light-medium weight wine best for drinking now through 2004. Best Buy. —M.M.

properties.title: Royal Oaks 2000 Syrah (Central Coast)
properties.descrption: Clean aromas of cola, meat and wild berries are simple, and so is the wine in the mouth. Big fruit, spicy and sugary ripe, is wrapped in soft acids and tannins and a round, silky texture. Doesn't really drink like a California Syrah; more like a jammy, early drinking Aussie Shiraz. —S.H.

properties.title: Lucente 1999 Sangiovese (Toscana)
properties.address: Loc. Castelgiocondo, 53024 Montalcino SI, Italy
properties.descrption: Dusty and dry, this wine uses a higher percentage of Sangiovese than Luce and the result is a tougher, more austere wine that gets much of its character from dried spice and toast. Understated and restrained, you can almost taste the influence of co-creator Tim Mondavi.

properties.title: Surh Luchtel 1999 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
properties.descrption: From Chiles Valley, a heady wine with 15.3% alcohol that will appeal to fans of superripe Zin. The plummy flavors veer into Port-like notes of raisins and sweet chocolate, although the wine is fully fermented to dryness.  —S.H.

properties.title: Morlanda 1998 Crianza Red (Priorat)
properties.address: 43738 Bellmunt del Priorat, Tarragona, Spain
properties.descrption: Overtly, overwhelmingly oaky, a shot at the international style, this red from the hot region of Priorat just doesn't go anywhere beyond the wood. From stem to stern, the coconut-toasty oak renders all other elements subservient to an extent that grape and location are rendered irrelevant. —M.M.

properties.title: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2009 Pentatonic Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.descrption: The blend is 51% Merlot, the rest divided among five other grapes, including Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Consequently, it's a bit of a mish-mash, fruity to the point of grapy, medium long, with the barrel flavors unresolved. Give this one another year or two of aging to allow all the components to come together.

properties.title: Steven Kent 2008 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
properties.address: 5443 Tesla Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.descrption: Dense and meaty like a baked purple leather pouch, this is tightly tannic, with a lift of acidity on the midpalate and a hint of violet struggling to get out. It's an interesting wine; give it 3–5 years in the cellar or drink now with red meat.

properties.title: Brokenwood 2010 Pinot Noir (Beechworth)
properties.descrption: A nicely textured if somewhat oaky Pinot Noir, with cherry fruit that just sufficient to support the plush coating of vanilla and cedar. Long and layered but oaky on the finish. Drink now and over the next couple of years.

properties.title: Cermeño 2009 Tinta de Toro  (Toro)
properties.address: Ctra. Tordesillas, 13, 49800 Toro, Zamora, Spain
properties.descrption: From a good vintage like 2009, this modest Tinta de Toro has a lot to offer. It smells slightly rustic but full of fruit. The palate has a tannic but balanced feel, with dark, sweet flavors of cassis and blackberry. It's peppery and lightly herbal on the finish.

properties.title: Ferré I Catasús 2007 CaMerlot Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Penedès)
properties.address: Crta. Sant Sadurní, Km. 8, 08792 La Granada del Penedès, Barcelona, Spain
properties.descrption: Dense and somewhat roasted on the bouquet, with tarry, leathery aromas. This feels good but angular, with sheering acidity, firm tannins and solid flavors of red berry, plum, herb and pepper. It's lengthy but a little hot and grabby on the finish. A blend of 50% Cabernet and 50% Merlot.

properties.title: Fidelitas 2008 Optu Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14467 Woodinville - Redmond Rd NE, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: For the moment, this is rather hard and tight, with notes of black pepper around tangy berry fruit. There are interesting streaks of iron and graphite, and a balanced structure that suggests extended cellaring may be an option. This blend is 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc and 6% Malbec.

properties.title: Fielding Hills 2009 RiverBend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)
properties.address: 565 S Lakeshore Rd, Chelan, WA 98816, USA
properties.descrption: A whiff of volatility brightens up the aromas of this ripe Merlot. The structure is tight and compact, and the acidity is substantial. Clean fruit flavors of red and black berries can be found, but this is a year in which all of the Fielding Hills wines would benefit from a bit more bottle age to knit together.

properties.title: Val de Los Frailes 2006 Selección Personal Tempranillo (Cigales)
properties.address: Ctra de Cubillas de Santa Marta s/n, 47290 Cubillas de Santa Marta, Valladolid, Spain
properties.descrption: Roasted and leathery smelling, with aromas of brick dust, root beer and exotic spices. Feels grabby and astringent, with boistrous tannins. It tastes toasty and black, with baked berry flavors and tons of chocolate and spice. It feels a bit choppy on the finish, with an espresso-like aftertaste.

properties.title: Yering Station 2010 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
properties.address: 38 Melba Hwy, Yering VIC 3770, Australia
properties.descrption: This is very close in quality to the winery's reserve bottling, boasting fully ripe cherry-berry fruit made complex by hints of vanilla and button mushroom. It's supple, silky and lingering on the finish, marked by lingering notes of vanilla and berry. Drink now.

properties.title: Gifford Hirlinger 2009 Estate Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
properties.address: 1450 State Line Rd, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Toasty and firm, this pure Petit Verdot is rich with black cherry and cassis. Whiffs of smoke and a slight burn in the finish suggest that further bottle age will bring in more barrel nuances (from 40% new American oak) and smooth out the finish.

properties.title: M. Chapoutier 2009 Petite Ruche  (Crozes-Hermitage)
properties.address: 18 Avenue Dr Paul Durand, 26600 Tain-l'Hermitage, France
properties.descrption: An early-maturing Crozes-Hermitage, with aromas of violets and hickory smoke alongside charming blueberry and blackberry fruit. There's not much tannin in this medium-bodied wine, so drink it over the next couple of years for its easy charm.

properties.title: Puelles 2004 Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: This opens with a classic Rioja nose of leather, dried cheese, roast berry and spice. It feels chunky and quite solid, with roasted fruit, tomato and herbal flavors on a deep palate. This is long and a touch warm on the finish, but healthy and ready to drink.

properties.title: Puelles 2003 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
properties.descrption: Hailing from the very hot 2003 vintage, this wine is baked and full, with mature yet rich aromas. It feels thorough and weighty, with sweet berry flavors that are at their peak along with a chocolate note. This is warm, full and under control on the finish. Drink now.

properties.title: Concannon 2008 Selected Vineyards Merlot (Central Coast)
properties.address: 4590 Tesla Rd, Livermore, CA 94550, USA
properties.descrption: These vineyards seem to have been selected for unripe, vegetal grapes. Just manages to scrape by with a veneer of cherries.

properties.title: Pietra Santa 2009 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
properties.address: 10034 Cienega Rd, Hollister, CA 95023, USA
properties.descrption: A soft, gluey Pinot Noir, with almost no structure and bizarre cherry candy and medicinal flavors.

properties.title: Renwood 2007 Red Label Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 12225 Steiner Rd, Plymouth, CA 95669, USA
properties.descrption: Low in price, high in quantity, low in quality. Dry and tannic with an off taste, the wine doesn't get better with time.

properties.title: Finca El Origen 2010 Syrah (Mendoza)
properties.address: Ruta provincial 94 Km. 24, Valle de UCo, M5565 Los Sauces, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Rubbery on the nose, then sharp in the mouth, with herbal, sour plum flavors and weird funk as well. Bitter, tart and hard on the finish.

properties.title: Campo Marin 2006 Selección Crianza Red (Cariñena)
properties.address: C. San Valero, 1, 50400 Cariñena, Zaragoza, Spain
properties.descrption: Sweet red fruit aromas have a chemical artificiality to them. The palate is underdeveloped, thin and tastes medicinal. Drying and hollow on the finish.

properties.title: Castello Banfi 2007 Excelsus Red (Toscana)
properties.address: 1111 Cedar Swamp Rd, Glen Head, NY 11545, USA
properties.descrption: The 2007 Excelsus is a gorgeous super Tuscan expression (with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot) that shows quality and superior fruit on all levels. Castello Banfi has really hit a home run with this vintage. You'll encounter persuasive aromas of cassis, blackberry, chocolate, tobacco, curry leaf and deep renderings of exotic spice. The wine's texture is exceedingly smooth, rich and long lasting.

properties.title: Fattoria Petrolo 2008 Galatrona Merlot (Toscana)
properties.address: Loc. Petrolo, 30, 52021 Bucine AR, Italy
properties.descrption: Each new vintage of Galatrona proves, year after year, the enormous potential of Italian Merlot. This is a soft and beautifully decadent wine with plush and perfectly ripe aromas of black cherry, light spice, chocolate and tobacco. The smoothness, richness and persistency is simply unbeatable.

properties.title: Qupé 2006 Bien Nacido Vineyard 25th Anniversary X-Block The Good Nacido Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 4665 Santa Maria Mesa Rd, Santa Maria, CA 93454, USA
properties.descrption: A gigantic wine, one of the most powerful Syrahs in memory. Shows fabulously rich tannins from stem fermentation, sweet, spicy and earthy. The aromas and flavors are of mushrooms, grilled meat, blackberries, cherries, cola, black pepper and smoky cedar. Extraordinary depth and complexity, a very great California Syrah. Could soar off the charts in the next 2–3 years.

properties.title: Babcock 2009 Microcosm Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 5175 CA-246, Lompoc, CA 93436, USA
properties.descrption: From the southernmost part of the appellation comes this very deeply flavored Pinot Noir. It bursts in the mouth with mushu plum sauce and cherry fruit and the most marvelous feral notes of mushrooms, minerals, hung meat, forest spices and herbs. It's quite a tannic wine, giving it a brooding quality. Huge, massive, stunning. Should glidepath through the next 6–8 years.

properties.title: Au Bon Climat 2008 20 Years in the Shed with Bob at Bien Nacido Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 813 Anacapa St #5b, Santa Barbara, CA 93101, USA
properties.descrption: A stunning Pinot Noir. Feels soft as silk, yet crisp, tastes flamboyant yet controlled, a wine that contains many opposites. Made from a barrel selection of the best of winemaker Clendenen's Bien Nacido Pinots, it's superb to drink now. Hard to exaggerate its charms, with waves of spicy raspberries, cherries, cola and sandalwood. Really seductive and impressive.

properties.title: Bien Nacido 2007 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 4705 Santa Maria Mesa Rd, Santa Maria, CA 93454, USA
properties.descrption: From the vineyard's choicest blocks. There's so much going on here, it's hard to know where to begin. Explosive in grilled meats, blackberries, plum jam, licorice, coffee, chocolate, caramel, black pepper and Chinese 5 spice, yet bone dry, with smooth, rich tannins. Extraordinarily good now, and should develop in interesting ways. Certainly one of the best California Syrahs of the last few vintages.

properties.title: Poggio al Tesoro 2006 Dedicato a Walter Cabernet Franc (Toscana)
properties.address: Via del Fosso, 33, 57022 Donoratico LI, Italy
properties.descrption: Poggio al Tesoro, located in coastal Tuscany, is showing amazing results with Cabernet Franc. This plush and decadent expression boasts rich extraction and a long list of ripe, dark fruit aromas. It's a thick and meaty wine, with a smooth but rock-solid quality of tannin. Drink after 2015.

properties.title: Tres Exilios 2012 Bonarda (Mendoza)
properties.address: 1774 E Cruger Rd, Washington, IL 61571, USA
properties.descrption: Heavy, raisiny aromas open this stewed, overweight red with sticky flavors of prune and overbaked berry. A gummy finish shows no agility.

properties.title: Conquista 2013 Oak Cask Red (Mendoza)
properties.address: 8461 NW Prairie View Rd, Kansas City, MO 64153, USA
properties.descrption: Flat on the nose, then almost identical on the palate, this blend of Malbec, Syrah and Bonarda tastes grassy, lightly green and weedy. Cherry and berry flavors are weak. Tasted twice with similar results.

properties.title: Hollen Family Vineyards 2008 Bonarda (Mendoza)
properties.descrption: Murky and dark in appearance, this older Bonarda smells soupy and too much like clove. Tannic and pounding, this is a stewy wine with an abundance of oak-driven clove flavor. There's sticky residue on the finish.

properties.title: Anton Bauer 2012 Reserve Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Wagram)
properties.address: Neufang 42, 3483, Austria
properties.descrption: Earthiness, undergrowth and juicy wild strawberries tinged with wet oak leaf dominate the nose and palate of this exemplary wine. It is exquisitely silky and profound on the palate, with fleeting, gossamer tannins. With time, ripe red-cherry notions appear. The finish is complex and nuanced, with lovely earth, spice and fruit sensations.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2012 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Just beautiful, this wine combines spicy, arresting aromas, vivid, bright cherry and raspberry flavors, an electric mouthfeel and bracing texture. All nerve and muscle, and no fat, it is vibrant in acidity, with firm tannins that support the enticing fruit flavors. Virtually irresistible now, this will gain complexity through at least 2022.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2012 Allen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 7227 Westside Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: A perennial standout for good reason, this Pinot is light in color and elusive at first. Teasing in baked strawberry-rhubarb, it subtly offers a rare purity of focused fruit flavor, with gorgeous aromas of dewy rose petals playing a substantial supporting role. Thanks to subtle oak, the finish builds in terms of intensity, with the wine maintaining a delicate balance of minerality.

properties.title: D'Arenberg 2010 The Swinging Malaysian Single Vineyard Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
properties.address: Osborn Rd, McLaren Vale SA 5171, Australia
properties.descrption: D'Arenberg's lineup of single-vineyard Shirazes is especially impressive in the 2010 vintage, and this was one of my favorites. The aromas are tight, nearly impenetrable at first, then only stubbornly yielding hints of graphite, but the mouthfeel is expansive and richly textured. Aristocratic notes of pencil shavings balance supple tannins and layers of dark fruit, concluding in espresso and chocolate on the finish. Drink now–2030.

properties.title: Krutzler 2012 Perwolff Blaufränkisch (Südburgenland)
properties.address: Deutsch-Schützen Weinberg 205-252, 7474 Deutsch-Schützner Bergen, Austria
properties.descrption: Elderberry with edges of tar and smoke, a floral lift and lots of black cherry are the aromatic hallmarks. The palate is muscular but svelte. The structured core of ripe but firm tannin can barely contain the luxuriating, dark elderberry and cherry fruit. This is lovely and crunchy now but will be far better 2017–2018. This is both big and elegant.

properties.title: Alain Brumont 2007 Château Bouscassé Vieilles Vignes Tannat (Madiran)
properties.address: Château, Montus, 65700 Castelnau-Rivière-Basse, France
properties.descrption: This is dense, almost impenetrable, a rich wine that is still dominated by dark tannins and black fruits. A juicy element suggests it is still fresh, still young enough for fruitiness. Dark black flavors are still working their way through and developing. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Prieler 2011 Goldberg Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
properties.address: Hauptstraße 181, 7081 Schützen am Gebirge, Austria
properties.descrption: Aromatic and spicy fruit speaks here: ripe blueberry and black cherry with brooding insinuations of flower and earth. The customary pepperiness is in attendance, too, but the structured palate bids you to wait. This is firm and focused and for now tightly corseted. Give this until 2017–2019 in bottle for its full beauty and aroma to emerge.

properties.title: Williams Selyem 2012 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.descrption: Since this is the winery's largest production Pinot, but still under 1,000 cases, buyers actually have a chance of finding this full-bodied beauty. Sly on the nose, it is tense in toasty oak and chewy cherry, venturing into black cherry, blackberry and root beer. It's amply structured and robust, yet with silky tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

properties.title: Avennia 2012 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
properties.address: 19255 Woodinville Snohomish Rd #1, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: This wine shines with notes of smoked meat, mineral, dark coffee and earthy funk. The flavors are dense, rich and voluptuous, while retaining an exquisite sense of balance. It's an exclamation point of a wine that's approachable now.

properties.title: Blandy's 2002 Colheita Bual (Madeira)
properties.address: Av. Arriaga 28, 9000-064 Funchal, Portugal
properties.descrption: The sweetest of the Madeira single-variety wines, this Bual is still laced with intense acidity. That brightness is contrasted by the toffee and caramel flavors, yielding a wine that is superrich while remaining so fresh at the end. This fine wine is ready to drink.

properties.title: Cavallotto 2011 Bricco Boschis  (Barolo)
properties.address: via Alba-Monforte 104, Bricco Boschis, 12060 Castiglione Falletto CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Dark berry, mint, menthol and a balsamic note are just some of the aromas you'll get on this gorgeous wine. The full-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove, ground pepper and anise alongside firm, refined tannins. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2019–2026.

properties.title: Carlisle 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
properties.address: 6301 Starr Rd, Windsor, CA 95492, USA
properties.descrption: This substantial wine will age beautifully through 2023, so structured and elegant it is behind its layers and layers of coconut fritter, vanilla and strawberry-raspberry jam. Beguiling in floral violets and lavender, it has streaks of black pepper too, ending in a dream-like trance of earthy dust.

properties.title: Rizzi 2011 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)
properties.address: 2809 Copley Rd, Copley, OH 44321, USA
properties.descrption: Underbrush, truffle, ripe red berry, violet and pipe tobacco aromas emerge on this beautiful, structured red. The delicious, full-bodied palate shows ripe black cherry, fleshy raspberry, star anise, ground pepper and clove framed in ripe, velvety tannins. A generous, gorgeous wine.

properties.title: Vallana 2006  Gattinara
properties.address: 14022 Vallana, Province of Asti, Italy
properties.descrption: Alpine herb, underbrush, pressed rose petal, dried berry and a balsamic note are some of the aromas you'll find in this elegant Nebbiolo. It's still remarkably youthful, with bright red cherry, fresh raspberry, clove, white pepper and mineral flavors accented by notes of rosemary and sage. It's impeccably balanced, with tightly wound but fine-grained tannins and bright acidity that support the bright flavors and vibrant edge. Drink 2018–2031.

properties.title: Damilano 2011 Cannubi  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Alba, 122, 12060 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Fragrant blue flower, perfumed berry, leather, cake spice and a balsamic note are some of the scents you'll find on this gorgeous, forward Barolo. The delicious palate offers raspberry, wild cherry, cinnamon, white pepper clove and tobacco. Ripe, polished tannins make this already accessible but it will also age well for a decade or more. Enjoy 2016–2023.

properties.title: Ferrando 2010 Black Label  (Carema)
properties.address: Via Torino, 599A, 10015 Ivrea TO, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas of underbrush, leather, flint, wild berry and a balsamic note mingle in the glass. The structured palate delivers dried cherry, crushed raspberry, grilled herb and anise alongside firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Hold for additional complexity; drink 2018–2035.

properties.title: Giuseppe Rinaldi 2011 Brunate  (Barolo)
properties.address: Via Monforte, 3, 12060 Barolo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This beautiful wine opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, scorched earth, mint, menthol and a balsamic note. The vibrant palate boasts juicy red cherry, black raspberry, sweet pipe tobacco, baking spice, grilled herb and a hint of game. It's still young and nervous, with tightly wound but refined tannins and firm acidity. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2020–2031.

properties.title: Force Majeure 2011 Collaboration Series II Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
properties.address: 52274 Pleasant View Rd, Milton-Freewater, OR 97862, USA
properties.descrption: This is relatively light for Red Mountain Syrah—silky and tart with accents of orange peel and lemony acidity. The tight, tangy berry fruit shows a streak of chocolate, from time in 30% new French oak, and despite the cool vintage it finishes with some heat.

properties.title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Ripanço Private Selection Red (Alentejano)
properties.address: R. José Augusto Coelho 12a, 2925-538 Azeitão, Portugal
properties.descrption: Using Ripanço, an old technique of destemming the grapes after harvest with wooden rods, the wine has intense color and a smooth, rich character. It is rounded and soft, with a light layer of tannins offering backbone to the generous fruitiness. Drink after 2015.

properties.title: Mario Gagliasso 2008 Riserva  (Barolo)
properties.address: Regione Regione Torriglione, 7, 12064 La Morra CN, Italy
properties.descrption: This shows evolved aromas of stewed plum, resin, varnish and leather with a whiff of vanilla. The palate offers dried black cherry steeped in spirits, black pepper, notes of espresso, mocha and baking spice alongside soft, muted tannins. Drink through 2018.

properties.title: Campolargo 2011 Baga (Bairrada)
properties.address: bairro 3780, Estr. São Lourenço do Bairro 43, 3780, Portugal
properties.descrption: Firm and dense, this is a fine example of the Baga grape. It gives both juicy blackberry and red berry notes, with a solid layer of firm tannins. It has the power, the structure and the acidity to see sometime in the cellar. Drink after 2016.

properties.title: Sparkman 2012 Kindred Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 14300 NE 145th St #102, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: Fruity and dark, this Bordeaux-style blend is two thirds Cabernet Sauvignon and one third a mix of the four other grapes. The result is a wine with stiff tannins and excellent structure, with clean dark-fruit and forest-floor flavors alongside streaks of iron and caramel.

properties.title: Apex 2011 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)
properties.address: 357 Port Ave, Prosser, WA 99350, USA
properties.descrption: The aromas of roasted coffee bean, chocolate, and dark raspberry are light, while the palate is elegant in style with a good sense of balance and a lingering finish.

properties.title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 JP Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)
properties.address: Estrada Nacional 10, 2925-901 Azeitão, Portugal
properties.descrption: A 10 month stint in oak has given this rich wine a seriously spicy character supported by dark chocolate and black fruit flavors. Syrah, Castelão and Cabernet Sauvignon give this young wine tannins and a dark texture that needs to soften. Drink after 2016.

properties.title: Château Brethous 2012  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
properties.address: 28 Chem. du Jonc, 33360 Camblanes-et-Meynac, France
properties.descrption: Certified French organic with this vintage, this 100% Merlot is ripe, full-bodied and already showing its potential richness. Terroir-driven black fruits and generous tannins give a warm character to the wine that is then backed by black fruits and final acidity. This is a generous wine from the Verdier family, ready to age. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Ca'Romè 2010 Cerretta  (Barolo)
properties.address: Str. Rabaja, 86/88, 12050 Barbaresco CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Aromas include rose petal, grilled herb, forest floor, coffee and ripe berry. The palate is still rather closed but offers black cherry, vanilla and espresso alongside astringent tannins that give it an abrupt, drying finish.

properties.title: Charles B. Mitchell 2012 Estate Grand Reserve Red (Fair Play)
properties.address: 8221 Stoney Creek Rd, Somerset, CA 95684, USA
properties.descrption: Full-bodied and dry, this has a very deep, saturated color and aromas of spicy oak, raspberries and cherries. With velvety texture, fine tannins and a lingering finish, it's well structured and youthful tasting. It should improve through 2017.

properties.title: Château Bel-Air Ortet 2011  Saint-Estèphe
properties.address: 33570 Puisseguin, France
properties.descrption: Still firm, this has dark chocolate and polished wood flavors, as well as dark plums and berries. With the tight acidity, it's a wine for aging, dark and concentrated for the future. Drink from 2018.

properties.title: Domenico Clerico 2010 Briccotto  (Barolo)
properties.address: località, Borgata Manzoni, 22/a, 12065 Monforte d'Alba CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Not very expressive, this shows subdued aromas that recall coconut, toasted oak, espresso and raw, red berry. The palate delivers red berry, licorice, mocha and vanilla alongside mild tannins. It's already surprisingly accessible. Drink 2015–2020.

properties.title: Elyse 2010 C'Est Si Bon Red (California)
properties.address: 2100 Hoffman Ln, Napa, CA 94558, USA
properties.descrption: Here is a hearty, full-bodied and dry red blend with a vivid black cherry character and spicy accents like black pepper and fennel. Firm and quite tannic, it will pair nicely with rich meat or cheese dishes that need a little bite in the wine to balance them.

properties.title: Frank Cornelissen 2012 MunJebel 9 VA Nerello Mascalese (Vino da Tavola)
properties.address: Via Nazionale, 297, 95012 Solicchiata, Castiglione di Sicilia CT, Italy
properties.descrption: This is an intense, extreme wine made from Nerello Mascalese vines planted in the 1940s. It's handcrafted, with no selected yeasts or added sulfites, and aged in terra cotta vessels. It's loaded with smoky mineral, concentrated black cherry, black pepper, cinnamon and notes of balsamic herbs framed by solid, velvety tannins. The only criticism is a slight fizzy sensation, but total perfection isn't what this wine is about.

properties.title: Fulkerson 2013 William Vigne Zweigelt (Seneca Lake)
properties.address: 5576 NY-14, Dundee, NY 14837, USA
properties.descrption: While blackberry and cherry notes are lush and ripe on the nose, this Finger Lakes Zweigelt is surprisingly elegant on the palate. Sour cherry and tart plum flavors are concentrated and juicy, but lively in feel. The finish is extended by a fringe of fine, polished tannins.

properties.title: Dunham 2011 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 150 E Boeing Ave, Walla Walla, WA 99362, USA
properties.descrption: Syrah shows different aspects in cooler vintages such as 2011, which has brought out the leafy, herbal and peppery notes in full force. However this wine is ripe enough to offer plenty of good flavor, with brambly berry fruit that sings out for thin-crusted pizza.

properties.title: Borges 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)
properties.address: R. Infante Dom Henrique 421, 4436-909 Rio Tinto, Portugal
properties.descrption: This is a firmly structured wine, solidly tannic and still developing. Big black-fruit flavors have set their mark on the texture while the dry core brings out the schist soil of the Douro vineyards, giving a tough sensation that needs to soften. Drink from 2016.

properties.title: Il Falchetto 2013 Lurei  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
properties.address: Frazione Ciombi, 16, 12058 Santo Stefano Belbo CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Fresh and full-bodied, this offers aromas of black-skinned fruit, underbrush and dark cooking spice. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, plum jam and black pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity.

properties.title: Gianfranco Alessandria 2011 San Giovanni  (Barolo)
properties.descrption: Aromas of rose, violet, sour cherry and baking spice make a promising initial impression but the palate is on the lean side offering raw red berry, clove, sage and a hint of tobacco. Grainy tannins leave an astringent finish. Let the tannins soften up for another few years and then drink to capture the remaining fruit.

properties.title: Beni di Batasiolo 2011 Sovrana  (Barbera d'Alba)
properties.address: 10241 Sawmill Pkwy, Powell, OH 43065, USA
properties.descrption: Aromas of scorched earth, mature black-skinned fruit, blue flower, toast and Oriental spice lead the way on this full-bodied wine. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, licorice and ground pepper set against a backdrop of fine-grained tannins.

properties.title: Cascina Chicco 2014 Gramera Alta  (Barbera d'Alba)
properties.address: Via Valentino, n. 14, 12043 Canale CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Bright and fragrant, this opens with aromas of underbrush, rose, dark berry and a whiff of exotic spice. The savory, easy-drinking palate doles out black cherry, blackberry, white pepper and chopped herb alongside bright acidity.

properties.title: Château Bélingard 2012 Réserve Red (Côtes de Bergerac)
properties.address: Château Belingard, 24240 Pomport, France
properties.descrption: This ripe, fruity and structured wine is still young and the tannins need time to round out. However, it is already rich, with juicy red fruits and a core of fragrant acidity. The wine is dense and worth aging. Drink from 2017.

properties.title: Dominio de Tares 2012 Baltos Mencía (Bierzo)
properties.address: Calle Los Barredos, 4, 24318 San Román de Bembibre, León, Spain
properties.descrption: Jammy aromas of blackberry and cassis start out gaseous and muddled but find their way with airing. This feels wide and low on zest. Flavors of prune and stewed berry end with toasty oak but also heavy ripe prune and berry flavors. Drink now.

properties.title: El Esteco 2012 Ciclos Icono Malbec-Merlot (Calchaquí Valley)
properties.address: RN40 km 4343, A4427 Cafayate, Salta, Argentina
properties.descrption: The nose on this Malbec-Merlot from Salta is raw and saucy, with more brawn and rusticity than elegance. A compact grabby palate is intense, with herbal plum and hefty berry notes that mellow on a chunky lightly herbal finish.

properties.title: Ellena 2011 Ascheri  (Barolo)
properties.address: 100 Pratt Ave, St Helena, CA 94574, USA
properties.descrption: Toast, espresso, coffee bean and dark berry aromas emerge on this firmly structured red. It's still very much on its oak, showing unripe sour cherry backed up by oak-driven spice including vanilla and coconut alongside grippy tannins.

properties.title: Giribaldi 2011  Barolo
properties.address: Via della Fontana, 1 Bis, 12050 Rodello CN, Italy
properties.descrption: Toast, espresso and mocha aromas lead the nose while the bracing palate offers raw red berry, anise, coffee and a hint of chocolate. Grainy tannins provide firm support but leave an astringent finish. Wait another few years for the tannins to soften a bit then drink up.

properties.title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 José de Sousa Red (Alentejano)
properties.address: R. José Augusto Coelho 12a, 2925-538 Azeitão, Portugal
properties.descrption: This is an open juicy and fruity wine. It has soft tannins and perfumed acidity that is already integrated into the structure of the wine. With blackberry and red plum flavors, it is easy and generous, ready to drink now.

properties.title: La Folia Winery 2012 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
properties.address: 263 Main St, Murphys, CA 95228, USA
properties.descrption: This has a well-aged aroma plus tangy raspberry and cranberry flavors. It offers good balance between flavor, crispness and firm tannins. Most of all, it conveys a personality that mirrors this grape variety's Italian roots. It's dry, medium bodied and slightly astringent in texture.

properties.title: Longboard 2013 DaKine Vineyard Merlot (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 5 Fitch St, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: From the producer's estate vineyard, the grapes planted on budwood from Napa Valley's famous Three Palms, this wine is bittersweet in tannin and flavor, a mix of blueberry, cedar, resin and clove. Full bodied in style, it maintains an elegance on the finish, marked irresistibly in dark chocolate.

properties.title: Mounts 2012 Estate Grown Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 3901 Wine Creek Rd, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: Cherry-vanilla surrounds a flank of big oak, while classic notes of baked strawberry also come into play. A brawny, full-bodied expression of the variety, given 6% Mourvèdre and 6% Syrah, it has good bones and acidity lurking beneath the power.

properties.title: Roco 2013 Gravel Road Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 13260 NE Red Hills Rd, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: Tight and tart, this entry-level bottling marries sharp fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry to a high-acid foundation. It's fruit-forward, perfect to gulp down with a favorite sandwich or football food.

properties.title: Roco 2013 The Stalker Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
properties.address: 13260 NE Red Hills Rd, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
properties.descrption: This new cuvée takes its name from the fermentation practice of mixing whole berries with grape-cluster stalks—just stalks, not whole clusters. Herbs and pine needle flavors dominate brambly berry fruit. It's quite young and raw, and will benefit from further bottle age.

properties.title: Vivencias 2008 V Tempranillo (Vino de Calidad de Valtiendas)
properties.address: 7370 Lockport Pl Suite B, Lorton, VA 22079, USA
properties.descrption: This is not fresh or fruity; in fact, the nose is nutty and muddied, with a rough, angular mouthfeel and flavors of peanut, vanilla and leathery raspberry.

properties.title: Convento San Francisco 2008  Ribera del Duero
properties.address: C. Calvario, 22, 47300 Peñafiel, Valladolid, Spain
properties.descrption: This wine is not impressive in any way. It's tannic, abrasive and tastes stalky and weedy. The finish is rough and green, like rocks in the mouth.

properties.title: Sean Thackrey 2010 Cassiopeia Wentzel Vineyard Clone 667 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 660 Horseshoe Hill Rd, Bolinas, CA 94924, USA
properties.descrption: A very pretty expression of Sean Thackrey's Cassiopeia's clonal experimentation, gorgeously floral and well rounded, with bright, concentrated, lush flavors of cherry with a light layering of spice. Well integrated, it's a standout among standouts.

properties.title: Bonaccorsi 2010 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 47 W Division St, Chicago, IL 60610, USA
properties.descrption: Shows the ripe voluptuousness that this vineyard always brings to Pinot Noir, as well as near-perfect balance. So rich, so delicious, it's hard not to drink the whole bottle. Waves of raspberry and cherry preserves, date-nut bread, white pepper, brown sugar, vanilla and toast are wrapped in a silky texture, with gorgeous acidity and smooth tannins. Drink over the next six years.

properties.title: Black Kite 2010 River Turn Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 1200 American Way, Windsor, CA 95492, USA
properties.descrption: Wow. Black Kite's River Turn, one of of its three annual block designates, is invigoratingly inviting, a heady mix of floral cherry pie, bright, full and ripe with a balanced backbone of acidity and a gentle hint of gingerbread. This wine is ready to enjoy this second, but if you can help yourself, it'll also hold up for several years in the cellar and no matter when you decide to drink it, pair exquisitely with a range of deftly mannered food.

properties.title: Bonaccorsi 2010 Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 47 W Division St, Chicago, IL 60610, USA
properties.descrption: Astonishingly deep in flavor, offering an explosion of the ripest cherries and raspberries imaginable. Additional notes of toasty oak, brown sugar and cinnamon spice make this Pinot irresistible, while the acidity brings all the richness to life. Drink now–2016.

properties.title: Côte Bonneville 2006 DuBrul Vineyard Côte Bonneville Red (Yakima Valley)
properties.descrption: This is two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon and one-third Merlot, all sourced from the estate's DuBrul vineyard. It's drinking quite well, though clearly heading into secondary fruit flavors that reflect its ongoing maturation. Cherries, plums and cassis fruits mingle, along with silky, polished tannins. Though it can be cellared indefinitely, it may be at its most delicious drinking peak currently.

properties.title: Sean Thackrey 2010 Cassiopeia Wentzel Vineyard Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 660 Horseshoe Hill Rd, Bolinas, CA 94924, USA
properties.descrption: Ethereally light with delicate red cherry flavor, this Pinot is soft, complex and interesting, with a racy herbal streak lurking in the background. Think a ham-and-cheese quiche gingerly sprinkled with thyme and oregano. So distinctive, one wonders what grows near this particular set of vines on the Wentzel Vineyard.

properties.title: Monteviejo 2008 Lindaflor La Violeta Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: Clodomiro Silva, M5665BPA Vista Flores, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Much like the previous vintage of La Violeta, this is a fabulous Malbec with depth, density and power to spare. The bouquet yields marzipan, cola, fine leather, char and rich berry aromas. That sets up a palate with impeccable structure and huge flavors of beef jerky, mocha, black fruits and spice. The finish is massive and loaded, with licorice and mocha flavors. Drink now–2018. Only 100 cases made, with 50 imported into the U.S.

properties.title: Siduri 2011 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
properties.address: 235 Healdsburg Ave, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: The pedigree of this vineyard shows in every aspect. It's not just the ripe black cherry and pomegranate fruit, or the brisk acidity, or the lush, gorgeous tannin structure. It's the incredible complexity, showing all kinds of mushroom,  cola, smoked meat and spice notes. Simply gorgeous now, and should develop over the next 10 years.

properties.title: Bonaccorsi 2010 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
properties.address: 47 W Division St, Chicago, IL 60610, USA
properties.descrption: Making Pinot Noir this sensually delicious is only half the effort. The challenge is to provide balance. Winemaker Jenne Lee Bonaccorsi succeeds wildly with this wine. The vineyard is planted entirely with the Dijon clone 115, and the wine shows the purest raspberry and cherry fruit—focused and intense. Yet there are all sorts of earthy, mushroomy, oaky complexities. Gorgeous now, and will hold for at least six years.

properties.title: Château Lagrézette 2009 Le Pigeonnier Malbec (Cahors)
properties.descrption: A small vineyard of six acres is used to produce this magnificent incarnation of Malbec. Black as ink and firmly tannic, a toughness magnified by new wood, this is still a richly fruity wine that will age superbly to give power and complexity. Keep for at least four years.

properties.title: Black Kite 2010 Stony Terrace Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
properties.address: 1200 American Way, Windsor, CA 95492, USA
properties.descrption: More subtle at first than the 2010 River Turn, Stony Terrace, another of Black Kite's yearly single-block designates, is earthy, savory and dense. Mouth filling in its juicy red and blue fruit flavor, it's silky and entirely seductive. Well integrated and structured, it's another fine choice for the table and for cellaring another 5–7 years.

properties.title: Avennia 2010 Gravura Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
properties.address: 19255 Woodinville Snohomish Rd #1, Woodinville, WA 98072, USA
properties.descrption: The name pays homage to the Graves region of Bordeaux, and the blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc also mimics those wines. Here the grapes are sourced from the Red Willow (Yakima Valley), Bacchus (Columbia Basin) and Klipsun (Red Mountain) vineyards. Supple, with beautifully integrated red fruits, and tannins as soft as a kiss, it's masterful winemaking from Chris Peterson, who tended the wines of DeLille for many years.

properties.title: Tapiz 2008 Black Tears Malbec (Mendoza)
properties.address: RP15, Agrelo, Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza, Argentina
properties.descrption: Until now, Tapiz has been a value-driven brand with no wine priced above $20. This outstanding Malbec shows that they've been holding something back. Black Tears is ripe and handsome, with almost everything in its perfect place. It's a hard-driving wine with blackberry, vanilla and coconut aromas and flavors in front of a chewy, tannin-rich finish with the mildest note of raisin. Drink this unbridled stud now through 2017.

properties.title: Donum 2010 East Slope Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
properties.address: 24500 Ramal Rd, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA
properties.descrption: Here's a complex young wine, vastly ripe and expressive, yet with the balance to age. Marked by a squeeze of citrusy acidity, it's rich in cherry pie flavors that are wrapped into softly firm tannins. There's a touch of beetroot that gives it an earthy complexity. A very interesting example of Carneros that should improve for 5–6 years, if not longer.

properties.title: Easton 2010 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
properties.address: 1247 Simon Blvd Suite N103, Easton, PA 18042, USA
properties.descrption: Edgy with mountainous berry flavor, Easton's 2010 Shenandoah Valley Zin is full-bodied, generous in savory spices and blackberry flavor and intoxicatingly aromatic with a peppery, leathery finish. It's structurally able to withstand many more years in bottle, so enjoy it now or give it some time. Either way, it'll shine poured alongside peppery meat.

properties.title: Bernard Baudry 2010 Le Clos Guillot  (Chinon)
properties.descrption: A chalk soil vineyard gives this very mineral interpretation of Loire Cabernet Franc. It has richness, weight, solid, ageworthy tannins as well as juicy red fruits. Dried fruits and just a hint of herbal acidity add complexity to a wine that is still young. Age for 5–6 years.

properties.title: Bernard Baudry 2010 Les Grézeaux  (Chinon)
properties.descrption: From clay and silex soil at the foot of the hill behind the Baudry house, this solid, richly fruity wine brings out both concentrated tannins and opulent, red berry flavors. Showing the great potential structure from old vines, this is a wine for aging over at least six years.

properties.title: Bonaccorsi 2010 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
properties.address: 47 W Division St, Chicago, IL 60610, USA
properties.descrption: A terrific Pinot, wonderful for drinking now, and should develop some bottle complexity over the next 5–6 years. Really shows off that flashy Bien Nacido character, offering wildly rich cherry and persimmon flavors, balanced with brisk acidity and a dusting of fuzzy tannins.

properties.title: Seghesio 2010 Cortina Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
properties.address: 700 Grove St, Healdsburg, CA 95448, USA
properties.descrption: As always, Seghesio's Cortina is a rich, complex Zinfandel.
